eventsByFilter.name: TransVision
eventsByFilter.description:
TransVision is a fierce and fabulous club night centred around making
space for people within the trans/non-binary/intersex community. The
night is brought to you by Lucia Blayke, the founder of London Trans+
Pride and features a rotating cast of your fave trans and NB DJs! Cis
allies are welcome but are asked to be respectful and considerate.
Expect wild performances, DJ sets and fundraising for different trans
charities. It is important now more than ever that trans people feel
embraced and loved, so come on down and celebrate the resilience and
beauty of our special little community. £6 ENTRY Door Policy Dalston
Superstore is a queer space. We prioritise our LGBTQIA+ customers and
will sometimes ask our straight & cis allies to support us by not taking
up room in our venue. Please be conscious of who this space is intended
for and be respectful. Never assume sexuality or gender identity. We
will never ask personal questions on the door. Low/no income access We
reserve limited spaces for those who cannot afford the standard ticket
price due to being on low or no income. Please
email hello@dalstonsuperstore.com to enquire. Full venue access info is
available here

eventsByFilter.name: SlutEra 2.0
eventsByFilter.description:
[GET TICKETS HERE !! ][1]



**Due to absolutely overwhelming demand, SlutEra is back for a second
round!**

Theme is HOUSE OF FUN - slutty clowns, party hats, clashing colours!

 

Can\'t make it but want to donate to the cause? Check out our
CrowdJustice page!:

https://www.crowdjustice.com/case/babes4justice/

 

Shows & music by…

MADDIE

MYNXIE

HELLIKISTO

 

bikini wrestling! live strips! party games! prizes!

 

Members of the sex worker branch of United Voices of the World
grassroots trade union are currently fighting a legal battle with a
major adult entertainment company. Claims include breaching of
contracts, data protection and GDPR violations, disregard for worker\'s
rights and a general failure to provide a safe, fair, respectful working
environment. We are being represented by excellent lawyers with social
justice experience, and are raising money to cover the costs of a
mediation. We are fighting for compensation for the affected workers,
plus changes in the company\'s business procedures to ensure that
current and future workers aren\'t subject to the same exploitative
practices. All proceeds from the night will go directly to the legal
fees!

 

**Expect SLUTTY POP, STRIPPER CLASSICS and QUEER BANGERS til late, with
live dances from our resident babes!**

Tickets are £8 in advance, £10 OTD.

Doors are at 10pm!

 

VFD is a queer venue with zero tolerance for discrimination. Our event
is queer & female run, trans inclusive, and operates on a strong
basis of consent & respect. Any unwanted touching, comments or
otherwise poor behaviour towards our dancers, DJs, or any of our
attendees will not be tolerated. If someone is making you feel
uncomfortable, grab a member of the team and we will deal with it.

 

The venue is a basement accessed by 12 stairs with a single bannister.
There are no other stairs in the venue and toilets are gender neutral.
Please let us know in advance if there\'s anything we can do to help
your night go smoothly, and we\'ll do our best!



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/12143/slutera-20-a-fundraiser-for-s3x-worker-justice

eventsByFilter.name: Afro-Cuban Music Night
eventsByFilter.description: This event is free - just turn up ! **We’re back on Monday nights!**  The Afro-Cuban Music Night is an evening of drum, song and dance from batá and orisha music to rumba. It is an informal gathering where musicians, music lovers, dancers and those who would like to learn to dance can participate. PLEASE NOTE this is not an audience/performance type event, all those who attend are encouraged to take part in some small or large way depending on their experience of the traditions –this could include anything from hand clapping, singing choruses, dancing, drumming or leading the songs. **Open Batá and Rumba Session: 20:30 -11.30 FREE!** Percussionists and singers familiar with these traditions are invited to come and play. We begin by playing for the orichas with batá music followed by a rumba. We have been honoured to be joined by some of the legends from the batá and rumba Cuban traditions including [Luanda Pau][1], [**Gerardo De Armas,**][2]** **[**Martica Gallaraga**][3], [**Yosvani Diaz**][4] and former Conjuncto Folklorico Nacional de Cuba member **Antonio Urdaneta Castro**. We are very grateful to the many UK based percussionists who also support this night and make it possible.  **IMPORTANT: Please drink up** We have worked hard to try and keep this event free (obviously apart from the dance class). This is only possible if people consume drinks at the bar, so please support the event by buying drinks of some kind; they don’t have to be alcoholic [1]: http://www.bomboproductions.com/team_member/luanda-pau/ [2]: http://www.bomboproductions.com/?team_member=gerardo-de-armas-sarria [3]: https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martha_Galarraga_%22Martica%22 [4]: http://eme.k63.top/

eventsByFilter.name: Releasing Your Masculine Voice For FTM\'s
eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*Wednesday March 8th 2023\*\*  
\*\*18.00 – 19.00, London UK (GMT)\*\*  
\*\*Live Zoom Webinar\*\*

\*\*Calling all FTM\'s who want to vocally sound better.\*\*

In this webinar we will hear from trans vocal coaching expert Stephen
Davidson, Director of the London Transgender Choir on how to lower your
voice and sound more male.

This is the second webinar in a series of four given by Stephen. This
webinar focuses on the voices of female to male trans folks.  
While the voice does change on Testosterone, an FTM’s vocal range does
not always achieve the same sound, range, volume or resonance as a
cis-males. This webinar will show you how you too can improve your vocal
range and sound and pass convincingly.

With years of vocal training expertise, Stephen will give you his best
tips and tricks to sound male. He will explain the mechanics of the
voice and will help you understand the vocal ranges, how to breath and
will give you simple techniques and exercises to help you speak in the
lower range of your voice. It’s about getting the maximum results. This
session is going to be filled with practical advice that anyone can
implement.

\*\*Bonus:\*\* Stephen will also be on hand to answer your questions
live and make sure that you have a path forward.

\### Who is this for:

This is an all-inclusive webinar, and you are welcome to join whether
you are trans, you know someone who is trans, or you are just interested
in the topic. We want to create an environment where learning and
sharing is not just possible but encouraged.

\### \*\*Register Now To Secure Your Place\*\*

\### \*\*About Stephen Davidson\*\*

Stephen is a voice coach for trans, non-binary, and gender
non-conforming people, and is a trans man himself. He has studied voice
widely, including with Alexandros Constansis and Kate Hammett Vaughn,
and as part of his actor training. He has taught voice for trans folks
with the Speech and Language Therapy department at the Tavistock and
Portman Gender Clinic, and is now teaching privately.  
Stephen has been an active musician for twenty years. He holds a BMus
(Performance) from the University of British Columbia and an Mmus (Solo
Performance) from McGill University. Stephen has performed with the
Vancouver Symphony Orchestra, Vancouver Miniaturist Ensemble, Designs in
Harmony Orchestra, Letter Four Quartet and behind open doors arts
collective.

\### Sign Up Now To Secure Your Place

\*\*We will have to limit numbers to make sure that we can host the
event properly, so please RSVP now to avoid disappointment.\*\*
eventsByFilter.summary: Releasing Your Masculine Voice For FTM\'s

eventsByFilter.name: t’ARTopia
eventsByFilter.description:
[Get tickets here !!][1]



Join us in t’ARTopia for a queer-curated night of drag, comedy, words,
cabaret and music from some of our most delicious t’ART’s.

We have invited some of the wonderful contributors to t’ART plus some of
our favourite performers to entertain you all, at a night that will be
nothing short of t’ARTopian.

We will be raising money for gender affirming surgery funds with this
evening&#39;s raffle, so come with a couple of quid, win art and
raise money for good causes!

**Performers:**

Pre-T Boy - Drag

PRE-T BOY is a fruity gender confused Belieber with a penchant for
pretty twinks and astrology. They were a finalist for Season 1 of Top of
the Slops drag competition.

Pre-T Boy is everyone’s favourite Y2K thembo boyfriend <3

Insta: [@prettyboy\_spice][2]

Boom Boom Raccoon - Music Trio

Boom Boom Racoon are an all queer, anarcho-acoustic, ska punk trio from
Bristol. They love singing about everything from biscuit factory heists
to social justice rants and describe their style as 80% politics, 30%
nonsense!

Insta: [@boomboomracoon][3]

Sarah Sakeena Martin - Spoken Word Poet

Sarah Sakeena Martin is a 37 year old mother of 3 from South London.
Sarah is a spoken word poet and creative entrepreneur. She’s also a gym
enthusiast that uses social media to inspire others to live a healthier,
holistic lifestyle.

Insta: [@creative\_sakeena][4]

TWATU - Drag Duo

We’re the ex-boyfriends of your dreams and we’re always right —
Wikipedia bros with toxic oat latte energy and the softest mullets. We
sing to Fleetwood Mac and never call you back. We want to be with you
everywhere, and we mean EVERYWHERE. We’re the TWATU you’ll never regret.

Insta: [@twatu\_drag][5]

Shivani Dave - Comedy

Shivani Dave (they/ them) is a journalist and broadcaster, specializing
in LGBTQ+ news, culture, and history. They occasionally dabble in comedy
and have to say that the opinions stated in their jokes are not that of
their employer.

@day\_vey

Daniele Zurbruegg - Poetry

Daniele Zurbruegg (he/him) is researching and writing about the queer
and the end of the world. He’s written stories for Untitled: Voices and
Sentience Lit Mag.

Twitter: [@cute\_dan\_milo][6]



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/12281/tartopia
[2]: https://www.instagram.com/prettyboy_spice/
[3]: https://www.instagram.com/boomboomracoon/
[4]: https://www.instagram.com/creative_sakeena/
[5]: https://www.instagram.com/twatu_drag/
[6]: https://twitter.com/cute_dan_milo

eventsByFilter.name: Spectrum
eventsByFilter.description:
Spectrum is a neurodiverse led event focused on protecting people on all
forms of spectrums, from unforgiving nightlife spaces. This includes
neurodiverse people, queer people of all presentations and anyone else
who feels as though the queer scene has made them feel othered. Spectrum
features all the music you missed since techno took over and all the
faces you don’t wanna miss! £8 before 11 / £10 after

+++ Dalston Superstore welcomes you to arrive with your whole self, with
the assurance that the team is doing the best they can to hold space for
whatever you may bring.

We have a dedicated welfare worker present on the night who is there for
you – check in with them when you arrive, or at any point during the
night if there’s anything you’d like to share with them, whether a
moment of celebration or a need for something to feel different. They’re
trained to share that with you! Any of the bar team can help you find
them on the night, and you can also get in touch beforehand on
welfare@dalstonsuperatore.com.

Dalston Superstore is on a sharp learning curve when it comes to serving
the neurodiverse community, but we’re learning fast and with huge
enthusiasm! Dalston Superstore is a loud, stimulating space and due to
the physical limitations of the venue, a designated chill-out space will
not be available. However, should you feel overwhelmed the welfare team
will be on hand to help you in any way they can! +++

Door Policy Dalston Superstore is a queer space. We prioritise our
LGBTQIA+ customers and will sometimes ask our straight & cis allies to
support us by not taking up room in our venue. Please be conscious of
who this space is intended for and be respectful. Never assume sexuality
or gender identity. We will never ask personal questions on the door.

Low/no income access We reserve limited spaces for those who cannot
afford the standard ticket price due to being on low or no income.
Please email hello@dalstonsuperstore.com to enquire.

Full venue access info is available here

eventsByFilter.name: Femmme Fraiche Spring Fling
eventsByFilter.description:
Spring is springing and our fave lezzy bash Femmme Fraiche are having a
fling on March 11th at the mothership! We’ve got a gorgey line-up packed
full of our faves… downstairs, we have Lishy warming up the basement,
whose sets for us last summer at Secret Garden Party and Body Movements
were nothing short of delicious, so we’ve invited her for her basement
debut with us. Lishy will be followed by our resident / promoter
Michelle Manetti plus a secret guest headliner ??? – the Canadian Born
DJ is known for known for her dynamic journeys through techno, house,
acid and UK rave, all will be revealed. Upstairs, we have the return of
our fave East London rave huns Rita Lin and Victoria Peckham aka UOKHUN
going hun2hun on the decks with all your fave slaggy bangers. We also
welcome back the colourful powerhouse Thempress and our very own duo of
Fraîchness residents Linzi Symons and Darren Skene on ?2 ? duties with
your trash-tastic guilty pleasures. We also welcome the legendary QHP
host and gorgeous fluid fairy Taali Not Charlie for their Femmme Fraiche
debut alongside a firm FF fave the goddess Novaya on gogo duties. £8
before 11 / £10 after

*We operate a zero tolerance policy* Our event is aimed as a space for
queer wxmn, trans, and non binary folx, although allies and friends are
welcome providing they respect the space.

Back by overwhelming demand, it’s SLVT ERA – VERSION 3.0! This time
we’re the SAPPHIC SLVTS FROM HELL!! Theme is demon babes, mommy Satan,
flames of hell, sexy sinners – so dress to impress! As always we’ll have
live strip shows and the sluttiest tunes, with our infamous sexy instax
photos for sale and all proceeds from the night going directly into the
Babes4Justice fundraiser! Members of the sex worker branch of United
Voices of the World grassroots trade union are currently fighting a
legal battle with a major adult entertainment company. Claims include
breaching of contracts, data protection and GDPR violations, disregard
for worker’s rights and a general failure to provide a safe, fair,
respectful working environment. We are being represented by excellent
lawyers with social justice experience, and are raising money to cover
the costs of a mediation. We are fighting for compensation for the
affected workers, plus changes in the company’s business procedures to
ensure that current and future workers aren’t subject to the same
exploitative practices. All proceeds from the night will go directly to
the legal fees! Can’t make it but want to donate to the cause? Check out
our CrowdJustice page!: https://www.crowdjustice.com/case/babes4justice/
Suggested donation £10

eventsByFilter.name: One More Time: 1995
eventsByFilter.description:
[GET TICKETS HERE !! ][1]



One More Time heads all the way to 1995! It\'s the year that kicks off
our decade of pop! Grunge was out and pop was back in. A new wave of pop
acts shared 1995\'s charts with stalwarts Janet Jackson, Celine Dion,
Cher, Madonna, Mariah Carey, Annie Lennox and Eternal. Boybands ruled
with Take That, East 17, Boyzone, Let Loose and PJ & Duncan all over
the charts.

But the big story of 1995 wasn\'t Britpop (despite what the history
books said)… it was the year of the dance banger. The Top 10 was filled
with dance hits by N-Trance, Everything But The Girl, The Outhere
Brothers, Alex Party, Livin\' Joy, Bobby Brown, Rednex, Strike, Nicki
French, Berri, Grace, Scatman John, The Original, Whigfield, M People,
Corona, Billie Ray Martin, De\'Lacy, Donna Summer, Real McCoy, Baby D,
Clock, Nightcrawlers, Perfecto Allstars, Bucketheads, JX, Felix, D:ream,
Happy Clappers, Jinny, 20 Fingers and Jam & Spoon. Whew - what a
list!

We’ll be playing the A list popstars from 1995 along with B listers like
Deuce, MN8 and the Human League along with loads of other pop and dance
hits from 1995. Expect loads of forgotten gems you\'re unlikely to hear
anywhere else (from Zig & Zag and Sean Maguire to the Childliners
and Michelle Gayle). Our Bargain Bin first hour of 1995’s pop flops
(from Mary Kiani and Diva to Optimystic) kicks the night off from 9pm.

We will be also joined by the fabulous [@Karmaisadrag][2] for an
amazingly ridiculous performance. Tickets sold out last time, so grab
yours now!



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/12332/one-more-time-1995
[2]: https://www.instagram.com/karmaisadrag/?hl=en

*-*

 

***About ***

 

On February 26th 2022, VFD collaborated with Hackney 365 to bring
together a walking tour of Hackney presented by Lavinia Co-op. 

 

The tour was recorded and edited together so we can share this glimpse
of life from our local history for those unable to attend. 

 

Lavinia has lived most of his life in Hackney and was a member of the
radical queer theatre group The Bloolips from the 1970\'s to 1990\'s.

eventsByFilter.name: Sleaze Dreams presents: SKINS
eventsByFilter.description:
[get tickets here !! ][1]



**Sleaze Dreams Presents :**



SKINS 📹🔞



QTBIPOC CENTRED ❤️‍🔥



Remember the messy lives of teenagers on tv that we couldn’t quite get
enough of? The TV show ‘Skins’ was a shift in pop culture in the 00’s
& 10’s when it arrived on TV. A mish mash of colours, indie/electro
music, teen angst and storylines that took twists and turns. Despite
some of its controversial paths, Skins gave us a view of adolescence
that most somewhat connected with and so it forever left a footprint on
our youth. 

 

Indie Sleaze, Indie Electo, NuRave! 

THINK ‘SKINS HOUSE PARTY’🪅

 🎧🔥DJ LINEUP - 



[@takenbymarshall ][2]

[@deejaypri ][3]

[@jaybd\_\_ ][4]

 

🗓️ 24/03/23

Whether you were Gen 1, 2 or 3 of the Skins Generation, this night is
for the QTBIPOC party goers, the indie sleaze boppers and the youth that
said “fuck this” to the people who said they couldn’t be who they wanted
to be. 2007 called and said “Get your tickets now!”

eventsByFilter.name: Pumping Velvet
eventsByFilter.description:
As the vernal (no, not venereal) equinox looms it can only mean one
thing. Yassss, spring hath sprung! And what better way to celebrate than
by pumping some velvet? PUMPING VELVET is back with an evening of
ecstatic fertility rituals to mark the changing of the seasons. Leading
the charge downstairs is the magnificent DEBONAIR, og NTS host and
mistress of scruffy EBM, post-punk echo and the most judiciously
selected party jams. Her unmissable NTS show has marked her out as
having an encyclopedic knowledge of sonic ephemera but she’s also an
incendiary club DJ, as her boiler room appearance will attest! Joining
DEBONAIR downstairs will be livwutang, travelling all the way from NYC!
livwutang is part of the enthralling grassroots american underground,
whose sound can’t be contained to one particular style or genre – she
instead delivers a distinctly eclectic array of exuberant kinetics and
chaotic dexterity to any dancefloor she’s a part of. Just check out
Dekmantel podcast for receipts of what she can deliver. Soundtracking
the best go-go dancers in the business we have house maestro Liam, one
half of the duo behind South East London’s Handclap party (who’s recent
mix for PV had us grooving), PV resident Sofie K, and the mysterious DJ
Set, who promises an uptempo mix of pop garage and bassline. If only we
could split ourselves in two to enjoy all this wondrous music
simultaneously! £7 BEFORE 11 / £10 AFTER

eventsByFilter.name: The Woke Brigade: Lest We Faguette All Day Party
eventsByFilter.description:
COO-EEE!! Cavalry calling!! To celebrate the launch of the Woke Brigade,
the UK’s most Anti-Drag Drag collective, we’re bringing you a 14 hour
party at Dalston Superstore. Yes, you read that right: FOURTEEN HOURS OF
STINKING HOT NONSENSE ? We start with a Fabulously Woke Brunch hosted by
Commanders-In-Chief Vanilla Parker Balls and The Doll Named Dan from
12:00 until 17:00 (book here). Then, from 18:00 until 20:00, you’ll be
treated to a Cabaret Spectacular, featuring some top tier agenda-pushing
performances from Don One, Donna the First, Dairy King, Die Lemma and
Barbs (tickets available here). Finally, to seal the indoctrination
deal, we’ll be partying the night away from 09:00-02:30 at our Brigadier
Conference Party! With all this silly entertainment, you’re sure to get
your fill of lefty woke nonsense! Commanders-in-Chief Vanilla Parker
Balls and The Doll Named Dan, and all of your favourite Woke Brigadiers
will be there to forcibly… *ahem* we mean… peacefully integrate their
Woke Agenda on you all. BRUNCH BOOKINGS FREE VARIETY SHOW CABARET
TICKETS £10

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents BUT I\'M A CHEERLEADER (1999)
eventsByFilter.description:
For the closing night of her residency at Transmissions, Nat Funni
graces us with another selection straight from her DVD shelf to our
screen. What do you get when you combine lesbian director Jamie Babbit,
queer icons Natasha Lyonne and Clea DuVall, and sprinkle in a
performance from (brace yourselves) RuPaul as a counsellor at a camp
full of gay teens being forced to straighten out? Well, of course you
get the undisputed classic But I’m A Cheerleader (1999). Join us in our
basement home at Dalston Superstore for this warm and funny essential of
queer cinema. “Oh my god… they were right. I’m a homo” Subtitles will be
displayed throughout. Seating is a mixture of benches, backed chairs,
bar stools, and floor space, and is first come first served. Free
tickets and donor options available via OutSavvy

eventsByFilter.name: Hunni Sound Sound Academy: Sound for Visual Media with Kiimi
eventsByFilter.description:
Hunni Sound is a collective and entity aimed at building the community
amongst women, non-binary and trans people involved or looking to get
involved in music and sound production. After running a number of highly
successful social events over the last couple of years, Hunni Sound
announces their biggest project yet a series of monthly workshops aimed
at sharing knowledge amongst the community and networking. Each workshop
features a special guest who will impart knowledge on their specialised
facet of the industry.

29/03/23 Kiimi \[Hotflush / Three Six Zero\] Kiimi is an electronic
music producer and DJ, but they also compose music and sound for visual
media. In this workshop, Kiimi will take the audience through a past
brief, outlining their process and highlighting key points of interest
within the production. This will be followed by a Q&A and networking
hour. This is an 18+ event

eventsByFilter.name: Art Is Coming x VFDalston
eventsByFilter.description:
[GET TICKETS HERE !! ][1]



The exhibition is an act of protest to current affairs involving
Conservative Britain and  
Capitalism, suggesting ways in which we can enter a brighter and hopeful
future. Each artist  
submitting work will have their own take on society now and what their
own utopia is.

There will be artists showing their prints, multiple DJs, a fashion show
and an Art is Coming  
zine too.

This is a non profit event aiming to uplift artists from different
communities and  
backgrounds. With all proceeds being donated to Mermaids, a charity
supporting  
transgender and non-binary youth.

eventsByFilter.description:
[GET TICKETS HERE !!][1]



We exist because we dream and the best way to dream is by dancing to
dreamy tunes.

We, Felixir and Martha Barbra will be from start to finish,
side-by-side, ass-to-ass, sometimes on the dancefloor but most of the
time together on the decks.

You bring your curves, your footwork, your loved one and your memories;
we promise to bring the most devilishly fabulous and mysteriously erotic
records of Electro-Disco, Electro-Pop and Italo Disco.

Your drag host of the night the cypriot non-binary heartthrob,
they-queen, the overly sweet muse of Harem of No One: Tahini Molasses;
and who knows what performance they have in store for us! 

This one\'s for the huggers, the believers and of course the dreamy ones
! Let\'s meet under the motherly roof of VFD Dalston, Friday 31st March,
no warm-up, we start at 10pm and go dancing and dreaming until 3am.





[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/12451/dreamy-vfd

eventsByFilter.name: Seize the means: Staff Trans Healthcare fundraiser
eventsByFilter.description:
SEIZE THE MEANS OF MEDICAL TRANSITION! Dalston Superstore presents our
annual staff tran healthcare fundraiser the Trans Day of Visibility,
with all proceeds going to Superstore staff gender affirming funds. We
need to relinquish the idea that visibility is positive in and of
itself. The hyper visibility that trans\* people have experienced in the
past decade has left us increasingly vulnerable to violence from both
the public and the government while continuously being neglected by
social services, including the NHS. The increased exposure of trans\*
people has not improved our access to gender affirming health care.
Rather, we are left hanging with an expected waiting time of more than
five years for an initial appointment at the Gender Identity Clinic.
Fundraisers and privatised health care should not replace the public
healthcare system but for most trans\* people, this is currently our
only option. Thus, health care becomes a matter of proximity to
privilege. We as trans\* people should get to define for ourselves
whether and how we choose to transition medicially, legally and
socially. On this Trans Day of In/visibility, we encourage you to seize
the means of medical transition to redistribute resources, including but
not limited to money, HRT, and knowledge. In an attempt to? do so,
Dalston Superstore is throwing a fundraising party to support gender
affirming health care for the staff of Dalston Superstore. This party
centres trans\* people, medicalised and otherwise.

We present a night of wall-to-wall trans excellence in support of our
trans\* staff members. In the basement
@fotu.tv @sadqueersclub and @dragmelle will be slinging house,
breakbeat, electro and techno heaters,
with @mascqueline @karliemarx.wav and @*rodent\_\_ serving silly pop
edits in the bar. ? The fabulous @motherlorimae will be your host for
the evening, with gogo action from T4T
babes @abstractkid* and @prinxsilver. We’ll be taking donations on the
door and inside all night, come open your hearts and wallets in support
of trans\* healthcare. Suggested donation £8 before 11 / £10 after

dishing up a smorgasbord of games, quizzes, shows and prizes every
Saturday and Sunday from 12-5pm. This February LIPSYNC1000 winner PMBC
is back at the mothership with special guest Alice Cockayne, serving
camp comedy, unhinged shows and unadulterated nonsense! FREE TO BOOK
eventsByFilter.summary: Drag Brunch with PMBC and Alice Cockayne!

eventsByFilter.name: Club Tantrum
eventsByFilter.description:
That’s right baby! Your favourite bratty bottoms Club Tantrum are back
at the mothership for our April Fool’s Day lol-cano edition! We’re going
hard ‘n’ fast in the basement with special guests Carlo and Selma all
the way from Copenhagen! Co-Founders and residents at the bi-monthly
series of therapeutic dancing sessions Group Therapy Carlo & Selma is a
Scandi-Latino duo delivering untamed flows of energy, propulsive
buildups and exhilarating morning rides. Dynamic and genre fluid, they
bring together a feisty mix of old-school stomping grooves, chopped-up
breaks, trance and disco oddities sprinkled with bouncy 90s gems primed
for ecstatic workouts and bold galactic excursions. All backed with
feel-good gay anthems. Warming up the basement with heady house, acid,
breakbeat and techno are Tanty residents Super Drama and Milk Shandy. On
the top deck it’s all killer no filler queer anthems from speshy
guests Faye and Mica Coca. PLUS we’ve got twirly girlies Sophie
Brain, Cherry and Super Mary Hoe serving bar top sl\*t drops all damn
night! Get your tickies now to guarantee entry babes, link in bio!
PRESALES: EARLYBIRD £8  GENERAL ADMISSION £10 SECURE THE BAG – TICKET
PLUS EXCLUSIVE LIMITED EDITION CLUB TANTRUM TOTE £15 OTD: £8 before 11 /
£10 after

eventsByFilter.description:
TransVision is a fierce and fabulous club night centred around making
space for people within the trans/non-binary/intersex community. The
night is brought to you by Lucia Blayke, the founder of London Trans+
Pride and features a rotating cast of your fave trans and NB DJs! Cis
allies are welcome but are asked to be respectful and considerate.
Expect wild performances, DJ sets and fundraising for different trans
charities. It is important now more than ever that trans people feel
embraced and loved, so come on down and celebrate the resilience and
beauty of our special little community. £6 ENTRY Door Policy Dalston

Hunni Sound Sound Academy: Radio Presenting and Production w/ Jess
Iszatt
eventsByFilter.description:
Hunni Sound is a collective and entity aimed at building the community
amongst women, non-binary and trans people involved or looking to get
involved in music and sound production. After running a number of highly
successful social events over the last couple of years, Hunni Sound
announces their biggest project yet a series of monthly workshops aimed
at sharing knowledge amongst the community and networking. Each workshop
features a special guest who will impart knowledge on their specialised
facet of the industry.

19/04/23 Jess Iszatt \[BBC London / BBC Radio 1\] Jess Iszatt is a radio
presenter and DJ, most known for her work on BBC London and BBC Radio 1.
This workshop will take on the form of a live interview with Jess,
followed by a Q&A and networking hour. This is an 18+ event

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Compost Club + Foraging Walk!
eventsByFilter.description: If you\'re an LGBTIQ+ person aged 18-25 in Hackney, join Young Rotters for three Saturdays in Spring, to go on a foraging walk with a twist, not only will we meet plants and funghi, we will then get to help make delicious compost for them! On 18th Feb, 18th March and 22nd April, w﻿e will meet at the Hackney Community Tree Nursery at 11, and set off round the marshes for an hour and a half foraging walk with mushroom nerd Susy (@queer.as.funghi.) We\'ll then return for a homecooked vegan lunch from vegan chef Jess (@Palamos\_plant\_kitchen) before turning the compost at the tree nursery. We\'ll discuss why turning the compost is so important, and spend time getting to know all the rotters that help turn our food waste and garden cuttings back into soil. W﻿e encourage you to come to all three workshops - 18th Feb, 18th March and 22nd April! Get in touch by emailing [youngrotters@gmail.com](mailto:youngrotters@gmail.com) or messaging on [insta][1] if you have any questions or need any information about accessibility. Book tickets here and then please fill out our sign up form to help us with keeping it free. Y﻿oung Rotters is a new project that works to connect local people to the ecologies around them, in a way that centres stewardship and reciprocity. This is our first public project - QUEER COMPOST CLUB - and woah we\'re excited! It\'s aimed at LGBTIQ+ people aged 18-25 in Hackney! [1]: http://instagram.com/youngrotters

eventsByFilter.name: Xuukiworld
eventsByFilter.description:
Live Performers

Le Poodle

Le Poodle is an experimental pop artist, producer, and composer from
Miami. Over the last year she has released an EP, worked on several film
scores, and did sound design for a dance performance at the Perez Art
Museum Miami. Her last major performance was at IIIPoints in Miami. She
has been working on a visual experience project with an architect and
designer that she intends on performing in March during Miami Music
Week. She will be flying overseas to perform in London and Berlin this
May for the first time as a solo artist.

Middle Act:

Louis Jack

Louis Jack is an alternative hip-hop artist, producer, and rapper who’s
unflinchingly honest and baritone-delivered lyrics are at the forefront
of his textured and evocative self-production. His dedication to the
process enables listeners to peer into the soul of the man himself -
intelligent, heartfelt, and without doubt entirely unique.

First Act:

Ratiba Ayadi ft. Silent Songstress

Ratiba Ayadi is a composer, producer, sound, and performance artist. She
layer’s fragmented vocalisations over sonic landscapes and explore the
possibility of curating invisible structures. She performs and record as
an alias, Silent Songstress - an entity that can move through and
between studies of self, through vocal and physical inquiry.

DJs

Robbi

Robbi is an independent experimental artist, producer, and DJ. She
produces, composes, songwriters, sings and plays instruments with a
passion for creative expression. Her music has a soundscape feel that
engulfs you in an audio transformative experience. With an interest in
film and scoring, Robbi creates experimental videos that serve as an
accompaniment for you on her music journey. She has an upcoming release
of a track called ‘Not Sad’ written amidst a relationship with despair
and the optimism of moving forward. This single and video will be
released in an EP titled ‘Headspace’ by the end of this month.

Eclecticist

Born in Oxford, nurtured in Bristol and now residing in London.
Eclecticist began DJing before he even hit puberty. Harboured by his
Rastafarian father’s Reggae & Dub Soundsystem background and inheriting
his mish-mash of equipment. Recently crowned as one of the Priate
Studios Pirate Prodigies of 2019, and producing some of the biggest
radio shows in the country, Eclectisist keeps his ear firmly to the
ground and below. After almost 2 decades of honing his technical
ability.

This is an 18+ event

eventsByFilter.name:
A party for macho sluts and their 100 boyfriends, girlfriends and
significant fuckers!
eventsByFilter.description:
Testo Hunkie is a social event for the boys and their pals. Whether
you’re questioning, pre-T or passing come down from 7pm for a pie and a
chat. It's a place where you can meet people, exchange tips, ask the
'difficult' questions and find a new home for your old 'boi stuff*'*Feel
free to bring anything that can bring joy to another fella; books,
binders, handkerchiefs, packers etc.Prove your moves with our arm
wrestling competition. Or if you want to show off the guns without
working up a sweat, put yourself forward for our best dress display.
Theme of Testo Hunkie #3 BALLS &amp; NETS in honour of the
basketball tournament happening just before our party. From 10pm we’ll
have DJ’s to get you up and dancing to heavy bangers and smooth grooves
and things will be getting hot and heavy with our Hunks. Join us for
your new fav queer gathering on the 20th May. Pies and gossip:
7pm-10pmArm wrestling: 9pmDJ's: 10pm-1amFashion competition: 11pmChill
out space upstairs: 9pm-1am How to find us:Matchstick Piehouse 213-214
Edward PlLondonSE8 5HD Matchstick Piehouse is down a row of railway
arches. The closest stations are New Cross (overground and national
rail) and Deptford (national rail).We have an access fund for anyone who
needs to get a taxi from the station/ nearby. COVID’s still a thing.
Please keep on testing and stay home if you feel unwell. A sniffle isn't
cute on anyone. Testo Hunkie is an 18+ event. No tiny cameras and your
face on the big screen, but we might have to check your ID for licensing
reasons.Testo Hunkie is an inclusive, LGBTQ+ event. We’re here for the
celebration of all bodies and gender expressions. No excuses here.
Acceptance is the bare minimum, babe. Matchstick Piehouse is wheelchair
accessible across the ground floor. There is an accessible toilet
situated next to the bar.There are plenty of chairs around including
sofas and hard backed seats. The chill out space and balcony is up a set
of stairs. Lighting is low in the bar area, music will be loud and
lights will be bright and flickering.Matchstick Piehouse has a resident
cat, if you have allergies please let us know. Dogs are welcome for the
social from 7pm-10pm. Testo Hunkie is the dream of two trans fags. We’re
doing it DIY and raising some money for trans\* joy whilst we’re at it.
We’ll be raising money for gender-affirming fundraisers through ticket
sales and our Hunks will have card tip jars. Money will be distributed
to anyone who makes a request. Email us a link to your fundraising page
to testohunkie@gmail.com and we’ll donate a split of the money raised.
eventsByFilter.summary:
A party for macho sluts and their 100 boyfriends, girlfriends and
significant fuckers!

eventsByFilter.name: BodySwap
eventsByFilter.description:
Dalston Superstore’s new party BodySwap invites a new trans\* artist,
promoter, or organisation to curate a month of Wednesday night parties
at the venue. This is a space for trans\* power, rage, beauty,
resilience, and joy. BodySwap celebrates and platforms trans\* artists
from diverse backgrounds, while raising crucial funds for organisations
that support the community. Our May guest curator is Danni Spooner
(they/them). Danni is an autistic, nonbinary go-go dancer, model and
founder of trans+ magazine PlayThey. They’ve been sexy and silly on
Superstore bar many times for nights such as Fémmme Fraîche, Celestial
Bodies, Fussy and are so excited to curate trans talent for BodySwap!
Community care and uplifting is deeply embedded within their life. They
are overjoyed to be able to bring together trans angels for joy,
silliness, support, expression, celebration and development at BodySwap
this May. All door profits will be donated to a queer organisation or
fundraiser of the guest curator’s choosing. £7 ENTRY

Door Policy Dalston Superstore is a queer space. We prioritise our
LGBTQIA+ customers and will sometimes ask our straight & cis allies to
support us by not taking up room in our venue. Please be conscious of
who this space is intended for and be respectful. Never assume sexuality
or gender identity. We will never ask personal questions on the door.

Low/no income access We reserve limited spaces for those who cannot
afford the standard ticket price due to being on low or no income.
Please email hello@dalstonsuperstore.com to enquire.

Full venue access info is available here

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Noise @ VFD
eventsByFilter.description:
[ TICKETS HERE ][1] Queer Noise is back with another gorgeous evening of Queer Poetry, Music
and Performance!   
 

Join us on the 1st of June at our new home VFDalston for a
simultaneously silly and sensitive exploration of queer community,
identity and relationships. 

This event is raising money for Gender Confirmation Surgeries 

Doors 7pm 

Performances start 7.30pm 

kia Matanky-Becker 7.30 - 7.45pm 

Thea Mayeux 7.45 - 7.50

Lalah-Simone Springer 7.50 -  8.05pm 

 

Break 8.05 - 8.25pm

 

Grace Quigley 8.25 - 8.40pm 

Eden J Howells 8.40 - 8.55pm

Maria Rosenberg 8.55 - 9.15pm

 

Event Ends 9.30pm 

 

 

In addition to a packed line up of Poets and musicians the night will
also bring you stalls from some of the best queer craft makers and
artist. Expect gorgeously engraved carabiners, crochet creations and
sexy queer art prints. 

 

The Venue is on the basement floor and unfortunately there is no step
free access to this floor.

eventsByFilter.name: Funds 4 Turkey
eventsByFilter.description:
Join us for a fundraiser supporting queer and trans survivors of the
earthquakes that hit Turkey in February 2023. No warm-up. All proceeds
go to Lubunya Deprem and Kaf Kolektif. £7/£10/£12 – you choose. We’ll
see you there.

Akis Ka is a character, perhaps a monster, who wanders between the walls
of binary genders and even breaks those walls. She is an out of place,
and thanks to you, a timeless player. Istanbul-based singer, songwriter,
performance artist and DJ, Kübra Uzun is an LGBTQIA+ rights activist,
working in Turkey and also on an international basis on various
platforms. Kübra wrote, sang and produced the song titled ‘ALAN2020’
with Mx. Sür and it became an anthem during Istanbul Pride in June 2020
MUST was born in Istanbul and graduated from Mimar Sinan Fine Arts
University Textile Design. Kika has been a make-up artist since 2010. In
the last few years, they started to concentrate on stage works by using
their skills on make-up, textile and dance. KAAN is the musical alias of
London-based producer and curator Erkan Affan. He creates soundscapes
inspired by his Indigenous Arab-Armenian heritage and folk music from
Hatay province in southern Turkey, as well as by his upbringing in south
London and in clubs across the city. An essential member of London’s
eclectic Night Slugs camp, GIRL UNIT’s music is steeped in low-end
pressure but also reaches toward a classic timelessness time-honoured
elements of production sit seamlessly alongside the most contemporary
sounds, as Girl Unit densely layers radio gloss and big melodies over
beats that take influence from a variety of Club and Pop sources.”

Poster by @dirty\_projector

£7 CONCESSION / £10 GENERAL / £12 SOLIDARITY SUGGESTED DONATION

eventsByFilter.name: TE MANAWA
eventsByFilter.description:
[ TICKETS HERE ][1] ### ***VFD presents…***

### **  
TE MANAWA**

 

### **Māori Concept - The heart, a place of affection, tolerance and breath.**

Leaning into their Māori heritage [VFD][2] founder Lyall Hakaraia looks
to curate an event that embraces the concept of Te Manawa, creating a
space of shared love, joy and solidarity, a place to breathe with our
Femme X and QTBIPOC community.  
 

VFD presents a night of collective community empowerment as we celebrate
with RhyssPieces, Black Venus and Hot Brown Honey (on their only
scheduled London stop of their 2023 UK tour)!   
 

Our event falls on International Sex Workers Day and we will be
fundraising for the NHS outreach programme [*Open Doors*][3] and the
[*Josephine Butler Society*][4] who both support the health and well
being of street Sex Workers.

 

Important Info



Doors: 7pm

Performances Start: 7:30pm

eventsByFilter.description:
oestrogeneration is a magazine platform higlighting the voices of trans
women and transfeminine people in the uk – it was born out of anger in a
media climate where we were constantly spoken of, but never in charge of
our own narrative. we are now releasing our very first print issue
themed around tenacity, the magazine reflects on the inherent strengths
and consequent narratives that come with trans womanhood. after
our launch at atlas grinds, we’re throwing a party at dalston
superstore. all the way from glasgow, the iconic taahliah will be
murdering the basement dancefloor, alongside east london’s favourite
dj grace sands, multitalented it girl princess xixi and
oestrogeneration’s very own co-editor harietta. upstairs, the nation’s
favourite transexual lucia blayke will bring chaos and c\*nt, sexy
superstar trojan-tyne will trigger all our wild thoughts & kayodeine‘s
sound wizardry will hypnotise your feet. + the sluttiest bitches in
town, ella & elouiza, steaming up the bar w their dancing <3 gonna be an
unforgettable night of high-femme debauchery, glamour and tenacious
dancing.

eventsByFilter.name: June\'s Friendly Transgender Social Meetup London
eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*Are you Trans and want to meet other trans people in a safe and
social environment?\*\*

Join me and your fellow trans lovelies for a relaxed meetup on
\*\*Thursday June 8th at 19.30 in the Soho, central London area.\*\*

This place has a great buzz and we have our own private space booked!
It\'s a sneaky way to start the weekend early. Come and join us :)

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

We have a private area upstairs in the venue, which is plenty of space
for us all to chat, hear each other and relax.

Thursday is the new start of the weekend. Let\'s use this opportunity to
make some new friends and chat about whatever pleases you.

This event will suit you if you are new to attending the meetup or are
one of our wonderful regulars. It is a popular evening with lots of
different people popping in. There is no need to be nervous. We are all
very friendly and welcoming. You\'ll feel right at home. :)

\*\*What is this meetup?\*\*  
This is a relaxed, friendly and inclusive meetup for the trans people of
London. This is an opportunity to make new friends and chat over a
sneaky Thursday drink.

\*\*Who is it for?\*\*  
Everyone from the trans community is welcome. This is an opportunity to
be yourself, whatever you identify as. We are inclusive and happy to
welcome you.

\*\*How does it work?\*\*  
Your host Ray has booked a private area in a pub in the Soho area. All
you have to do is RSVP and then Ray will message you on the day with the
event location. Then, all you have to do is show up.

Ray will make sure that you meet some new people and get a chance to get
to know your fellow trans buddies. He is very friendly and will welcome
you and make sure you feel comfortable and happy.

It is free to attend, just buy yourself a drink at the bar.

\*\*Please Note:\*\* RSVP is a must as the location (based around Soho)
will be sent by email on the day to those who have RSVP\'d only. RSVP
closes at 16.00 on the day of the event.

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*
eventsByFilter.summary: June\'s Friendly Transgender Social Meetup London

Introducing **Virginia Woolf of Wall St** - London’s first capitalistic

I

bangers, while you yell about stocks on your MASSIVE mobile.

 

Expect; sweaty jostling on our trading (dance) floor; slick hair;
soaring margins; sapphism; insid(h)er trading; bail outs; pin stripes;

Encouraged; skirt suits, pantsuits, zoot suits, shoulder pads, bowler
hats, statement earrings, harsh make-up, genderfuck tailoring. We wanna
see you channeling your inner KenDoll Roy, Patrick BateHun and JP
Whxregan - so show us what you’ve got!

 

We are too big to fail! Come and bail us out.

eventsByFilter.name: Grief Revel
eventsByFilter.description: [ Tickets Here ][1] ### **Grief comes in many shapes and forms, it hits us in waves, catches us off guard. You may be mourning a loved one, old relationships, even a past self. As we transform, we often need a moment to catch our breaths. Enter Grief Revel, a one-off event brought to you by a collective of female/NB practising artists, facilitators, writers, and witches who invite you to gather for an evening of performance and healing at the wonderful VFD.  Join Fausta Joly, Reanna Valentine, Shiva Honey, and Renee Willoughby for spoken word, music, art and ritual. **   £10 Advance Tickets £12.00 OTD    Please DM [@jolylicks][2] on instagram if you are feeling the pinch but would still like to attend.   ### **Meet the space holders: **   **Fausta Joly** @fauifesto Poet and founder of Arts Events company, [Joly Licks][3] (founded 2018) brings their unique dreamscape of femme-centric and loving summonings in the form of her debut EP, *I’m A Giver* as an offering for Grief Revel. Her work has been featured at Zebra festival Berlin, HOME, Manchester and she’s performed at The Royal Albert Hall,(2020),  We Out Here Festival (21-22) and Brighton Fringe (2023). Co-Founder of Queer Performance festival [Fervor][4] - back Winter 2023   **Reanna Valentine ** [@reannavalentine ][5] Trauma poet keeping it light. Reanna recently released ‘Fragmented Light’, a joint collection with their grandmother Carolyn Reed, has been published in Ergi Press’s Loki anthology, and Muswell Press’s ‘Queer Life Queer Love: The Second Anthology’. In 2022, they were shortlisted for the Zealous Amplify creative prize and had a pamphlet longlisted for the Disabled Poets Prize. Reanna has performed widely and runs two poetry nights: [@QueerThe Mic ][6]and [@PoetryMeetQT.][7]   **Renee Willoughby** [@\_renalien\_][8] Renee is an interdisciplinary artist from Detroit working within themes of collage, ghosts + telematics. She recently released a tape through the label Irritable Tentant titled ‘Her Shape is Light’ exploring the relationship with her mother, who passed away when she was 3. She is a resident video jockey for queer femme DJ night in Detroit called Femmedom, works as an Art Advisor for PASC, an arts studio supporting artists with disabilities, and lives in an art environment called Hamtramck Disneyland.    **Shiva Honey** [@shiva\_honey][9] Author, Weaver of Spells, Priestess of the Satanic Temple, and Musician all the way from Detroit, Shiva Honey gifts us with a taste of some of her latest work. After spending the last several years writing and leading Satanic rituals at The Satanic Temple Headquarters and collaborating with Lucien Greaves, co-founder of The Satanic Temple, on events across the country, Shiva Honey wanted to create a soundtrack for the sacred Satanic experience. Serpentīnae wasconceptualized by Shiva and Lucien as an accompaniment to Shiva’s ritual book, *The Devil’s Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual. * ‘The music provides an opportunity for catharsis,’ Shiva explains. ‘We’re creating a soundtrack for healing, for anger, for empowerment.’ **-  so come and join the Grief Revel and this pretty extraordinary troupe - Monday, 12th June 7pm - 9pm at VFD.** [1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/14593/grief-revel [2]: https://instagram.com/jolylicks [3]: https://jolylicks.com/ [4]: https://www.fervorfestival.com/ [5]: https://www.instagram.com/reannavalentine/ [6]: https://www.instagram.com/queerthemic/ [7]: http://poetrymeetqt./ [8]: https://www.instagram.com/_renalien_/ [9]: https://www.instagram.com/shiva_honey/

[ TICKETS HERE ][1] ### **MySpace or Yours? **

 

Do you remember teaching yourself how to code at 12? Created in 2003,
MySpace was the most popular social network from 2005 to 2008. Whether
it was creating your own profile pages, sharing photo’s, posting your
“top friends” or sharing your music, MySpace was the place for lots of
our youth. 

 

Even though Facebook stole its short lived but glitter layout limelight,
we can never forget the hours we put into this website! 

 

Get your iPod’s out, your iTunes library ready and dancing shoes on. 🪩

 

We can’t wait to throw this MySpace party with tunes from the 00’s in
true Indie Sleaze style. 

 

Grab tickets and show us your best upside down profile pic 😜



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/14179/myspace-or-yours

eventsByFilter.name:
QUEER KID IN THE LANDSCAPE: an evening of films exploring queer
childhood experience
eventsByFilter.description: [ Tickets Here ][1] ### ***Queer Kid in the Landscape: an evening of films exploring queer childhood experience*** * * *Join us for an evening where we contemplate the intricacies of growing up queer in the 80s through the lens of three short films. Afterwards we\'ll host a post-screening Q+A to discuss the themes and experiences of the filmmakers!* * * *There will be a bar for drinks 🍸* * * *Doors at 7pm* * * *Tickets £5.50 advance // £7 On The Door* * * *-* * * ### ***Films*** * * ***LET MY BODY SPEAK / Madonna Adib (UK, Lebanon, 2020, 10’)*** * * The body does not forget. A sexually repressive childhood in Damascus is experienced alongside the growing socio-political repression of the city in the late 1980s and early 90s. Intercutting the landscape of her own body with family archive, the filmmaker embodies the trauma of her queer childhood in Damascus. [***https://www.scottishdocinstitute.com/2020/11/04/madonna-adib-let-my-body-speak/***][2] * * * * ***THE PERPETRATORS / Richard Squires (UK, 2022, 14’)*** Suburban London, the 1980s. A stranger in the family becomes a ghost child and awakens the monsters and desires of a queer childhood. Commenced during lockdown and shot in the neighbourhoods the filmmaker grew up in, THE PERPETRATORS collages moody analogue film, original animation and archival materials in a dreamy autofiction of queer darkness that ponders the correlations between Stranger Danger, the construction of homosexual identity and the institution of the family. At a time when political leaders are once again escalating narratives of the queer threat to children, Squires’ timely reflection on his own 1980s childhood exposes the history of pathological representations of menacing queers. [***http://lmfyffproductions.com/the-perpetrators/***][3] * * * * ***THE YEAR I BROKE MY VOICE / Angelo Madsen Minax (US, 2012, 47’)*** * * *A cast of trans performers, portraying male characters from 1980s coming-of-age films, drift through a post-apocalyptic wasteland sharing misadventures and forging strange kinships. Impromptu races, night-time spooning, cheating at card games, attempts at hypnotism, pocket-knife haircuts, and sexual fantasies become attempts at knowing one another. Constructed from interpretations and re-enactments of 1980s coming of age movies, including The Outsiders(1983), Stand By Me (1986) and The Year My Voice Broke (1987), the film re-approaches the master narrative of childhood’s transition into adulthood from a subversive, yet altogether fragile and uncertain vantage point. * [***https://www.angelomadsen.com/the-year-i-broke-my-voice***][4] * * * * *-* * * *This event is hosted in VFD\'s new event space \'64 Stoke Newington\' Road\'* * * *The screening room is accessed by a staircase leading down to a basement. * * * *If there is anything we can do to facilitate your visit to VFD then please contact us on info@vfdalston.com and we will do our very best to help in advance and on the night.* * * [1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/14521/queer-kid-in-the-landscape-an-evening-of-films-exploring-queer-childhood-experience [2]: https://www.scottishdocinstitute.com/2020/11/04/madonna-adib-let-my-body-speak/ [3]: http://lmfyffproductions.com/the-perpetrators/ [4]: https://www.angelomadsen.com/the-year-i-broke-my-voice

eventsByFilter.name: Discovering Intersex & Transgender
eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*Wednesday July 5th 2023\*\*  
\*\*18.00 – 19.00, London UK (GMT)\*\*  
\*\*Live Zoom Webinar\*\*

Let’s explore the relationship between Intersex and Transgender folks.  
   
Our assigned at birth gender can be a significantly more complex subject
than just transgender. Gender incongruence is far more diverse and far
more widespread than the media would have you believe. This webinar will
uncover the truth and will help you understand just how enormous this
subject really is.  
   
Led by Debra Carroll-Beight, a highly qualified expert in gender
diversity and the study of intersexed individuals, this webinar will
begin by uncovering the history of intersex. We will discuss how this
has become a medical topic, and we will uncover the vast spectrum of
intersex people and how the focus has been shifted to intersex in
children. Closely linked, but different to transgender we will uncover
what is typically understood as intersexed, including the hidden biology
and characteristics that are not visible on the outside.  
   
\*\*BONUS:\*\* Debra will also take your questions live and will draw on
her vast experience to leave no stone unturned.

\### Who is this for:

This is an all-inclusive webinar, and you are welcome to join whether
you are trans, you know someone who is trans, or you are just interested
in the topic. We want to create an environment where learning and
sharing is not just possible but encouraged.

\### Register Now To Secure Your Place

\### About Debra Carroll-Beight

Debra is a second-year Ph.D. student at Case Western Reserve University
studying bioethics. She holds an MA in bioethics from Ohio State
University, an MSc in Public Health from Lund University in Sweden, and
BAs, also from Ohio State, in Women’s Gender, and Sexuality Studies, and
Communications. Debra’s research work includes reproductive health
disparities in LGBTQ+ communities, inequities in mental healthcare for
transgender persons, and ethical practices in the medical care of
intersex children.  

\### Sign Up Now To Secure Your Place

\*\*We will have to limit numbers to make sure that we can host the
event properly, so please RSVP now to avoid disappointment.\*\*

eventsByFilter.name: Celebrate Trans Pride London With Us
eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*Celebrate Trans Pride London 2023 With Us\*\*

\*\*We are very excited to announce that we are going to Trans Pride
London. We had a wonderful time here last year and we are delighted to
be able to support it again.\*\*

This year we are partnering with The Outhouse. This is an amazing
LGBTQAI+ organisation with a fantastic parents group for transgender
children.

\*\*We have a full day planned and you’re very welcome to join us for
the whole day and evening or just the day or evening.\*\* Its up to you.
This is a friendly group and you will be welcomed into the group,
introduced to everyone and we’ll march together.

\*\*The Details:\*\*  
\*\*12.30\*\* We will be meeting at Trafalgar Square - Exact details to
those who RSVP  
\*\*13.00\*\* The march is starting at 1pm and will march into SOHO.
From there, there are planned speeches and entertainment.  
\*\*18:00\*\* For those that wish to celebrate after the day I have
organised and early dinner in a nearby restaurant. It’s a relaxed place
with a varied menu that will suit everyone. - Places are limited to 16
so please book early.  
\*\*20.00\*\* I have booked us a space in a central LGBTQ+ bar where we
can continue the celebrations. - Places are limited to 30 so please book
early.

\*\*As always I’ll email out the full details the day before to anyone
who has RSVP’d the day before.\*\*

\*\*About the March\*\*  
It first started in 2019 in London and has attracted more and more
people every year. Remember PRIDE IS A PROTEST!

To honour the long legacy of transgender, non-binary, gender
non-conforming and intersex people who came before us, build a placard,
wear the flag or flowers, paint your face, get involved and have fun
while you are building awareness of trans people and the trans
community.

\*\*Who is this for:\*\*  
This is for anyone who is trans, questioning or a supporter of trans
people.
eventsByFilter.summary: Celebrate Trans Pride London With Us

eventsByFilter.name: ADAM’S PRESENTS: VISIONS OF HEAVEN
eventsByFilter.description: [ Tickets Here ][1] ***ADAM’S PRESENTS: VISIONS OF HEAVEN *** *08/07/23 – 10PM – 3AM * We’re going to Heaven (no not that one) and you’re invited… Following on from the gorgeous  @Adamsbar’s pop-up last summer, a new series of fabulous club nights celebrating all things  Queer is our next outing.  First up…VISIONS OF HEAVEN, on Saturday the 8th of July @vfdalston will transport you to a  heavenly scape where angels play to an intoxicating mix of pop, dance and house. Don’t worry,  even you naughtier souls are welcome through our pearly gates.   On Saturday 8th of July in celebration of TRANS PRIDE we will be raising money for the wonderful trans charity Gendered Intelligence (@genderedintelligence), with proceeds from ticket sales  going to support the charity and the incredible work they do.  *\"Gendered Intelligence, established in 2008, is a registered charity that works to increase  understandings of gender diversity and improve the lives of trans people. * *Focusing on trans youth work across the country, trans awareness training and workshops, as well  as making life better for trans people in the UK through public engagement and education.” * *“We believe everyone can be intelligent about gender!” * DRESS THEME: ***HEAVENLY LOOKS & ANGELIC VIBES. *** MUSIC: ***POP/ DANCE HITS AND CAMP EUPHORIC ENERGY *** 🎵 – HEAVENLY SOUNDS BY:   @pelio1  @adamfrost   @paulius\_ka  @\_erin\_sutton  @runa.roberts  @djfemnms  ⚡️ VFD   66 Stoke Newington Rd, London N16 7XB  ⚡️ TICKET LINK: https://rb.gy/q12kj   £8 ONLINE PRESALE, £10 ON THE DOOR £12 AFTER MIDNIGHT.  -----------------------------------  ⚡️ WE CAN PROVIDE TAXIS HOME FOR TRANS ATTENDEES OF THE NIGHT WHO WISH FOR THEM. PLEASE SPEAK TO STAFF ON THE NIGHT OR DM @adamsbarlondon AHEAD OF TIME. GENDERED INTELLIGENCE ASKED FOR THIS FUND TO BE RINGFENCED BEFORE ANY OTHER PROCEEDS  FROM THE NIGHT ARE SENT TO THEM, TO HELP ENSURE PEOPLE\'S SAFETY AND FUN AS BEST AS  POSSIBLE.   ***This is a night run by and for the Queers in London to celebrate TRANS PRIDE together. We  operate a on strong basis of consent & respect. *** VFD is a queer venue with zero tolerance for discrimination. Any unwanted touching, comments  or otherwise poor behaviour towards our dancers, DJs, or any of our attendees will not be  tolerated. If someone is making you feel uncomfortable, grab a member of the team and we will  deal with it.   The venue is a basement accessed by 12 stairs with a single banister. There are no other stairs in  the venue and toilets are gender neutral. Cloakroom will be operating on the night as well to  keep items secure should you wish.   Please let us know in advance if there\'s anything we can do to help your night go smoothly, and  we\'ll do our best! eventsByFilter.description:
On July 8th for Trans pride, we are holding a special party to celebrate
our Trans, non-binary and gender non-conforming siblings at the
mothership Dalston Superstore – and with an all Trans / NB line-up,
platforming some amazing local and regional Trans / NB talent. We will
also be asking for donations on the door and donating a portion of our
profits to Trans Pride – last year’s Trans Pride party, we managed to
donate £600 to Not A Phase! Let’s smash that this year! DJ Talent in the
basement comes from London’s fave cheeky Hi-NRG Duo FAFF – who blew our
minds at our Birthday in January, joining them is Todmorden’s fave – the
rising star and absolute legend Kim Lana she’s well loved in Manchester
and the north and we’re excited to be bringing her down to London for a
slice of action! And of course our beloved resident / promoter Michelle
Manetti taking warm-up duties in the Banging Basement.. Upstairs, we
welcome the return of two of our faves Alex Loveless and Thempress as
well as a Fèmmme Fraîche debut from the unstoppable Karlie Marx and this
glorious trio will be joined on gogo duties by our gorgous regular gogo
stunner Novaya + more TBA Entry is £8 b4 11pm / £10 after + donations on

If you\'re an LGBTIQ+ person aged 18-25 in Hackney, join Young Rotters on 15th July, for a free Summer Special at Queer Compost Club. We\'ll be foraging, eating a vegan lunch and learning how to make calendula balm for skin health.W﻿e will meet at the Hackney Community Tree Nursery at 11, and set off
round the marshes for an hour and a half foraging walk with mushroom
nerd Susy (@queer.as.funghi.) We\'ll then return for a homecooked vegan
lunch from vegan chef Jess (@Palamos\_plant\_kitchen) before working
together to make a sun skin balm from calendula.

Get in touch by emailing youngrotters@gmail.com if you have any
questions or need any information about accessibility.

  
Y﻿oung Rotters is a new project that works to connect local people to the ecologies around them, in a way that centres stewardship and reciprocity. These workshops are funded by Hackney Council.

eventsByFilter.name: Brighton Trans Pride - 10 Years - Celebrate with us
eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*Trans Pride Brighton - 10 Year Celebration\*\*

Join us at Trans Pride Brighton. This was a fantastic event last year
with tens of thousands of people and we are delighted to return this
year. This is Trans Pride Brighton\'s 10 year celebration. It\'s a
really well organised event and you\'ll have an amazing time.

\*\*THERE ARE 2 PARTS TO THIS EVENT:\*\*

\*\*1: We have the regular meetup where we will do the march and then
will relax in the park after, enjoying the entertainment and then off to
the after pride official party. See below for more.\*\*

\*\*2: We are shooting our second film. This short film is titled Trans
Pride. We\'d love to have you involved! See below for more.\*\*

\*\*PART 1: - Regular meetup event.\*\*

\*\*The Details:\*\*  
\*\*10.30\*\* We will be meeting at \*\*Brighton Train Station.\*\*  
\*\*11.00\*\* We will go down to Jubilee Square, to \*\*listen to the
speeches\*\* outside The Brighton Jubilee Library.

\*\*12.00: The march begins\*\* and we will join in, walking to
Brunswick Square. (This is really fun).

\*\*13.00 - 18.00\*\* The park event with entertainment and festivities
is at Brunswick Square. This will be BSL interpreted. There are lots of
trade stands and food stalls. You can even pop down to the beach for a
quick dip to cool off. We certainly did last year.

\*\*19.30 - 03.00\*\*: This is the official after party trans
celebration - \*\*THIS IS A TICKETED EVENT AND YOU NEED TO BUY YOUR
TICKETS IN ADVANCE.\*\* The link is Tickets:
\[[https://concorde2.seetickets.com/event/trans-pride-brighton-afterparty/concorde-2/2686033\](https://concorde2.seetickets.com/event/trans-pride-brighton-afterparty/concorde-2/2686033?fbclid=IwAR3x-bAD9CpCFCoq5wzAIeHpFPM93I\_\_-jcTyXSugnHHrvlzxftKO9CCws4][1])

\*\*As always I’ll email out the full details the day before to anyone
who has RSVP’d the day before.\*\*

\*\*PART 2: The Filming Of Trans Pride.\*\*  
This is film 2 of our series of 3 for this year.

\*\*We need your involvement: We had over 16 of you get involved in the
first film which was amazing. This time we want many more....\*\*

The interviews this time will be just a couple of minutes and we are
just asking what does Trans Pride mean to you. We have a trade stand in
Brunswick Square and all you need to do is pop by and say your piece.
Simple and easy!

\*\*For more information and to get involved please message/email Jess
at \[masked\] /\[masked\].\*\*

\*\*Getting there:\*\*  
As we are meeting in Brighton train station, please make your own
arrangements to get there. Brighton has an excellent service from
London. It takes 90 minutes roughly from London to get there and trains
are quite regular. A direct train from Victoria takes just under 1 hour.
(\*\*Please Note:\*\* You cannot tap on with your card so please
remember to book a ticket).

\*\*About the March\*\*  
there is a vibrant trans community in Brighton and Trans Pride Brighton
started in 2013 and has grown year on year since then. Over 50,000
people attended online in 2021. Let\'s help make this the best year
ever.

To honour the long legacy of transgender, non-binary, gender
non-conforming and intersex people who came before us, build a placard,
wear the flag or flowers, paint your face, get involved and have fun
while you are building awareness of trans people and the trans
community.

\*\*See more at
\[[https://transpridebrighton.org/\](https://transpridebrighton.org/][2]
)\*\*\[ \]([https://transpridebrighton.org/][3] )

\*\*Who is this for:\*\*  
This is for anyone who is trans, questioning or a supporter of trans
people.



[1]: https://concorde2.seetickets.com/event/trans-pride-brighton-afterparty/concorde-2/2686033%5D(https://concorde2.seetickets.com/event/trans-pride-brighton-afterparty/concorde-2/2686033?fbclid=IwAR3x-bAD9CpCFCoq5wzAIeHpFPM93I__-jcTyXSugnHHrvlzxftKO9CCws4
[2]: https://transpridebrighton.org/%5D(https://transpridebrighton.org/
[3]: https://transpridebrighton.org/
eventsByFilter.summary: Brighton Trans Pride - 10 Years - Celebrate with us

eventsByFilter.name: One More Time: 2004 - London
eventsByFilter.description:
*The last year in our glorious decade of pop! The tide was about to turn
against pop but there was still one last hurrah with Girls Aloud,
Britney, Rachel Stevens, Kylie, Jamelia, Sugababes and Busted were
flying the flag for pop.*

*It was also the year that saw the launch of McFly, The 411 and V along
with Natasha Bedingfield, JoJo, Scissor Sisters and Pop! Gwen Stefani
went solo, Kelis returned big time and a star from 1996 returned in the
shape of Peter Andre! In the clubs Eric Prydz, LMC (vs U2),
Shapeshifters and Stonebridge ruled the dancefloors. And at the very
start of the year we had Queen VB herself with Let Your Head Go (and
This Groove).*

*We’ll be playing the A list popstars from 2004 along with B listers
like Angel City, VS and 2 Play along with loads of other pop and dance
hits from 2004. Expect loads of forgotten gems you\'re unlikely to hear
anywhere else (from the final days of Blue and Atomic Kitten to Phixx).
Our Bargain Bin first hour of 2004’s pop flops (from the Cheeky Girls
and Bellefire to Nadia) kicks things off from 9pm.*

eventsByFilter.name: Pumping Velvet
eventsByFilter.description:
We interrupt your regular schedule of basking in the sun and/or
endlessly complaining about the heat (delete as appropriate) to let you
know that PUMPING VELVET is back. And in keeping with the ever rising
temperatures it’s going to be a hot one. Chief instigator of this
evening’s entertainment is our long time friend Gwenan. In this age of
aggrandising social media strategies and looped clips of club streams
Gwenan is that rarest of things – an underground hero who is content
just to let her records do the talking. With barely an online footprint
to speak of Gwenan’s sheer force of rhythm and idiosyncratic take on
classic 90s Techno and Electro has led her to play a slew of the best
underground clubs and festivals across the world, as well as landmark
mixes for Dekmantel, Resident Advisor and others. Joining Gwenan in our
famed sweat dungeon is Adonis resident and absolute queen of the classy
warm up (not that we need it any warmer mind), is Seb Odyssey. With a
focus on eschewing trends and seeking out timeless but underappreciated
records you can feel Seb’s deep connection to his music with every
single mix. Check out this interview and his slinky Smut mix for more
insight into his sound. Flying the flag on the top deck of HMS PV will
be our resident Sam PV alongside Rosy Ross & babyschön. Recently moved
from Leeds to London (their loss, our gain!), babyschön hosts a regular
show on NARR and plays just the kind of lithe and sleazy italo, boogie &
synth-pop we love so much. It’s all set to be a summer slammer! Come
PUMP SOME VELVET. £7 BEFORE 11 / £10 AFTER

eventsByFilter.name: t’ARTopia
eventsByFilter.description:
### ***Join us in t\'ARTopia for a queer-curated night of drag, music, poetry and burlesque from some of our most delicious t\'ARTs. We have invited some of our favourite performers to entertain you all, at a night that will be nothing short of t\'ARTopian.***

### ***We will be raising money for gender affirming surgery funds with this evening\'s raffle, so come with a couple of quid, win art and raise money for good causes!***

* *

### ***Performers:***

### ***  
J-Love and the Baa-Gee - Music***

*Jesse is an alternative artist from south London. Jesse is a multi
talented musician, playing drums, keys, guitar and bass and has worked
with numerous artists and labels as a producer and song writer. Now
releasing music under the name J-Love, he’ll be joined on stage by Thom
(guitar) & Gillian (bass) from the Baa-Gee. The Baa-Gee is a
community of people consisting of musicians, artists, designers etc.*

*  
Jesse - he/him - @tharealjloveofficial  
Thom - she/her - @thom\_jude  
Gillian she/her - @itsjustgillian  
The Baa-Gee - @thebaagee*

* *

### ***Marty Gleeson - Comedy***

*Marty Gleeson is an Irish standup comedian kickin\' down the front,
back and side doors of the London comedy scene. Her offbeat, whimsical
and dry performance style pulls you in close and takes to places you
don\'t see coming. Winner of the Pete Nash Award for comic originality,
West New Act of the Year and Max Turner finalist.*

*  
‘It\'s rare to find a comic whose playful relationship with suspense has
an audience laughing before they\'ve even spoken, but this seems to be
Marty Gleeson\'s superpower.\' - Broadway World*

*  
‘A breath of fresh air. Funny and original deadpan comedy with an
unexpectedly dark edge.’ - Dan  
Atkinson*

*  
@martygleeson\_*

### ***ellc - Music***

*ELLC (ell-cee) is a London-based artist, by way of Nigeria &
Northampton. Their work is underpinned  
by a love for storytelling, vulnerability and playfulness. Their music
centres black diaspora identities and  
blends genres creating an expansive sound whilst exploring the self,
relationships and community.  
Leaning into their dramatic flair they provoke the senses using vivid
imagery and a little dash of whimsy.  
Their latest single Jealous is available wherever you like to stream
music.*

*  
@ellcsings*

eventsByFilter.name: July\'s Friendly Transgender Social Meetup London
eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*Are you Trans and want to meet other trans people in a safe and
social environment?\*\*

Join me and your fellow trans lovelies for a relaxed meetup on
\*\*Thursday July 20th at 19.30 in the Soho, central London area.\*\*

This place has a great buzz and we have our own private space booked!
It\'s a sneaky way to start the weekend early. Come and join us :)

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

We have a private area upstairs in the venue, which is plenty of space
for us all to chat, hear each other and relax.

Thursday is the new start of the weekend. Let\'s use this opportunity to
make some new friends and chat about whatever pleases you.

This event will suit you if you are new to attending the meetup or are
one of our wonderful regulars. It is a popular evening with lots of
different people popping in. There is no need to be nervous. We are all
very friendly and welcoming. You\'ll feel right at home. :)

\*\*What is this meetup?\*\*  
This is a relaxed, friendly and inclusive meetup for the trans people of
London. This is an opportunity to make new friends and chat over a
sneaky Thursday drink.

\*\*Who is it for?\*\*  
Everyone from the trans community is welcome. This is an opportunity to
be yourself, whatever you identify as. We are inclusive and happy to
welcome you.

\*\*How does it work?\*\*  
Your host Ray has booked a private area in a pub in the Soho area. All
you have to do is RSVP and then Ray will message you on the day with the
event location. Then, all you have to do is show up.

Ray will make sure that you meet some new people and get a chance to get
to know your fellow trans buddies. He is very friendly and will welcome
you and make sure you feel comfortable and happy.

It is free to attend, just buy yourself a drink at the bar.

\*\*Please Note:\*\* RSVP is a must as the location (based around Soho)
will be sent by email on the day to those who have RSVP\'d only. RSVP
closes at 16.00 on the day of the event.

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*
eventsByFilter.summary: July\'s Friendly Transgender Social Meetup London

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Noise
eventsByFilter.description: [ TICKETS HERE ][1] *Queer Noise is back with another gorgeous evening of Queer Poetry, Music and Performance!   * *Join us on Wednesday the 26th of July at VFDalston for a simultaneously silly and sensitive exploration of queer community, identity and relationships. * Each month we raise money for Gender Affirming Surgeries. This month we are supporting [*MJ\'s Top Surgery Fundraiser. *][2] * * *As well as our amazing performers there will also be gorgeous stalls from queer artists and craft makers!!!* * * *Please arrive in time for a 7.30 start* * * *Doors 7pm* *Grace Quigley 7.30 - 7.40 * *Maureen Onwunali 7.40 - 7.55* *Gail 7.55 - 8.15 * * * *Break 8.15 - 8.40* * * *Kia Matanky-Becker 8.40 - 8.50* *Mascette 8.50 - 9.05* *MB Fortune 9.05 - 9.25* * * *Music and Vibes 9.30 - 10pm * * * ***TICKETS:*** *Standard: £8* *Solidarity: £14\** *Pay-it-forward: £9\*\** * * *\*Solidarity tickets: for allies or those who can afford to pay a higher ticket price to will help us keep this event sustainable and make it grow, so please consider this option if you can.* *\*\*Pay-it-forward tickets: please consider this option if you\'re an ally who\'d like to support low/unwaged people from the community.* * * * * Unfortunately the venue is in a basement without step free access. Please contact us on [*queernoiseevents@gmail.com*](mailto:queernoiseevents@gmail.com) with any questions regarding accessibility. The event is mostly seated however there is some standing room. If you need us to reserve you a seat for access reasons please send us an email :)   * * [1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/15061/queer-noise [2]: https://www.gofundme.com/f/mjs-big-chop-day

eventsByFilter.name: BLEDI DEBUT
eventsByFilter.description:
[ Tickets Here ][1] *BLEDI presents Fulla! With the new Barbie movie coming around, a
certain iconic doll needs the spotlight too; Fulla - come to Bledi in
your favourite Fulla-inspired fit - think pink, plastic, and pious.*

* *

*Bledi is The Queer SWANA Art Rave, a dedicated collective and night out
centring QTIBPOC (Queer, Trans/Non-Binary, and/or Intersex, Black people
and People of Colour) from the SWANA region (South West Asia/North
Africa - commonly referred to as \'the Middle East\'). Bledi (Arabic for
‘My Homeland’) has created a space for SWANA Queers to celebrate our
lives and showcase our talents, as underrepresented artists of typically
marginalised backgrounds.*

* *

*Our debut night out will be hosted at VFDalston and showcase a number
of QTIBPOC drag performers and DJs. Non-QTIBPOC allies are welcomed and
encouraged to pay for the higher entry fee. Reminder that this is a
space prioritising QTIBPOC, be aware of the space you are taking.*

* *

*Performances by: Jinn Alhijra, Lujane Oud, Cairo Ali, and Minara El
Waters*

*DJ sets by: Raks2Riches, Habibtati, Seksu, Atrialia*



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/14947/bledi-debut

eventsByFilter.name: Tickle
eventsByFilter.description:
Attention: Very Hot! Join us for a friends family and lovers affair as
TICKLE takes over the mothership! In the basement expect vibrant 80s and
90s house and italo selections from Superstore regular and Tickle
resident Jimmy Acid followed by guest David Ramsay who has been
electrifying dancefloors around London with diverse selections drawing
from his wide range of influences. Tickle resident and newcomer on the
London scene Iarlaith will bring the lazer pit to a climax with some
darker cuts and uplifting ravey energy. In the bar Tickle resident
nellída is joining Someone Sunny for a cute and sexy b2b. As the name
suggests, Someone Sunny delves into bright, bold and radiant sounds of
the electronic spectrum, blending a range of textures from uplifting
trance to racy ghettotech. nellída likes to keep things hot ‘n’ fun,
skillfully and sensually weaving progressive house, acid laced anthems
and percussive bussy poppers. On closing duties upstairs is Goh Well
whose rising career in the scene embodies a fresh spin on UK dance music
– expect pulsating percussion, infectious grooves with a potent blend of
sensuality and soul.

£8 before 11 / £10 after

eventsByFilter.name: BUMWARMING PARTY
eventsByFilter.description:
Bumwarming, as in housewarming, but in the grand tradition of queer as
f\*ck!The legendary queer artists Kubra Uzun aka Q-BRA & Akis Ka have
just moved from Istanbul to London, their new home! Come help us welcome
our sisters to the London scene! All proceeds will go to Kubra & Akis,
to give them a head start in their new life.And you better warm that bum
too because this is just the beginning: this hot group of DJs and
performers will soon set this city on fire. Don’t miss the chance of
being able to say you were there at the very beginning.
