eventsByFilter.name: Fussy
eventsByFilter.description:
FUSSY: KICK BACK KEWL DOWN Wanda Whatever and Lori Mae‘s cult queer
party with care and community at it’s heart returns to the mothership!
FUSSY is a series of queer gatherings with the mission to celebrate joy,
community, togetherness, and singularity. LEGS, LEGS, LEGS! We can’t
stop ‘em! They’re legs, they’re gams, they guide us through life’s
meauxments, they take us over hills and down the valleys. It’s time to
give your lil gammies the good good kewl down they deserve at the next
FUSSY: KICK BACK KEWL DOWN on 11 August, our bi-monthly queer gathering
space at Dalston Superstore. You know that feeling of fresh, kewl rain
on a hot summer day? In the words of Drew Barrymore: “Rain is for
everybody, and I love things that are for everyone” – we hope the Kick
Back Kewl Down provides us all with the spritz we all deserve from Hot
Gammy Summer 2023.

£8 BEFORE 11 / £10 AFTER

eventsByFilter.description:
Come and discover the tarot deck from a queer perspective. Get to know
the basics and learn how to read intuitively in this fun introduction to
tarot. We’ll look at different ways of finding meaning in the deck and
how to create a spread, as well as how to use the cards for
self-reflection, creative inspiration, and unlocking our subconscious.No
experience necessary – suitable for those completely new to tarot and
feeling curious, and those looking to find fresh inspiration for their
readings.Facilitated by Sarah April Lamb.Date: Monday 14 August 2023,
7-8:30pm Location: The Glitch, 134 Lower Marsh, London, SE1 7AE (a five
minute walk from Waterloo station)Price: £10 (please book in advance as
we have caps on numbers)Accessibility: The venue is wheelchair
accessible, with step-free access to toilets.Sappho Events welcomes

tropi-queer ritual! Amoresss! Exciteddd to host another fresh caliente

eventsByFilter.description:
158km over 3 days with 1460m elevation  
The second trip this year planned by Josie is to be another go at the king Alfred’s way! So good we are doing it twice. The route, campsites and vibe was so good last year, it provides a great intro (or refresher) to Bikepacking. One of the things Josie loves about off-road is you can do the same route again and the weather/conditions/company make it a totally different experience. A great trip for building confidence!  
  
Velociposse enquiry form: [https://forms.gle/oWznxrYM129cC7m47][1]

eventsByFilter.name: Femmme Fraiche Bank Holiday Special
eventsByFilter.description:
Our biggest and best lezzy rave is back for a Bank Holiday special!
Beloved celesbian DJ Michelle Manetti and friends return for a big
summer love in at the mothership! Downstairs we have a full Australian
contingency joining our resident Michelle Manetti. First up, good friend
and fellow promoter Estée Louder is joining us, she’s the creator of
Sydney Queer Rave Control, and uplifts women and queer spirits, merging
global talents in a techno haven. Following her on closing duties is DJ
Luv You a non-binary DJ and multidisciplinary visual artist and founder
of queer/femme lead Naarm (Melbourne) party LUNA Blessings. A tasty trio
if ever there was one. Upstairs, we welcome Ellefire with her debut set
for Femmme Fraiche, joined by regular and fave Ms.G with the party
pumpers and of course our very own duo of Fraîchness residents Linzi
Symons and Darren Skene on ?2 ? duties with your trash-tastic guilty
pleasures. For gogo duties, we welcome the debut of super fierce and
extra sassy Sxbrina Jade joined by our firm fave, the fabulous Danni
Spooner £8 before 11 / £10 after

*We operate a zero tolerance policy* Our event is aimed as a space for
queer wxmn, trans, and non binary folx, although allies and friends are
welcome providing they respect the space.

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Open Decks
eventsByFilter.description:
Queer Open Decks are a support and networking event for any LGBTQ+ DJs
working within London/Online or those looking to learn basic DJ skills.
Started as a small meet up at the @ldnlgbtqcentre, they are now a
growing community of genre-fluid LGBTQ+ DJs meeting on a monthly basis.
Sign up details: During the night, we have 6x 20 minute slots from 7-9pm
that you can sign up in advance here, followed by 6 x 30 minute slots
from 9-12pm that you can sign up for on the night. Please note that this
is primarily a social/networking event rather than a club night – we
have the whole venue to ourselves to allow for those wishing to learn to
DJ in a supportive environment alongside. Feel free to bring your
friends and supporters along! FREE ENTRY

eventsByFilter.name: BodySwap
eventsByFilter.description:
Dalston Superstore’s weekly party BodySwap invites a new trans\* artist,
promoter, or organisation to curate a month of Wednesday night parties
at the venue. Septmeber guest curator: WIMP WIMP is a talent agency
prioritising trans+ talent, the home for models who exist outside of the
rigid binaries of gender. The agency was launched by Xoey Fourr in the
early Summer of 2020 as a means of providing support for Trans+ talent
in the commercial modelling world. WIMP has initiated a crucial
conversation about financial reimbursement for models, especially those
who are trans+ and queer. Throughout the month of September, WIMP
invites artists from their roster to guest curate a night celebrating
trans+ talent. The curators for this month are Darkwah, Dodo and
TrashedBaby. TrashedBaby has walked for Loverboy, is a performance
artist, musician and promoter currently focusing on hyperglitch, breaks
and idm. Dodo has hosted Dazed workshops and modelled for Michaela
Stark, featured on the cover of Metal magazine, and is currently one of
the faces of Levi’s. Darkwah is a performer and creator who has
spearheaded WIMP workshops and talks for Dazed alongside Burberry as
well as featuring in a couple upcoming Tim Walker shoots. This is a
space for trans\* power, rage, beauty, resilience, and joy. BodySwap
celebrates and platforms trans\* artists from diverse backgrounds, while
raising crucial funds for organisations that support the community. All
door profits will be donated to a queer organisation or fundraiser of
the guest curator’s choosing. £7 ENTRY

eventsByFilter.name: Dolls vs Twinks
eventsByFilter.description:
Join us on Friday the 4th of September as we settle a rivalry as old as
time. DJing upstairs we have a handpicked crew of 4 tboy twinks who will
attempt to win over the crowd with pop bangers. DJing in laser pit are 4
dolls, Superstore veterans, who will be rinsing out all manner of
transgender genres to defend their place. Dancing on the bar is an
independent jury of hotties with a range of pronouns, there to establish
and maintain the vibe. Will the dolls defend their place at the top of
the food chain? Or will the tboy twinks overthrow them? It’s literally a
meme come true. Inspired by the wave of Twinks Vs Dolls cigarette races
in NYC, with artwork by the runaway internet sensation
@Czech.hunter.schafer   £8 before 11 / £10 after

eventsByFilter.name: Femmme Fraiche
eventsByFilter.description:
As festival season is nearly nigh, we’ve got an end-of-summer, September
meltdown to squeeze the last sweaty Summer moments from before Autumn
sets in. On September the 9th, we head back to the mothership, with a
scorchio jam-packed line-up for you. We’ve got all the tasty MMMMM’s in
the basement, with warm up from East London rising star Minimel plus
secret guest headliner M\*\*\*\*\* (can you guess who it is?) with our
beloved resident / promoter Michelle Manetti sandwiched in between the
two, all your basement bangers and fantasies are covered. Meanwhile
upstairs, High Priestess of Hub 16 resident DJ at Bi Fast and Bi
Furious and all-round East London megababe SAMANTHA makes her Fèmmme
Fraîche debut, joined by the sass queen and creator of Taboo TV – Jeanie
Crystal who both sandwich our very own duo of Fraîchness residents Linzi
Symons and Darren Skene on ?2 ? duties with your trash-tastic guilty
pleasures. For gogo duties, our firm fave, the fabulous Danni Spooner is
joined by Queer House Party royalty Taali, for ass-shakin’ sexy, sassy,
stupendous bar-top antics. £8 before 11 / £10 after

*We operate a zero tolerance policy* Our event is aimed as a space for
queer wxmn, trans, and non binary folx, although allies and friends are
welcome providing they respect the space.

eventsByFilter.name: FLOWERS.02
eventsByFilter.description:
[ Tickets here ][1] ***“This is the need: that for a few beats, or thousands, I’m not. Not
here. Not anywhere… A trans body homing in on its own estrangement,
losing itself, in these alien beats, among this xeno-flesh.” (McKenzie
Wark, Raving)  
  
What is your need? Your need to party, to rave?  
  
FLOWERS is a queer club night created for those who seek comfort,
release and communion in the dance.  
  
To party is a collective practice as important as any other. A practice
in the possible. A practice in world-building. A practice in cultivating
a communal language of sound, movement and sociability.  
  
As we step into the garden once again, come as you are, wherever you\'re
at, open to the transformative potential of ravespace.***

*  
*

***\[Instagram: @***[***flowerssldn***][2]***\]***

*  
*

***✿   ✿   ✿***

*  
*

***\*If you would like to buy a ticket but do not have the means to do
so at this time, email ‘flowerssldn@gmail.com’ to request a free ticket
(no other information needed) and we will send you one - no questions
asked.***

*  
*

***\*\*We apologise that VFD is a basement venue accessed by a staircase
and therefore is not wheelchair accessible. We strive to make the space
as accessible as possible and welcome any suggestions and open
discussion around this topic.***



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/15287/flowers02
[2]: https://www.instagram.com/flowerssldn/#

eventsByFilter.name:
The Fox\'s Bingo Royale: Majestic Mayhem from the Monarchs of Dragged
Around London
eventsByFilter.description:
Are you ready for an evening of the glitziest balls you\'ve ever seen?
The drag queens and kings of Dragged Around London are taking over The
Fox\'s social room to bring you a Drag Bingo extravaganza every
Thursday! 

Gather your friends, put on your fiercest outfits, and prepare for a
night filled with hilarious banter and the chance to win fabulous
prizes. This is not your grandma\'s bingo night (though I bet she\'ll
love it too!)

The event is free to attend (please reserve to ensure you get a spot in
the room!), with the bingo cards costing £5 each on the night. Prizes
for the winners include shots and drinks from The Fox bar, Dragged
Around London walking tour voucher, and a rolling jackpot up for grabs
in the final game each week!

  
More info and to reserve a seat: [https://tinyurl.com/foxsbingoroyale][1]

eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*Are you Trans and want to meet other trans people in a safe and
social environment?\*\*

Join me and your fellow trans lovelies for a relaxed meetup on
\*\*Thursday September 14th at 19.30 in the Soho, central London
area.\*\*

This place has a great buzz and we have our own private space booked!
It\'s a sneaky way to start the weekend early. Come and join us :)

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

We have a private area upstairs in the venue, which is plenty of space
for us all to chat, hear each other and relax.

Thursday is the new start of the weekend. Let\'s use this opportunity to
make some new friends and chat about whatever pleases you.

This event will suit you if you are new to attending the meetup or are
one of our wonderful regulars. It is a popular evening with lots of
different people popping in. There is no need to be nervous. We are all
very friendly and welcoming. You\'ll feel right at home. :)

\*\*What is this meetup?\*\*

This is a relaxed, friendly and inclusive meetup for the trans people of
London. This is an opportunity to make new friends and chat over a
sneaky Thursday drink.

\*\*Who is it for?\*\*

Everyone from the trans community is welcome. This is an opportunity to
be yourself, whatever you identify as. We are inclusive and happy to
welcome you.

\*\*How does it work?\*\*

Your host Ray has booked a private area in a pub in the Soho area. All
you have to do is RSVP and then Ray will message you on the day with the
event location. Then, all you have to do is show up.

Ray will make sure that you meet some new people and get a chance to get
to know your fellow trans buddies. He is very friendly and will welcome
you and make sure you feel comfortable and happy.

It is free to attend, just buy yourself a drink at the bar.

\*\*Please Note:\*\* RSVP is a must as the location (based around Soho)
will be sent by email on the day to those who have RSVP\'d only. RSVP
closes at 16.00 on the day of the event.

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*
eventsByFilter.summary: September\'s Friendly Transgender Social Meetup London

eventsByFilter.name: Down2Clown
eventsByFilter.description:
A silly little fundraiser for a silly little queer art project! Calling
all slaggy clowns and mischievous queers for a night of unhinged
remixes, electronic bangers, & your fav guilty pleasures, with all
proceeds going towards the development of a brand new piece of queer
comedy theatre. Cressup, Watcha, MYNXIE and RODENT will be throwing out
feral beats, throwback dance hits & all the tunes you need to be the
silliest jester in Dalston. Lori Mae, hotboiyo and Angel will be
clowning around on the bar and dancing for the court!

eventsByFilter.name: HAUS PARTY PRESENTS: FASHUN
eventsByFilter.description:
[ TICKETS HERE ][1] HAUS PARTY is here strutting down the runway its time for FASHUN! Our
new party bringing all

the fashion huns and divas together and just in time for London Fashion
Week darling.

Friday the 15th of September @vfdalston will transport you to hallowed
halls of HAUS bringing

you the hottest designer looks, tracks and party people...and you’re on
the list for THE PARTY of

London Fashion Week.

We are delighted to be collaborating with our HAUS family friend fashion
designer Adam Frost’s to

be his official Spring Summer 2024 show after party. So expect lots of
air kisses and looks being

served by him and his entourage...

Our resident DJ’s will be bringing all the attitude with their tunes
runway then we will bring it to

‘Hunway’ picking our favourite divas from the crowd for a walk off for
the grand prize.

So save the date for the most important party in the fashion week
calendar.

“That’s all...”

DRESS THEME: FASHION WEEK BITCH

MUSIC: 90 & 2000s HITS AND HIGH FASHION ATTITUDE

🎵 – RUNWAY MUSIC VIBES BY OUR RESIDENT DJS:

@pelio1

@paulius\_ka

⚡️ VFD

66 Stoke Newington Rd, London N16 7XB

⚡️ TICKETS:

• £8 FROW (EARLY BIRD) – ONLINE ONLY

• £10 DOOR BITCH (DOOR BEFORE MIDNIGHT)

• £12 FASHIONABLY LATE (AFTER MIDNIGHT)

-----------------------------------

This is a night run by and for the queers in London to celebrate fashion
together darling.

We operate a on strong basis of consent & respect.

VFD is a queer venue with zero tolerance for discrimination. Any
unwanted touching, comments

or otherwise poor behaviour towards our dancers, DJs, or any of our
attendees will not be

tolerated. If someone is making you feel uncomfortable, grab a member of
the team and we will

deal with it.

The venue is a basement accessed by 12 stairs with a single banister.
There are no other stairs in

the venue and toilets are gender neutral. Cloakroom will be operating on
the night as well to

keep items secure should you wish.

Please let us know in advance if there\'s anything we can do to help
your night go smoothly, and

we\'ll do our best!



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/15611/fashun

eventsByFilter.name: Psybuzz
eventsByFilter.description:
Psybuzz is back at the mothership Dalston Superstore for a third
spiralling edition of Trancey, Psycho-Delic shenanigans, Deep-Haus
groovers, Hi-NRG and beyond! Featuring a wave of much anticipated
first-hand guests, local scene experts and legends. Including another
handful of London and Superstore debuts in the laserpit: Iconic Irish
export and Trance revival pioneer DJ and Producer Eoin DJ (Radiant
Records), esteemed Korean born and France-based vinyl records selector
Soyoon (Macadam, Cocktail d’Amore), Naarm/Melbourne star and RA city
manager, the now London based Producer and sound-artiste RBI (Butter
Sessions, Animalia), and Fuaim co-founder, 21′ Irish prog-revival
initiator the young Feargal (Fuaim). Upstairs, another well-known figure
from dance music history: Girl Unit aka Hysterics (Night Slugs),
headlines the bar with his arsenal of club-edits, productions, and his
own take on housey and r&b-beat influences. Hardcore queen and East
London babe Ms G (Dalston Superstore) plus deep-house and trippy-groove
connoisseur Seb Odyssey (Adonis). With dance action from the one and
only’s: Yung Reenie and Kurtis Lincoln. £8 BEFORE 11 / £10 AFTER Door

eventsByFilter.name: RIPOSTE DAY RAVE - QUEER, ART, TECHNO
eventsByFilter.description:
20 DJs - 10 performers - 10 visual artists doing installations - 10
stalls. 2 dance floors, a chill room with stalls, an art space, a play
space, a big outside… What are you waiting for?Come celebrate and make
memories with the beautiful London queerdos during this 10 hours day
rave at the fab 60 Dock Road. ACCESSIBILITY INFORMATIONS-Stairs across
the venue: Groundfloor (chill space, stalls, bar and many performances):
are on the ground floor. Small ramp of 60cm to access this room. This
room is smaller than the one you might know at Electrowerkz but there is
a much bigger outside space to chill &amp; chat out of the
music.Smoking area: choice between a few small steps or a ramp.
Accessible, levelled toilets are available (please ask to anyone wearing
a high-vis jackets or venue workers: they are on the side
outside)Outside stage: level access from the street (music, stalls,
performances)Room 1: unsure yet (they have the new room beginning of
December) but it is on the ground floor so it should require no of only
a few steps. Room 2: approximatively 30 stairs up. Playroom: an
additional 15 stairs above Room 2. -Some areas will be dark (room 2 /
playroom).-Strobe lights on dancefloors.-Service animals not allowed
in-If you do not have the means to pay for a ticket, please send us a DM
on instagram or email us at least a few days before the event. We
encourage to pay at least concession price as it is a hella pricey
&amp; time consuming event to put on, but we can also offer free
tickets if needed xPlease contact riposte.london@gmail.com or DM us on
https://www.instagram.com/riposte.london if you have any question ENTRY
REQUIREMENTS- This is an 18+ event- Valid form of ID (photocopies /
pictures not accepted) with a picture. Plan accordingly and tell your
friends. No ID no entry.- A ticket (no tickets on the door if we are
sold out)-Last entry 8pm-The club has its own security that will search
you and can refuse entry if you carry any illicit or forbidden items or
if you are in an altered state.If these requirements are not respected,
you will not be able to gain entry and you will not get refunded.

eventsByFilter.name: One More Time: 2002
eventsByFilter.description:
[ TICKETS HERE ][1] *One More Time returns back to 2002! It was the year Pop Idol was all
over the charts - from Will Young, Gareth Gates and Darius to Jessica
Garlick, Rosie Ribbons, Sarah Whatmore and, err Rik Waller. Not to
mention the resurgence of Liberty X and emergence of Girls Aloud and The
Cheeky Girls.*

*We also saw the launch of Shakira, Holly Valance (before she became
controversial), S Club Juniors, Christina Milian and Ashanti... and a
certain Las Ketchup. Enrique Inglesias, Pink, Sugababes, A1 and Atomic
Kitten all returned and the clubs filled with dance music from Kelly
Llorenna, Flip & Fill and Scooter and Belgian eurotrance from Lasgo,
Milk Inc and Ian Van Dahl.*

*We’ll be playing the A list popstars from 2002 along with B listers
like H & Claire, Romeo and Anastasia along with loads of other pop
and dance hits from 2002. Expect loads of forgotten gems you\'re
unlikely to hear anywhere else (from allSTARS\* to Mad\'House and
MadDonna). Our Bargain Bin first hour of 2002’s pop flops (from
Lighthouse Family to Aurora and the year\'s biggest flop Angelle) kicks
the night off from 9pm.*



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/15743/one-more-time-2002

eventsByFilter.name: Pumping Velvet
eventsByFilter.description:
After the summer that never was Pumping Velvet is back to give you the
heat you so desperately need ?. Our September edition is a special
party, with three of our finest residents taking control downstairs all
night long. Fresh from a slew of amazing gigs at some of the finest
queer parties Adonis, Cocktail and the Panorama Bar, Joe Delon returns
to play for us for the first time since November 2022. Except this time
he’ll be teaming up with Sofie OK their first ever b2b! Expect three
very special hours of sleazy weirdo chug of the kind that makes you both
aroused and limber. Closing out the basement is our bossman and
founder Sam PV with a set bound to span a broad gamut of genres,
majoring on big drums, pop melodies and more than an undercurrent of
filth. Upstairs is an exceedingly fresh line up of superstore debuts.
Traveling down from Manchester with a stick full of squiggly bops is All
Hands on Deck member aNNA complemented by ConCon resident at Leeds
party Lickquid Gold promising a set of pumping house and disco. Closing
out the evening is Glotzer founder of Dalston hottest new queer
party Ziber Klub , and master of all things Italo. Come pump some velvet
? £7 BEFORE 11 / £10 AFTER

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents THE OLD GUARD (2020)
eventsByFilter.description:
On the third night of Fairy Tales, we bring you Action epic The Old
Guard (2020) from director Gina Prince-Bythewood (Love & Basketball, The
Woman King). Charlize Theron leads a group of immortal mercenaries who
have survived centuries in secrecy only to find themselves hunted in
present day by those seeking to harness their power for themselves.
These ancient soldiers realise the fight is on just as the presence of a
new immortal complicates things further. The Old Guard marked the first
major Hollywood comicbook adaptation by a black woman, and despite being
dropped on Netflix painfully undermarketed and consequently underseen,
Prince-Bythewood’s film is a slice of genre excellence that marries an
all-star cast – including Kiki Layne (If Beale Street Could Talk), and
Matthias Schoenaerts (Rust and Bone) – with the sensibilities of similar
films from the 2000s like Lara Croft: Tomb Raider, Underworld, and the
original few X-Men. In short, it’s a film about people fighting and
looking extremely cool while doing it. Not only does The Old Guard offer
the chance to see reigning Bicon and Transmissions favourite Charlize do
what she does best, but there’s more gayness to be had! A romance
between two of the immortal men is functionally the beating heart of the
film, and we think you’ll enjoy a rare chance to see explicitly queer
characters in a big-budget genre film as much as we did. So grab
yourself goodies from the vegan kitchen, a drink from the bar, and join
our majority-trans audience downstairs at Dalston Superstore for a
screening of a real hidden gem. Tickets available via OutSavvy Subtitles
will be displayed throughout the film. Seating is a mixture of benches,
backed chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is first come, first
served.

eventsByFilter.name: BodySwap
eventsByFilter.description:
Dalston Superstore’s weekly party BodySwap invites a new trans\* artist,
promoter, or organisation to curate a month of Wednesday night parties
at the venue. Septmeber guest curator: WIMP WIMP is a talent agency
prioritising trans+ talent, the home for models who exist outside of the
rigid binaries of gender. The agency was launched by Xoey Fourr in the
early Summer of 2020 as a means of providing support for Trans+ talent
in the commercial modelling world. WIMP has initiated a crucial
conversation about financial reimbursement for models, especially those
who are trans+ and queer. Throughout the month of September, WIMP
invites artists from their roster to guest curate a night celebrating
trans+ talent. The curators for this month are Darkwah, Dodo and
TrashedBaby. TrashedBaby has walked for Loverboy, is a performance
artist, musician and promoter currently focusing on hyperglitch, breaks
and idm. Dodo has hosted Dazed workshops and modelled for Michaela
Stark, featured on the cover of Metal magazine, and is currently one of
the faces of Levi’s. Darkwah is a performer and creator who has
spearheaded WIMP workshops and talks for Dazed alongside Burberry as
well as featuring in a couple upcoming Tim Walker shoots. This is a
space for trans\* power, rage, beauty, resilience, and joy. BodySwap
celebrates and platforms trans\* artists from diverse backgrounds, while
raising crucial funds for organisations that support the community. All
door profits will be donated to a queer organisation or fundraiser of
the guest curator’s choosing. £7 ENTRY

eventsByFilter.name: Dansu Dalston
eventsByFilter.description:
[ Tickets here ][1] ***Japanese artists DJ Jansport, and Big Animal Theory for a one off event and crossover with local London artists Pistashio and support from Ois; Headlined by the coldest to do it, Joe Polar off the back of his last two stellar club tracks Touch/Particle, and killer set at Boomtown, the Cloudcore alumni will be sending us out with a bang. We can promise beats, beverages and one hell of a boogie, with a mix of genres encompassing all aspects of dance music.*** Joe Polar (He/Him) [***https://soundcloud.com/joepolaruk***{::}*** ***][2]***Alongside co-founding popular nights, \'Mid Air\' and \'Roll Through Crew\', Joe Polar has displayed his production finesse through notable releases on Cloudcore, including the collaborative \'Tengo\' featuring Huna and debut solo track \'3Flake\'. His recent release comes in the form of self-release two track EP ‘Touch/Particle\', which was spotlighted in Mary Ann Hobbs \'Music From The Near Futures\' segment on BBC 6 Music. Joe Polar\'s influence extends beyond London. His performances across the city, including Venue MOT Unit 18, Ton of Brix, Aaja Snakepit, and Fox & Firkin, sit alongside international appearances at Korea\'s Cakeshop and Seoul Community Radio.***
PISTASHIO [***https://soundcloud.com/pistashio-wav***][3]*** *** ***PISTASHIO are an electronic music duo, formed by two friends living in post-lockdown London. Where rave-fueled nights replaced relaxed evenings-in, PISTASHIO draw influence from the city that surrounds them and the vibrant scene within it.   Carefully treading the line between lush soundscape and dark underground, the two-piece create opulent texture whilst maintaining a focus on melody. From shimmering ambient pads and infectious vocal cuts, to hard breakbeat samples and pounding 909s; Matt and Tom are inspired by every corner of the UK scene.   Spending the year defining a unique sound and building an extensive drive of demos, PISTASHIO are ready to hit the ground running in 2023: starting with the self-release of their first single \"Without You\" (27th January), followed by an ambitious release schedule and further DJ plans for the year ahead. *** [1]: https://ra.co/events/1763068 [2]: https://soundcloud.com/joepolaruk [3]: https://soundcloud.com/pistashio-wav

eventsByFilter.name: Getting Your Body In Shape For MTF’s - Live Webinar
eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*Online zoom webinar\*\*  
\*\*Monday September 25th\*\*  
\*\*19.00 London, UK (GMT)\*\*

\### Getting Your Body In Shape For MTF\'s

There are so many questions surrounding fitness and physical health for
trans people. In particular for MTF’s. There is such a dramatic change
in physical appearance and the effects of hormones really change the
rules of engagement.

In this webinar we will speak with Liz Ridgway (she/they), a personal
trainer and fitness coach for trans people. Liz will ensure we get to
the bottom of the most commonly asked questions for trans women.

\* How do I stay fit without building muscle?  
\* How will oestrogen effect my abilities?  
\* Will oestrogen make it harder to lose fat?  
\* What exercises are best for trans women?  
\* How does this change what I can eat?  
\* And so much more…

There are very few experts in the fitness field who are working with
transgender women and who are transgender themselves. Liz Ridgway is one
such professional and she is going to help us answer the above questions
and ensure that you understand the most common health and fitness do’s
and don’ts and she will help get your exercise regime right for you.

\### Bonus:

Liz will be on hand to answer your questions live.

Join us for this fitastic webinar and get your beautiful self into the
shape you’ve always dreamed of.

\### Who is this for:

This is an all-inclusive webinar, and you are welcome to join whether
you are trans, you know someone who is trans, or you are just interested
in the topic. We want to create an environment where learning and
sharing is not just possible but encouraged.

\### Register Now To Secure Your Place

\### About Liz Ridgway (she/they):

Liz is a fitness professional, campaigner, and advocate, with a history
of community broadcasting and public speaking. She works directly with
organisations and individuals to enhance the lives of LGBTQ+ people
through inclusion, sport, health, and wellness.

As one of the UK’s few trans feminine Personal Trainers, Liz see’s the
tangible benefits of greater inclusion, fitness training and sporting
participation every day in her work and is passionate about extending
these opportunities and experiences to as many people as possible.

\### Sign Up Now To Secure Your Place

\*\*We will have to limit numbers to make sure that we can host the
event properly, so please RSVP now to avoid disappointment.\*\*

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents THE WITCH (2015)
eventsByFilter.description:
Since Transmissions began its evolution into East London’s premiere film
club nearly two years ago, we’ve been waiting for the right time to
screen Robert Eggers’ almighty classic of modern Horror cinema, and as
we get ever closer to Halloween, the time is finally nigh. Gird your
loins and say your prayers, because The Witch (2015) is here to curdle
your blood. One of the most triumphant debut features of all-time,
Eggers’ immersive New-England folktale also marked the debut of Anya
Taylor-Joy, who launched an enormous career after her performance here
as Thomasin, the eldest child of Christian puritans, excommunicated from
the church for the extremity of their beliefs and forced to live off the
land while superstition, isolation, and unknown forces lay waste to
their family. Hailed upon release by The Satanic Temple as
transformative and empowering, The Witch is ultimately a story about who
suffers most under religious oppression and patriarchy, and within its
chilling Horror trappings is one of the most compelling depictions of
resistance to those powers put to film.  We invite you to venture
downstairs to the deep dark of Dalston Superstore’s basement where we’ll
usher in October’s month of Horror programming a little early with a
screening of one of the very best the genre has to offer.   Tickets
available via OutSavvy Subtitles will be displayed throughout the film.
Seating is a mixture of benches, backed chairs, bar stools, and floor
space, and is first come, first served.

eventsByFilter.name: BodySwap
eventsByFilter.description:
Dalston Superstore’s weekly party BodySwap invites a new trans\* artist,
promoter, or organisation to curate a month of Wednesday night parties
at the venue. Septmeber guest curator: WIMP WIMP is a talent agency
prioritising trans+ talent, the home for models who exist outside of the
rigid binaries of gender. The agency was launched by Xoey Fourr in the
early Summer of 2020 as a means of providing support for Trans+ talent
in the commercial modelling world. WIMP has initiated a crucial
conversation about financial reimbursement for models, especially those
who are trans+ and queer. Throughout the month of September, WIMP
invites artists from their roster to guest curate a night celebrating
trans+ talent. The curators for this month are Darkwah, Dodo and
TrashedBaby. TrashedBaby has walked for Loverboy, is a performance
artist, musician and promoter currently focusing on hyperglitch, breaks
and idm. Dodo has hosted Dazed workshops and modelled for Michaela
Stark, featured on the cover of Metal magazine, and is currently one of
the faces of Levi’s. Darkwah is a performer and creator who has
spearheaded WIMP workshops and talks for Dazed alongside Burberry as
well as featuring in a couple upcoming Tim Walker shoots. This is a
space for trans\* power, rage, beauty, resilience, and joy. BodySwap
celebrates and platforms trans\* artists from diverse backgrounds, while
raising crucial funds for organisations that support the community. All
door profits will be donated to a queer organisation or fundraiser of
the guest curator’s choosing. £7 ENTRY

eventsByFilter.name: Uncles: A Comedy Night presented by Erika Ehler and Pravanya Pillay
eventsByFilter.description: [ TICKETS HERE ][1] *Erika and Pravanya’s uncles are finally doing stand up comedy. They’ve got so many jokes, they’ve got this great one about phones. Plus they’ve got terrible wives!  That’s hours of material right there. It’s really not that hard to do a stand up. * * * *‘Uncles’ is comedy night hosted by Erika and Pravanya’s uncles featuring comedy from their favourite nephew and their nieces by marriage Erika Ehler and Pravanya Pillay. * * * *———————————————————————* * * ***Erika’s*** razor-sharp, dark and visceral writing paired with precise delivery makes her one of the most exciting young comedians on the circuit.  She has quickly become a much in demand writer and comedian working on numerous high profile shows. * * * In 2019, she was crowned winner of the Chortle Student Comedy Award, was the recipient of the Mike Craig Comedy Award, and the Hot Water Roast Battle Champion. She has performed at the Edinburgh Fringe, Latitude Festival, and the Toronto Sketch Festival. Erika has recently written for the upcoming fourth series of Comedy Central’s Roast Battle.* * * ***Pravanya Pillay*** is a stand up comedian and writer. Pravanya delivers surreal, observational comedy from a unique perspective. She is like if Diana, Princess of Wales, did comedy.  * * *She’s a 2023 Chortle Award Best Newcomer Nominee, 2022 Funny Women “One To Watch”, placed joint third in So You Think You’re Funny 2022 and has supported Olga Koch and Sophie Duker on tour.* * * *———————————————————————* * * *Doors: 7pm* * * *£7 Advance* *£7 Pay-It-Forward* *£10 OTD* * * If you are in a position where you cannot afford entry but would like a ticket please email [*info@vfdalston.com*](mailto:info@vfdalston.com) and we will add you to the wait list for the Pay-It-Forward scheme. eventsByFilter.name: Testo Hunkie
eventsByFilter.description:
A party for macho sluts and their 100 boyfriends, girlfriends and
significant fuckers. Testo Hunkie is a social event for the boys and
their pals. Whether you’re a trans twink, butch bruiser or a wee guy
come down from 7pm for a pie and a chat. Our ever popular arm wrestling
competition returns, with a lil difference. This time round we’re
limiting numbers to 16 competitors. DM us on insta if you want to be a
champ. We’ll be celebrating everything punderful and dykonic with our
fashion moment. It’s time to make a statement with your best slogan tee
or show up head to toe logo. STOP BEING POOR. and give us some rich
bitch attitude. See you on the dance floor from 10pm. We’ll have sets
from The Creeps and Karlie Marx to get you up and dancing until our very
reasonable 1am curfew. Join Us For Another Hunksome time. Pies and
gossip: 7pm-10pmArm wrestling: 9pmBest dressed: 10pm DJ’s: 11pm-1am
Chill out space upstairs: 9pm-1am How to find us:Matchstick Piehouse
213-214 Edward PlLondonSE8 5HD Matchstick Piehouse is down a row of
railway arches. The closest stations are New Cross (overground and
national rail) and Deptford (national rail).We have an access fund for
anyone who needs to get a taxi from the station/ nearby. COVID’s still a
thing. Please test and stay home if you feel unwell. Testo Hunkie is an
18+ event. We might have to check your ID. Testo Hunkie is an inclusive,
LGBTQ+ event. We’re here for the celebration of all bodies and gender
expressions. No excuses - acceptance is the bare minimum, babe.
Matchstick Piehouse is wheelchair accessible across the ground floor.
There is an accessible toilet situated next to the bar.There are plenty
of chairs around including sofas and hard backed seats. The chill out
space and balcony is up a set of stairs. Lighting is low in the bar
area, music will be loud and lights will be bright and
flickering.Matchstick Piehouse has a resident cat, if you have allergies
please let us know. Dogs are welcome for the social from 7pm-10pm. Testo
Hunkie is the dream of two trans fags. We’re doing it DIY and raising
some money for trans\* joy whilst we’re at it. We’ll be raising money
for gender-affirming fundraisers through ticket sales and
donations.Money will be distributed to anyone who makes a request. Email
us a link to your fundraising page to testohunkie@gmail.com and we’ll
donate a split of the money raised.

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents Saw (2004)
eventsByFilter.description:
In October at Transmissions we’ll be spoiling you rotten with five
nights to scream about. Join our friendly crowd of regulars downstairs
at Dalston Superstore every week for only the creepiest of vibes to
celebrate the best month of the year. On opening night of our second
annual Horror season, we screen James Wan’s gamechanger Saw (2004). Just
in time for the release of the tenth film, let us take you back to where
it all started with what is – let’s be very real – the best of the
series by at least a few miles. Two men wake up in chains in a bathroom
grimier than anything you’ve experienced at a Pride event, and quickly
realise they’re playing a game where their lives are on the line. “Live
or die, make your choice” Tickets available via OutSavvy Subtitles will
be displayed throughout the film. Seating is a mixture of benches,
backed chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is first come, first
served.

eventsByFilter.name: Free Sarah Jane Baker: Fundraiser
eventsByFilter.description:
Join us on Thursday 5th October for a night of DJs, drag, performance
and readings to raise support for Sarah Jane Baker. She has served the
longest time in prison in UK history for any trans person, and Sarah
Jane was recently put back in the spotlight due to her speech at London
Trans Pride. Initially the police concluded there should be no further
action, but due to an anti-progressive sentiment in society, a hate
campaign in the right wing press, and the intervention of the Home
Secretary, Sarah was put back in jail. Though she has recently been
found not guilty, she remains in a male prison until a parole hearing
currently delayed until April 2024. None of us are free until all of us
are free. £7 ENTRY

eventsByFilter.name: October\'s Friendly Transgender Social Meetup London
eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*Are you Trans and want to meet other trans people in a safe and
social environment?\*\*

Join me and your fellow trans lovelies for a relaxed meetup on
\*\*Thursday October 12th at 19.30 in the Soho, central London area.\*\*

This place has a great buzz and we have our own private space booked!
It\'s a sneaky way to start the weekend early. Come and join us :)

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

We have a private area upstairs in the venue, which is plenty of space
for us all to chat, hear each other and relax.

Thursday is the new start of the weekend. Let\'s use this opportunity to
make some new friends and chat about whatever pleases you.

This event will suit you if you are new to attending the meetup or are
one of our wonderful regulars. It is a popular evening with lots of
different people popping in. There is no need to be nervous. We are all
very friendly and welcoming. You\'ll feel right at home. :)

\*\*What is this meetup?\*\*

This is a relaxed, friendly and inclusive meetup for the trans people of
London. This is an opportunity to make new friends and chat over a
sneaky Thursday drink.

\*\*Who is it for?\*\*

Everyone from the trans community is welcome. This is an opportunity to
be yourself, whatever you identify as. We are inclusive and happy to
welcome you.

\*\*How does it work?\*\*

Your host Ray has booked a private area in a pub in the Soho area. All
you have to do is RSVP and then Ray will message you on the day with the
event location. Then, all you have to do is show up.

Ray will make sure that you meet some new people and get a chance to get
to know your fellow trans buddies. He is very friendly and will welcome
you and make sure you feel comfortable and happy.

It is free to attend, just buy yourself a drink at the bar.

\*\*Please Note:\*\* RSVP is a must as the location (based around Soho)
will be sent by email on the day to those who have RSVP\'d only. RSVP
closes at 16.00 on the day of the event.

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*
eventsByFilter.summary: October\'s Friendly Transgender Social Meetup London

eventsByFilter.name: ArtHaus present Häxan with live score
eventsByFilter.description:
[ ][1] [ Tickets Here ][1] *As we approach Halloween, a special time when the barriers between the
physical world and the spirit world dissolve, ArtHaus make an offering
to you to join them for a screening of Benjamin Christensen’s Häxan
(1922) with improvised live film score. 101 years after it’s release,
Häxan is as potent as ever, combining historical material and folklore
to explore ideas around witchcraft from it’s origins to the early 1920s.
A prime of example of the power of the horror genre, in depicting the
persecution - and so-called treatment - of witchcraft, it allows us an
imaginative space to scrutinise and reflect on ongoing systems of
oppression and misogyny today. *

*  
 *

*ArtHaus is Anika Mottershaw, Lucinda Chua, Fran Lobo, Laura Groves and
Auclair. *

*They come together through a shared enjoyment of sound, weird and
wonderful films and creative community.*

*  
 *

*⛢ Anika Mottershaw*

*  
 *

*Anika is a modular synth head keen on wrangling electrons around
circuits in pursuit of some deeply ephemeral, highly magical sonic
alchemy. Making sounds and noises never to be repeated (and often ugly
or unmusical) feels cathartic, triumphant and playful. Leaning into the
situationists\' concept of dérive, this approach to sound creates an
antidote to the highly structured world we live in today.*

*  
 *

*⛢ Lucinda Chua*

* *

*Artist, composer & multi-instrumentalist Lucinda Chua released her
debut solo album “YIAN” on 4ad earlier this year. Prior to this Chua
wrote, recorded and performed under the moniker “Felix;” releasing two
albums on American independent record label kranky. As a cellist Chua
has toured as part of FKA twigs and Stars of the Lid. In 2019 she
co-wrote the soundtrack to the feature documentary 30HA.*

*  
  
 *

*⛢ Fran Lobo*

* *

*Fran Lobo is a British- Asian singer, songwriter, producer and
performer. She has just released her debut album ‘Burning It Feels Like’
on Heavenly Recordings on 18 August 2023. The album was accompanied by
three self directed short film/music videos which explored dance,
theatre and fantasy.  Previously, she released the Brave EP on Slowdance
recordings as well as performing live with UNKLE on their world tours.
Her work often explores dreams/reality, a search for identity and a
sense of horror which often results in collagist and chopped and screwed
compositions.*

*  
  
  
 *

*⛢ Laura Groves *

* *

*Laura Groves is an artist and producer from Bradford, West Yorkshire.
Her album “Radio Red” was released on Bella Union in August 2023,
following on from her “Private Road” EP, releases on XL Recordings as
Blue Roses and EPs “Thinking About Thinking” and “Committed Language” on
DEEK Recordings. She is a frequent collaborator and has spent over a
decade producing a body of work through a passion for
home/self-recording and layering of voices, acoustic and synthesised
sounds. Her latest album was accompanied by self-directed video work and
she currently hosts an NTS Radio show called Desire Paths, alongside a
series of collaborative improvised music nights of the same name.*

*  
  
  
 *

*⛢ Auclair *

* *

*Auclair is a British-Rwandan music and sound artist. Her work explores
rhythm, voice and electronica - treating everyday life like new
mythologies and taking an embodied approach to exploring ideas with
sound. Alongside a series of releases, her versatility has led to a wide
range of multidisciplinary projects and collaborations. Her latest EP
Giramata is out now on Amorphous Sounds, written/recorded/produced by
Auclair, with additional production and mix from Kwes (Warp Records) and
visuals by Dark Angel Services.*



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/15968/arthaus-present-hxan-with-live-score
eventsByFilter.summary: ArtHaus present Häxan with live score

eventsByFilter.name: Drag Tales
eventsByFilter.description:
Come on down to the queerest bookstore in London, where drag artists
will be reading some of our favourite children\'s books by diverse
authors.

Books like Where The Wild Things Are, Penguin, Girls, The Hug, and many
other classic stories will be read. The focus is to have children see
books they know and love being read by gender-diverse fabulous beings
that exist all across our society. By using stories they’re familiar
with, the whole environment becomes familiar and comfortable.

Expect the unexpected, there might be some singing and if the kids are
old enough, there might also be some games. Kids (as well as the
parents, guardians, or carers) will have time to ask questions at the
end to help further understand drag queens, gender fluidity, and why we
are wearing whatever it is we are wearing.

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Open Decks
eventsByFilter.description:
Queer Open Decks are a support and networking event for any LGBTQ+ DJs
working within London/Online or those looking to learn basic DJ skills.
Started as a small meet up at the London LGBT Centre, they are now a
growing community of genre-fluid LGBTQ+ DJs meeting on a monthly basis.
Sign up details: During the night, we have 6x 20 minute slots from 7-9pm
that you can sign up in advance here, followed by 6 x 30 minute slots
from 9-12pm that you can sign up for on the night. Please note that this
is primarily a social/networking event rather than a club night – we
have the whole venue to ourselves to allow for those wishing to learn to
DJ in a supportive environment alongside. Feel free to bring your
friends and supporters along! FREE ENTRY

eventsByFilter.name: Celestial Bodies Halloween - til 4am!
eventsByFilter.description:
+++ TIX ON THE DOOR FROM 10PM! +++ Hell hath no fury like a they/them
scorned! Dalston Superstore is joining forces with queer makeup brand
Maniacc and turning into the house of horrors this Halloween! The
Celestial Bodies crew are take a trip to the dark side with a devilish
lineup of queer talent from the underworld and beyond. Don your demonic
best and dance among the cursed creatures! We want to see your best
fallen angels, zombies, witches and demons… £50 bar tab and makeup
bundle prize for best look! In the depths of the lazerpit, special guest
DJs F.O.T.U, Ms.G and Milk Shandy will be serving up an assault-course
of drum n bass, breakbeat, house, techno and more. On the top deck,
expect a mixed bag of hyperpop, cvnty house and RnB hits n misses from
Perrinha, Mads Mads, Rodent and Ryan Lovell. Haunting the bar top will
be your gogo dancers Donna The First, Jason, Light and Lust! PLUS we’ll
be raving all the way thru ’til 4am! Strap in babes, it’s going to be a
bumpy ride! £8 before 11 /£10 after

eventsByFilter.name: Saturday Late Brunch Meetup
eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*Let\'s all have a late brunch together in Lambeth.\*\*

\*\*November 4th at 13.00\*\*

\*\*Come and join us for a relaxed social Saturday Brunch, tea or coffee
and make some new trans friends. You\'ll have a great time.\*\*

\*\*The details:\*\*

In collaboration with Lambeth Council, we are very proud to release this
new event, where we can all get together in a relaxed environment and
make new friends.

We are further delighted to support a wonderful LGBT business in the
Streatham area.

\*\*Who is this for:\*\*

This is a great event for everyone whether you are trans or a trans
supporter. (Guests welcome but please message me to ensure there is
space).

Your host will greet and welcome you and will be sure that you are
introduced to everyone at the event. There is no need to be nervous.
You\'ll be made to feel very welcome and you\'ll get a chance to meet
other people just like you.

\*\*SPACES ARE LIMITED AND GET BOOKED UP QUICKLY\*\*

\*\*RSVP Now To Avoid Disappointment\*\*

eventsByFilter.name: A Show Called Thursday with Daniel Foxx
eventsByFilter.description:
[ tickets here ][1] *London\'s hit new comedy night as recommended by the Evening Standard,
LMAOnaise and Londonist as one of the city\'s top comedy nights, returns
to VFD for another month! Featuring their signature mix of stand-up,
alternative, musical and character comedy.*

* *

*This month\'s line-up:*

* *DANIEL FOXX (Comedy Central Live, \'drolly witty and candidly
  persona\' The Scotsman)*

* *SOOZ KEMPNER (Musical Comedy Awards winner, Funny Women Awards
  winner)*

eventsByFilter.name: oestrogeneration fundraiser
eventsByFilter.description:
oestrogeneration is a magazine platform higlighting the voices of trans
women and transfeminine people in the uk – it was born out of anger in a
media climate where we were constantly spoken of, but never in charge of
our own narrative. Oestrogeneration is BACK at Superstore this November,
raising funds for issue two. After the success of our first print issue
on tenacity, we’re excited to work on magazine number two next year. We
aim to continue hiring and platforming trans women to own our narratives
and tell our stories, carving out our own space in the UK media
landscape. Join us for a night of DJs, raffles and an opportunity to buy
our first issue, all helping us raise funds for our continued work.
Hosted by Harietta & Ella Mitchelle, with sets from Trojan Tyne, The
Doll Named Dan and Mya Mehmi, this is one not to miss! £8 before 11 /
£10 after

eventsByFilter.name: Yalla!
eventsByFilter.description:
Yalla! Party Project is an Arts collective based in New York City,
centering QSWANA, QBIPOC and their besties. Their emblematic monthly
dance party features international and local DJs spinning a variety of
world dance music and diasporic sounds spotlighting Arabic pop, South
Asian, Afro, Baile Funk and diverse global grooves honoring the healing
power of intentional spaces and the communities behind them. Yalla!
Party Project also features a rolling artists series throughout the
year, a directory called Yalla! Pages, as well as a market Souk
highlighting Queer and Women owned small businesses. Yalla! London will
feature one of our hottest line ups as we gather to mobilize and raise
money for our siblings in Gaza. A portion of proceeds will go to
emergency water for Gaza, 97% of water there is undrinkable, and clean
water is gravely needed. Bar codes with essential resources, medical aid
help and tool kits will be provided throughout the venue, please don’t
forget to scan them. An additional portion of proceeds of our signature
drink The Warda will be donated to @medicalaidpal.

£10 BEFORE 11 / £12 AFTER

eventsByFilter.name: Femmme Fraiche - til 4am!
eventsByFilter.description:
Femmme Fraiche have one last party left at the mothership Dalston
Superstore before the year is out and on Nov 11th, we’ll be sure to go
out with a bang! And with a special 4am license, we’re giving you an
hour extra for your pleasure. In the basement, our guest headliner is
the London-based, northern-raised, crate digger KT –
the space.dust and SISU resident, renowned for her wizardry on the decks
and sublime selections of rare 90s house, electro, trance, garage,
breaks and everything in-between, we guarantee she’ll keep the basement
pumping right til close. Warming up the lazerpit is the equally as
eclectic and exciting Prague-born Ariane V – The Common ground (fka
Rhythm Sister) resident, is known for her exquisite selections,
frequently drifting through the dreamlike and euphoric to the broken
beat and acid pumpers, and sandwiched between the two is our very own
fave genre-non-conforming resident Michelle Manetti, who completes the
perfect trio, what more could you ask for? A floor of guilty pleasure
did you say? Yeah OK we got that covered too! Opening the night is one
of our faves and regulars Thempress, followed by a return of Karlie
Marx, because she was so damn good at our Trans Pride party, we needed
her back pronto! Then closing upstairs duo of Fraîchness residents Linzi
Symons and Darren Skene on ?2 ? duties with all your trash-tastic faves.
For gogo duties, our firm faves, the fabulous Reenie is joined by Queer
House Party royalty Taali, for ass-shakin’ sexy, sassy, stupendous
bar-top antics. £8 before 11 / £10 after

*We operate a zero tolerance policy* Our event is aimed as a space for
queer wxmn, trans, and non binary folx, although allies and friends are
welcome providing they respect the space.

eventsByFilter.name: November\'s Friendly Transgender Social Meetup London
eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*Are you Trans and want to meet other trans people in a safe and
social environment?\*\*

Join me and your fellow trans lovelies for a relaxed meetup on
\*\*Thursday November 16th at 19.30 in the Soho, central London
area.\*\*

This place has a great buzz and we have our own private space booked!
It\'s a sneaky way to start the weekend early. Come and join us :)

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

We have a private area upstairs in the venue, which is plenty of space
for us all to chat, hear each other and relax.

Thursday is the new start of the weekend. Let\'s use this opportunity to
make some new friends and chat about whatever pleases you.

This event will suit you if you are new to attending the meetup or are
one of our wonderful regulars. It is a popular evening with lots of
different people popping in. There is no need to be nervous. We are all
very friendly and welcoming. You\'ll feel right at home. :)

\*\*What is this meetup?\*\*

This is a relaxed, friendly and inclusive meetup for the trans people of
London. This is an opportunity to make new friends and chat over a
sneaky Thursday drink.

\*\*Who is it for?\*\*

Everyone from the trans community is welcome. This is an opportunity to
be yourself, whatever you identify as. We are inclusive and happy to
welcome you.

\*\*How does it work?\*\*

Your host Ray has booked a private area in a pub in the Soho area. All
you have to do is RSVP and then Ray will message you on the day with the
event location. Then, all you have to do is show up.

Ray will make sure that you meet some new people and get a chance to get
to know your fellow trans buddies. He is very friendly and will welcome
you and make sure you feel comfortable and happy.

It is free to attend, just buy yourself a drink at the bar.

\*\*Please Note:\*\* RSVP is a must as the location (based around Soho)
will be sent by email on the day to those who have RSVP\'d only. RSVP
closes at 16.00 on the day of the event.

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*
eventsByFilter.summary: November\'s Friendly Transgender Social Meetup London

eventsByFilter.name: ¡Que Calor!: Rossana + Mirador + Karma Sheen (DJ)
eventsByFilter.description:
¡QUE CALOR!: ROSSANA + GUESTS: MIRADOR + KARMA SHEEN (DJ SET)

 Rossana brings back the heat wave for one last London date this
year.  After a busy year with multiple runs around Portugal, her debut
LP and UK tour Rossana finishes up this cycle, bringing some brand new
textures to the stage.   
Rossana brings a set of fresh arrangements of Portuguese traditionals,
mixed with themes from her debut LP and some unreleased originals.

Firing up we have the pleasure to host Mirador. An outstanding new band,
self-described as \"a bunch of young silly musicians who love Turkish
Jazz and Armenian Metal\" a genuine testament to their explosive and
multifaceted performances.

Closing down the night will be a special DJ Set by members of
electrifying London-based act Karma Sheen.  Absolute specialists in
crossing their multiple influences into psychedelic fields, we can
expect a set as eclectic and involving as their live sets and brand new
self-titled LP.

 A stellar night, with musical heritage ranging from all sorts of
corners of the world, brought together for a night that will surely get
you sweating.

\+ Guests to be announced

superstars and go-go gremlins poised and ready to lube up those limbs on

Hysteria is a queer night-life fantasy. A space for music-loving queer
women, trans and non-binary folk to whip up a frenzy and get hysterical

eventsByFilter.name: Queer House Party
eventsByFilter.description:
THAT’S RIGHT. WE’RE BACK. Tickets for our first event of 2023 are on
sale now. We’ve had such an incredible time taking QHP on the road, but
we’ve been missing what we love most - creating our own spaces to share
with our community. Bringing together radical and liberatory politics
with some of the best performances, music, and art from the DIY queer
scene. NEW VENUE: We’ve found our new home at Studio 9294, Hackney Wick.
It’s a huge warehouse space with multiple rooms - meaning we will have a
stacked lineup across two rooms with spaces to watch shows, dance, and
chill. TRANS PPL TO THE FRONT: Queer House Party is run by a
predominantly trans team - and while we are a queer party, moving
forward, we’re going to be centering the ongoing fight for trans
liberation and the trans community at all of our parties. Queer House
Party is for everyone - but trans people to the front. EVERYONE IN:
We’ve done our best to keep ticket prices down for everyone. Tickets are
on a sliding scale from £7.50-17.50. If this is still a barrier for you,
please drop us a message, and we will add you to our free list. IMPROVED
ONLINE PARTY: In true alignment with our roots as a party that started
online, we still run our events with live-streams so that anyone can be
included in the club, regardless of geography, financial situation,
disability, and other needs. To make this happen, we’re working with a
brand new streaming service, CastRooms. We’re talking multiple cameras
with high-quality video and audio for everyone who wants to join us
virtually. SAME ACCESS: Studio 9294 is a wheelchair-accessible venue.
Both our IRL and URL events will have BSL, AD, and CC available during
the shows. Free tickets are available for carers and PAs. We will be
following this post up with a more detailed breakdown of the space, but
if you have any specific questions, drop us a line at
queerhouseparty@gmail.com.COVID POLICY: We ask that everyone tests
before attending to try and keep the party as safe as possible. If you
can’t get hold of a test before the event, there will be a covid testing
station outside the venue. We will not ask for proof that you have
tested. Cover image - Bex Wade

eventsByFilter.name: Pumping Velvet - til 4am!
eventsByFilter.description:
The nights are growing longer, our limbs are getting colder and the rain
pours down. Come and shake off your seasonal depression and warm those
feet with a night of ecstatic dancing at Pumping Velvet! Leading our
winter warmer is Puerto Rican-American DJ and producer Juan Ramos. Juan
is a resident at Berlin’s fabled Cocktail d’Amore party and his elusive
mixing and fearless selection works to keep the floor guessing but
always dancing. Joining Juan downstairs will be Michael Upson, founder
and resident DJ of Leeds based, pumping queer club night, Love Muscle.
Love Muscle is rightly regarded as one of the best underground queer
parties in the country and Michael will be bringing some of that magic
down with him as he plays Superstore for the very first time. Opening
proceedings will be babyschön, who hosts a regular show on NARR radio
and plays just the kind of lithe and sleazy italo, boogie & synth-pop we
love so much. Upstairs sees a wavy night of music as Edith Escobar and
Sports Maximum step up with sets bound to span amapiano, R&B and club
edits, before rising star Goh Well closes out the night with a cute and
fun blend of house and garage. Come pump some velvet ? £7 BEFORE 11 /
£10 AFTER

working within London/Online or those looking to learn basic DJ skills.

growing community of genre-fluid LGBTQ+ DJs meeting on a monthly basis.

that you can sign up in advance here, followed by 6 x 30 minute slots
from 9-12pm that you can sign up for on the night. Please note that this

eventsByFilter.name: Folktales Presents Afro Groove & Latin Rhythm Party
eventsByFilter.description:
Join us for our second segment of Folktales World Music live at the
Folklore where we are joined this time round by the legendary Bene Tally
Band of Senegalese and West African heritage and the rhythm centric
Andean Afro-latin fusion delights of LOKANDES.

Converging at the magnificent forest of lore on 186 Hackney Road - Bene
Tally Band which was formerly initiated by master Dembis Thioung, brings
with them a unique and organic sound of Senegalese/ West African
percussion rhythms, ancestral songs and choreographies which weave
various Afro-Latin traditional musical forms and instruments against the
bass heavy sound of the West African Dundun drum.

Expect to be entranced by the engaging and co-creative atmosphere of
traditional song, reflexive dance at the primal rhythm and the
opportunity to connect to your deeper self, others and life itself
through the deeply hypnotic and seductive rhythm.

We’ll then be graced by the unconventional and alternative sound of
Lokandes - a name reflecting the eclectic fusion of Andean instruments
with contemporary genres such as Reggae, Cumbia, Ska, Jazz, Rumba Folk
and funky Latin rhythms all of which make this band an experience not to
be missed.

The band brings together a diverse cast of musicians from Peru, Bolivia,
Panama, Chile, Spain & Cuba and is lead by their charismatic leader
Kanti of Peruvian descent horning their unique sound, alongside socially
conscious lyrics and a super-tight rhythm section drawing awareness to
the diverse Latin-American and global cultures.

In true collaborative Folktales fashion, we will end the night with a
collective improv jam with both bands joined and supported by the
musical gifts of Gnawa Master - Simo Lagnawi and the Audio.sync
Collective for an unforgettable night of dancing, connecting and
celebration of culture and unity in rhythm.

Secure your ticket and see you Friday 24th at the Folklore, 186 Hackney
Rd. E2 7QL.
eventsByFilter.summary: Folktales Presents Afro Groove & Latin Rhythm Party

returns, just find Lori Mae and sign up for a chance to be the champ of

See you on the dance floor from 6pm. We’ll have sets from Eli la nuit

celebration of all bodies and gender expressions. No excuses -
acceptance is the bare minimum, babe. Testo Hunkie is the dream of two

eventsByFilter.name: Frank Malachi - Quantum Happiness
eventsByFilter.description:
**About**

Frank Malachi presents their EP Quantum Happiness, a reflection on
sentience, artificiality and virtual immersiveness. The album is a
journey through the arpeggiated wave-forms of the Omnichord recapturing
much of the 80\'s nostalgia. Pedalled by the era of Casio keyboards and
machine drum effects, Quantum Happiness is shaped like a scientific love
letter - (“Oxytocin+Serotonin+Dopamine”).

**Stage Times**

20:00 Bella Unwin

21:00 Frank Malachi

**Bio**

Frank Malachi @frank\_malachi\_music

Frank Malachi is an Audio-Visual Artist, Producer and
Multi-Instrumentalist. Their EP entitled “Quantum Happiness” is a
philosophical axe that excavates the layers of our growingly
desensitized bodies, speaking volumes through choruses of electronic
voices in a mating dance, in turn confronting our computerised selves.
In a progressively dehumanised culture where virtual immersiveness and
artificiality take precedence an atomic autopsy of happiness looks at
the economy of emotional value through much of this digital age.

Frank examines the flux of happiness through a wider lens, influencing
the thermostat arrow movements between the latitudes of lust or sorrow.
Franks music casts a graphic of extreme polar ends making pure
contemplation not so far from absolute alienation.

Will Pinocchio ever be a real boy? Will the cyborg ever destroy?

Bella Unwin @bellaunwin

Bella Unwin is a London based producer baking up beeps, boops and funky
loops. After experimenting with varying different genres of electronic
dance music, Bella’s sets explore 80’s beats and aesthetics, from techno
to house music. Dancing is also expected - but not compulsory.

eventsByFilter.name: BodySwap
eventsByFilter.description:
Dalston Superstore’s weekly party for the trans+ community BodySwap
returns in November! Every Wednesday from 10pm, curators Harietta and
Karlie Marx play Transgender Dance Music along with guest DJs, gogos and
cvnty club kids. It’s the only place to be on a Wednesday night in
Dalston!  This is a space for trans\* power, rage, beauty, resilience,
and joy. BodySwap celebrates and platforms trans\* artists from diverse
backgrounds, while raising crucial funds. BodySwap is by and for trans
people. Each week we raise money for a trans person’s healthcare
fundraiser with our door profits, so come through and party in community
with the transexuals of Kingsland Road.  £7 ENTRY

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Tarot Reading Workshop
eventsByFilter.description:
Dive a little deeper into the tarot deck and expand your practice with
our Queer Tarot nights. In each session we will explore a theme -
looking at a smaller series of cards, exploring new spreads, sharing
creative approaches to the deck and reading for one another. These
nights are perfect for finding more depth in your readings, for learning
from each other and for sharing your practice in a queer space. Together
we will explore what it means to queer the tarot by growing our
understanding of the deck as a community.These nights will be
facilitated by Sarah April Lamb - follow her instagram @findme\_fool for
updates on what themes we will be discovering. They are suitable for
people with a little bit of experience with tarot, looking to expand
their practice. If you're curious and totally new to tarot look out for
our 'Intro to Tarot' events. Bring along a journal and pen, and if you
have your own tarot deck (or collection) please do bring along your
cards. Sarah has a few to go around if you don't have your own. Date:
Thursday 14 December 2023, 7-8:30pm Location: The Glitch, 134 Lower
Marsh, London, SE1 7AE (5 minutes walk from Waterloo underground
station)Cost: £10 (please book in advance as we have venue
caps)Accessibility: The venue is wheelchair accessible, with step-free
access to toilets.Sappho Events welcomes LGBTQIA+ women, trans and
non-binary people to our events

eventsByFilter.name: December\'s Friendly Transgender Social Meetup London
eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*It\'s been a big year! Let\'s all celebrate together and enjoy a few
drinks and some fun!\*\*

Join me and your fellow trans lovelies for a relaxed meetup on
\*\*Thursday Dec 14th at 19.30 in the Soho, central London area.\*\*

\*\*As its Christmas, lets do a Cheesy Christmas thing and wear
something Christmassy! 😃\*\*

This place has a great buzz and we have our own private space booked!
It\'s a sneaky way to start the weekend early. Come and join us :)

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

We have a private area upstairs in the venue, which is plenty of space
for us all to chat, hear each other and relax.

Thursday is the new start of the weekend. Let\'s use this opportunity to
make some new friends and chat about whatever pleases you.

This event will suit you if you are new to attending the meetup or are
one of our wonderful regulars. It is a popular evening with lots of
different people popping in. There is no need to be nervous. We are all
very friendly and welcoming. You\'ll feel right at home. :)

\*\*What is this meetup?\*\*

This is a relaxed, friendly and inclusive meetup for the trans people of
London. This is an opportunity to make new friends and chat over a
sneaky Thursday drink.

\*\*Who is it for?\*\*

Everyone from the trans community is welcome. This is an opportunity to
be yourself, whatever you identify as. We are inclusive and happy to
welcome you.

\*\*How does it work?\*\*

Your host Ray has booked a private area in a pub in the Soho area. All
you have to do is RSVP and then Ray will message you on the day with the
event location. Then, all you have to do is show up.

Ray will make sure that you meet some new people and get a chance to get
to know your fellow trans buddies. He is very friendly and will welcome
you and make sure you feel comfortable and happy.

It is free to attend, just buy yourself a drink at the bar.

\*\*Please Note:\*\* RSVP is a must as the location (based around Soho)
will be sent by email on the day to those who have RSVP\'d only. RSVP
closes at 16.00 on the day of the event.

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*
eventsByFilter.summary: December\'s Friendly Transgender Social Meetup London

eventsByFilter.description:
Are you ready for an evening of the glitziest balls you\'ve ever seen?
The drag queens and kings of Dragged Around London are taking over The
Fox\'s social room to bring you a Drag Bingo extravaganza every
Thursday! 

Gather your friends, put on your fiercest outfits, and prepare for a
night filled with hilarious banter and the chance to win fabulous
prizes. This is not your grandma\'s bingo night (though I bet she\'ll
love it too!)

The event is free to attend (please reserve to ensure you get a spot in
the room!), with the bingo cards costing £5 each on the night. Prizes
for the winners include shots and drinks from The Fox bar, Dragged
Around London walking tour voucher, and a rolling jackpot up for grabs
in the final game each week!

  
More info and to reserve a seat: [https://tinyurl.com/foxsbingoroyale][1]

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Open Decks
eventsByFilter.description:
Queer Open Decks are a support and networking event for any LGBTQ+ DJs
working within London/Online or those looking to learn basic DJ skills.
Started as a small meet up at the London LGBT Centre, they are now a
growing community of genre-fluid LGBTQ+ DJs meeting on a monthly basis.
Sign up details: During the night, we have 6x 20 minute slots from 7-9pm
that you can sign up in advance here, followed by 6 x 30 minute slots
from 9-12pm that you can sign up for on the night. Please note that this
is primarily a social/networking event rather than a club night – we
have the whole venue to ourselves to allow for those wishing to learn to
DJ in a supportive environment alongside. Feel free to bring your
friends and supporters along! FREE ENTRY Door Policy Dalston Superstore
is a queer space. We prioritise our LGBTQIA+ customers and will

eventsByFilter.name: Drag Tales
eventsByFilter.description:
Come on down to the queerest bookstore in London, where drag artists
will be reading some of our favourite children\'s books by diverse
authors.

Books like Where The Wild Things Are, Penguin, Girls, The Hug, and many
other classic stories will be read. The focus is to have children see
books they know and love being read by gender-diverse fabulous beings
that exist all across our society. By using stories they’re familiar
with, the whole environment becomes familiar and comfortable.

Expect the unexpected, there might be some singing and if the kids are
old enough, there might also be some games. Kids (as well as the
parents, guardians, or carers) will have time to ask questions at the
end to help further understand drag queens, gender fluidity, and why we
are wearing whatever it is we are wearing.

community BodySwap returns… IT’S A CHRISTMAS MIRACLE! Transvisions is
back at Dalston Superstore on Wednesday 20th December to join forces
with BodySwap! Joining us is the icon that made Wednesdays
transgender, Lucia Blayke upstairs with Harietta, while Karlie
Marx & Ayu Mesi bring 140bpm jungle to the basement. Fundraising for
Trans\* health funds as always ?? BodySwap is a space for trans\* power,
rage, beauty, resilience, and joy. BodySwap celebrates and platforms
trans\* artists from diverse backgrounds, while raising crucial funds.
BodySwap is by and for trans people. Each week we raise money for a
trans person’s healthcare fundraiser with our door profits, so come
through and party in community with the transexuals of Kingsland Road.

£7 ENTRY

eventsByFilter.name: Dalston Superstore NYE Bash!
eventsByFilter.description:
Join your favourite queer pleasure palace as we bid farewell to 2023
with a big fat house party for you and all your babes this New Year’s
Eve! We’ve stacked the lineup with from top to bottom with our favourite
queer rising star DJs, drag performers and gogo dancers to end this year
with almighty bang baby! In the lazerpit, it’s gonna be fast ‘n’ loose
all night, with the finest bassline, hard house, techno and electro
from MS.G (High Tea), Lovecat (Arize) and Ellefire (2Girls1Tuck)! On the
top deck, expect wall-to-wall hot mess pop, RnB, cvnty house and disco
from Trojan Tyne, Jane Norman, Zaleel and Karlie Marx! PLUS leading the
countdown and slut-dropping into 2024 are your gogo babes Loren
Dell’Arco, The Doll Named Dan and Cherry! LIMITED EARLYBIRD TIX: £10 
GENERAL ADMISSION: £12 ON THE DOOR: £15

– FEMME FATALE DJS – HOT BABES – FIERCE BEATS – EMPOWERING ENVIRONMENT –
QUEER MAGIC – SH\*T LOADS OF VINYL Picture this: a night where the beats
are as fierce as the talent behind them, and where every drop is a
testament to the power and skills of femme and nonbinary turntablists!
Through Vinyl Bitch open deck events, we seek to inspire, showcase, and
elevate the art of turntablism which overwhelmingly favors cisgender
men. Want to get involved? SIGN UP HERE! Want to be spontaneous!? Enjoy
free for all sets from 10 pm to midnight! Perhaps you want to go b2b
with a new bestie, take an encore, or walk in off Kingsland Road! Want
to play but don’t own any vinyl? NO PROBLEM! WE GOT YOU! We also offer
tutorials at the beginning of each event! 7pm. – 10pm SIGN UP SETS 10pm
– Midnight FREE FOR ALL SETS

eventsByFilter.name: RIPOSTE QUEER ART RAVE
eventsByFilter.description:
Riposte is a queer art-rave aiming to facilitate connections between
strangers. A full on sweaty RAVE where you have nice spaces for good
chats, installations, performances, everything to make good memories and
have fun. This is a large scale event on 4 floors, 8 rooms (2
dancefloors, 1 playroom, 1 chill room, 1 performance room, 2 bars). It
is mainly attended by alternative queer people across the whole LGBT+
spectrum with many gender non-confirming people. Strong allies are
welcome 🏳️‍🌈🏳️‍⚧️ This is a RAVE, be ready to SWEAT. We will open at 9pm
with a "social" , a moment before the music start to meet new people and
make cute connections and at 5.30am until 6am in the Courtyard: free
BREAKFAST so you have time to gather your thoughts and find your
friends.Ceasefire now
🇵🇸❤️----------------------------------ACCESSIBILITY INFORMATIONS-Stairs
across the venue (both of the main dance floors are up long flights of
stairs, roughly 30 each). -Groundfloor (chill space, playroom, bar
&amp; quieter room) accessible with no stairs, levelled access,
accessible toilets (please ask: there is 4 different toilets ground
floor so it can be tricky to find. ). Please note that the courtyard
floor partially has cobbles.-Some areas are quite dark (stairs).-Strobe
lights (normally, only on top floor dancefloor).-If you do not have the
means to pay for a ticket, please send us a DM on instagram or email us
at least a few days before the event. We encourage to pay at least
concession price as it is a hella pricey &amp; time consuming event
to put on, put we can also offer free tickets if needed. This offers if
only available before we are sold out.-Covid: we follow the U.K. gov
guidelines and tests are not required upon entry but welfare has self
test kids as well as masks upon demands.-Welfare can also provide you
with free: food, safer sex products (condoms, lube, dental damns) as
well as gloves, finger gloves, wet wipes, hand sanitisers, lollipops,
menstruation products &amp; non-judgmental chats to resolve any
problems you might have. They can also provide a uber service if needed
(please only use if really in need: we have a limited amount of funds
dedicated to this scheme). The welfare is a fully queer, very diverse
team of ravers that are trained and have seen it all. There is also SIA
security &amp; medics on site.Please contact
riposte.london@gmail.com or DM us on
https://www.instagram.com/riposte.london if you have any questionENTRY
REQUIREMENTS- This is an 18+ event- Valid form of PHYSICAL ID
(photocopies / pictures not accepted) with a picture: please check
Electrowerkz website to see what form of ID is accepted. Plan
accordingly and tell your friends. No ID no entry.- A ticket (no tickets
on the door if we are sold out)-You will be searched by security upon
entry (body search + bag) &amp; your ID will be scanned as in all
major London venue. You can ask for someone specific to search you.-Last
entry 2.30amIf these requirements are not respected, you will not be
able to gain entry and you will not get
refunded.---------------------------------- LINE UP
----------------------------------DJsTOP FLOOR10 DESIREE 11.30 REENIE
12.30 ASHTREY 1.30 YIOTA 2.30 S RUSTON 4.30 RCKT MIDDLE FLOOR10 LO-LOW
11.30 DJ PEGGASUS12.30 GRMCK 1.30 CARMEN 2.30 NINA PIXINA 3.30 ALTERUM
PLAYROOM10 PAWEL KETARSIS 12 EMMALLY 2 ANAHITA SHAMSEI 3.30 TSUNIMAN
PERFORMANCESAGRONABILLY GIGURTSISBINKY STANXXXCO KENDRAHDAVID PUCK
DRAGELKLITTLE BIRDMARIANNASHAWN NAYARWHET COLLECTIVE STALLSALEXANDRA
FERREIRACUTIE GEMSMANIACCOMINATINA'S APOTEACARYTINKERBEL CREATESVISUAL
ARTISTS / INSTALLATIONSBUNNY PEBBLE JAYCLAUDIO PESTANADUCK TAPE
