eventsByFilter.name: Femmme Fraiche - 8th Birthday!
eventsByFilter.description:
Can you believe it, we’re turning 8! A whole 8 fabulous year’s we’ve
been throwing magical FLINTA focused parties at the mothership Dalston
Superstore – so come celebrate with us on Jan 13th. In the basement,
we’ve got a very special Back to Back for you, the one you’ve all been
waiting for, the first (but prob not last) pairing of these two queer
icons, our resident Michelle Manetti will go cheek to cheek with
Hysterical babe, Homodrop hun, Marie Malarie. Expect Hi-NRG, Hands in
the air, dancefloor Euphoria. Joining them in the basement for warm-up
duties is BDE resident DSS fave, bass lover Sadidas. A bumper basement
line-up for our Birthday, what more could you ask for? A top floor of
top-notch treats? Yep we got that covered too! Opening duties is a
Fèmmme Fraîche fave and regular Thempress, followed by another Fèmmme
Fraîche fave Areola Grand Latte aka Grace Goslin, with closing upstairs
from our fave duo of Fraîchness, Fèmmme Fraîche residents Linzi Symons
and Darren Skene on Babe2Babe duties with all your trash-tastic faves.
For gogo duties, our firm faves, the fabulous Reenie is joined by Queer
House Party royalty Taali, for ass-shakin’ sexy, sassy, stupendous
bar-top antics. With a small selection of £5 early bird tickets and a
limited number of General Admission tickets for sale online – these
allow you Q-jump and are valid for entry until 11pm only. Once these
have sold out, entry will be general admission tickets available on the
door, on the night. £8 before 11 / £10 after

Our event is FLINTA focused and aimed as a space for queer wxmn, Trans,
NB, and they will be given priority. Allies and friends are welcome,
providing they respect the space. ?

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Open Decks
eventsByFilter.description:
Queer Open Decks are a support and networking event for any LGBTQ+ DJs
working within London/Online or those looking to learn basic DJ skills.
Started as a small meet up at the London LGBT Centre, they are now a
growing community of genre-fluid LGBTQ+ DJs meeting on a monthly basis.
Sign up details: During the night, we have 6x 20 minute slots from 7-9pm
that you can sign up in advance here, followed by 6 x 30 minute slots
from 9-12pm that you can sign up for on the night. Please note that this
is primarily a social/networking event rather than a club night – we
have the whole venue to ourselves to allow for those wishing to learn to
DJ in a supportive environment alongside. Feel free to bring your
friends and supporters along! FREE ENTRY Door Policy Dalston Superstore

returns for the new year! Every Wednesday from 10pm, curators Harietta
and Karlie Marx play Transgender Dance Music along with guest DJs, gogos
and cvnty club kids. It’s the only place to be on a Wednesday night in
Dalston!  This is a space for trans\* power, rage, beauty, resilience,
and joy. BodySwap celebrates and platforms trans\* artists from diverse
backgrounds, while raising crucial funds. BodySwap is by and for trans
people. Each week we raise money for a trans person’s healthcare
fundraiser with our door profits, so come through and party in community
with the transexuals of Kingsland Road.  FREE ENTRY

eventsByFilter.name: Book Club - Trans Discussion! :)
eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*Join Us For Our Brand New Book Club.\*\*

\*\*Thursday January 18th 2024\*\*  
\*\*19.30 – 21.00, London UK (GMT)\*\*  
\*\*Kennington Area & Zoom\*\*

\*\*Available in-person and online. While we have booked a location, we
will also have the ability for your to join via zoom.\*\*

\*\*We are thrilled to announce this new meetup activity that will
happen quarterly.\*\*

As one of the requests from members we are delighted to make this event
a reality. Participating is very easy. All you have to do is read the
book below and then come to the meetup with your book and anything
you\'d like to discuss about the book. Nothing is off the table!

The book club will be supported by your host and will ensure that
everyone both in-person and online get an opportunity to discuss their
thoughts on the book.

\*\*The book we are going to discuss is:\*\*  
Amateur, A Reckoning with Gender, Identity, and Masculinity.

\*\*\[You can buy your copy via Amazon
HERE\]([https://www.amazon.co.uk/Amateur-True-Story-About-Makes-ebook/dp/B079HW5N56/ref=sr\_1\_1?crid=J9HY65I994C2&amp;keywords=amateur+a+reckoning&amp;qid=1700232914&amp;sprefix=amateur+a+reckoning%2Caps%2C80&amp;sr=8-1][1])\*\*

We \*\*DO NOT\*\* get any money for the book purchased. That\'s between
you and the author.

\*\*Who this is for:\*\*  
Anyone who is transgender or supporting transgender and wants to do
something a little different. To enjoy themselves and take some down
time while expressing themselves through art. This is a friendly and
supportive environment where everyone, regardless of their artistic
abilities are welcome.

\*\*WHEN YOU RSVP Please message Ray to let us know if you will attend
in person or via Zoom.\*\*

\*\*About Us:\*\*  
This event is part of a series of events run by the London Transgender
Meetup Group, sponsored by Lambeth Council and supported by LGBT Hero.

\### Sign Up Now To Secure Your Place

\*\*We will have to limit numbers to make sure that we can host the
event properly, so please RSVP now to avoid disappointment.\*\*



[1]: https://www.amazon.co.uk/Amateur-True-Story-About-Makes-ebook/dp/B079HW5N56/ref=sr_1_1?crid=J9HY65I994C2&amp;keywords=amateur+a+reckoning&amp;qid=1700232914&amp;sprefix=amateur+a+reckoning%2Caps%2C80&amp;sr=8-1

eventsByFilter.name: DOGZ OR GODZ
eventsByFilter.description:
Dogz or Godz possess the audacity of hip-hop and the rebellious spirit
of punk.

The London-based band kicks mediocrity firmly in the b\*llox. Their
first single, \'SCUM\', was released in March 2023. Legend has it that
Liam Howlett of ‘The Prodigy’ heard the original demo and liked it so
much that he asked if he could sprinkle a little dirt on it. The result
was a sonic bullet to the brain, swiftly followed by the anthems
\'ENERGY,\' \'F\*\*K IT,\' and \'HARD,\' each hitting the top of the
charts on iTunes and Amazon. July 2023, they completely sold out their
first ever gig while headlining the Camden Rocks Festival.

The Camden gig skyrocketed Dogz or Godz\'s profile, catching the
attention of one of Europe\'s largest festivals, Boomtown, and its
70,000-strong audience. Outside of London, the band is relatively
unknown, that is about to change. Boomtown invited Dogz or Godz to close
out their Vault Stage on August 13, 2023. The crowd couldn\'t get enough
of their festival anthems and charismatic stage presence, leading to a
flood of demands for their next gig. In October 2023, Dogz or Godz
performed for Darco Recordings, a new label led by former Island Records
CEO Darcus Beese. Dogz or Godz are more than just a band; it\'s a
rebellion in motion. Their music resonates with outcasts, rebels,
nonconformists, and those who refuse to bow to the masses. With their
middle finger firmly up, the D.O.G. continue to stick it to the man. DIG
THE NEW BREED...

eventsByFilter.name: Pumping Velvet
eventsByFilter.description:
The festive season may be over but joy, good tidings and a tasty
stuffing are always to be found at a Pumping Velvet party. For their
January do PV are teaming up with Manchester-based All Hands on Deck, a
collective for women, trans and non-binary DJs. Not just a famed Tinashe
bop, AHOD work to broaden participation in the underground-dance music
scene through their open-deck parties and DJ workshops, which they have
run at festivals like We Out Here, Supernormal and Headroom.  AHOD deck
residents Abena, ANNa & Hayter Player are also incredible DJs, each with
their own distinctive style, blending a wide-range of boops, bangers,
bleeps and bops. Together they will be taking over our beloved sweatbox
basement all night long. Check out Abena’s recent Boiler Room for
receipts on the damage they do in the club! Upstairs local Dalston hero
and TRANSENDANCE DJ Mads Mads, Balamii radio resident Bratmode and
Frizzy D, founder of the queer events collective Hunnisuckle, will take
us through to the early hours with a diverse mix of pop, R&BA, garage
and global bangers.  Come pump some velvet! £7 BEFORE 11 / £10 AFTER

eventsByFilter.name: January\'s Friendly Transgender Social Meetup London
eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*FYI Change of Date. Event now happening on Thursday 25th January. -
Sorry everyone, due to the train and tube strike for 8-12th of Jan,
I\'ve changed the date of this meetup, otherwise none of you will be
able to attend, me included.\*\*

\*\*Are you Trans and want to meet other trans people in a safe and
social environment?\*\*

Join me and your fellow trans lovelies for a relaxed meetup on
\*\*Thursday January 25th at 19.30 in the Soho, central London area.\*\*

This place has a great buzz and we have our own private space booked!
It\'s a sneaky way to start the weekend early. Come and join us :)

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

We have a private area upstairs in the venue, which is plenty of space
for us all to chat, hear each other and relax.

Thursday is the new start of the weekend. Let\'s use this opportunity to
make some new friends and chat about whatever pleases you.

This event will suit you if you are new to attending the meetup or are
one of our wonderful regulars. It is a popular evening with lots of
different people popping in. There is no need to be nervous. We are all
very friendly and welcoming. You\'ll feel right at home. :)

\*\*What is this meetup?\*\*

This is a relaxed, friendly and inclusive meetup for the trans people of
London. This is an opportunity to make new friends and chat over a
sneaky Thursday drink.

\*\*Who is it for?\*\*

Everyone from the trans community is welcome. This is an opportunity to
be yourself, whatever you identify as. We are inclusive and happy to
welcome you.

\*\*How does it work?\*\*

Your host Ray has booked a private area in a pub in the Soho area. All
you have to do is RSVP and then Ray will message you on the day with the
event location. Then, all you have to do is show up.

Ray will make sure that you meet some new people and get a chance to get
to know your fellow trans buddies. He is very friendly and will welcome
you and make sure you feel comfortable and happy.

It is free to attend, just buy yourself a drink at the bar.

\*\*Please Note:\*\* RSVP is a must as the location (based around Soho)
will be sent by email on the day to those who have RSVP\'d only. RSVP
closes at 16.00 on the day of the event.

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*
eventsByFilter.summary: January\'s Friendly Transgender Social Meetup London

eventsByFilter.name: Charlie Barnes + Hannah Lou Clark + Foxette Moxy
eventsByFilter.description:
Charlie Barnes announces his first London headline show since before the
you-know-what, at the beautiful FOLKLORE.

Hailing from the midlands, Charlie is a musician who wears many varied
hats. Since 2010, he has released five albums (four under his own name,
one as the lead singer and songwriter of alt-country duo The Society
Pages) and was the arranger and musical director behind Bastille’s MTV
Unplugged live album. As well as making music of his own, Charlie has
spent the last eight and a half years as Bastille’s touring member,
playing guitar, keys, bass, percussion and backing vocals, performing
all over the world on some of its most celebrated stages. He was also
the opening act for the band’s 2018 ‘ReOrchestrated’ tour, performing
acoustic renditions of songs from his ‘Oceanography’ album, and was at
the production and mixing helm for two songs from the band’s most recent
studio album release, ‘Give Me The Future & Dreams of the Past’.

Support on the night will come from Charlie\'s good friend Adam Smith,
known for his work with the band Temples, who will be making his first
live appearance as \'Foxette Moxy\', a new psychedelic pop solo project.
Also performing will be one of Charlie\'s favourite artists, the amazing
Hannah Lou Clark, who plays grungy, lo-fi pop with wickedly smart
melodies.
eventsByFilter.summary: Charlie Barnes + Hannah Lou Clark + Foxette Moxy

legends with a global reach.

G. Pal gained international recognition with releases on some of the
most respected labels in the field, such as Yoshitoshi Recordings,
Plastic City and Bedrock Records. His tracks have been featured in the
sets of many prominent DJs in the electronic music scene, which have
solidified his reputation as a talented artist.

Get ready for a night with high energy levels of melodic techno,
progressive and house rhythms in an intimate setting. Joined by Kris
Joy, our upcoming Athenian London resident DJ, this is one for the
books!

eventsByFilter.name: VINYL BITCH: OPEN DECKS
eventsByFilter.description:
On the first Monday of every month: – FEMME FATALE DJS – HOT BABES
– FIERCE BEATS – EMPOWERING ENVIRONMENT – QUEER MAGIC – SH\*T LOADS OF
VINYL Picture this: a night where the beats are as fierce as the talent
behind them, and where every drop is a testament to the power and skills
of femme and nonbinary turntablists! Through Vinyl Bitch open deck
events, we seek to inspire, showcase, and elevate the art of turntablism
which overwhelmingly favors cisgender men. Want to get involved? SIGN UP
HERE! Want to be spontaneous!? Enjoy free for all sets from 10 pm to
midnight! Perhaps you want to go b2b with a new bestie, take an encore,
or walk in off Kingsland Road! Want to play but don’t own any vinyl? NO
PROBLEM! WE GOT YOU! We also offer tutorials at the beginning of each
event! 7pm. – 10pm SIGN UP SETS 10pm – Midnight FREE FOR ALL SETS

eventsByFilter.name: February\'s Friendly Transgender Social Meetup London
eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*Are you Trans and want to meet other trans people in a safe and
social environment?\*\*

Join me and your fellow trans lovelies for a relaxed meetup on
\*\*Thursday February 8th at 19.30 in the Soho, central London area.\*\*

This place has a great buzz and we have our own private space booked!
It\'s a sneaky way to start the weekend early. Come and join us :)

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

We have a private area upstairs in the venue, which is plenty of space
for us all to chat, hear each other and relax.

Thursday is the new start of the weekend. Let\'s use this opportunity to
make some new friends and chat about whatever pleases you.

This event will suit you if you are new to attending the meetup or are
one of our wonderful regulars. It is a popular evening with lots of
different people popping in. There is no need to be nervous. We are all
very friendly and welcoming. You\'ll feel right at home. :)

\*\*What is this meetup?\*\*

This is a relaxed, friendly and inclusive meetup for the trans people of
London. This is an opportunity to make new friends and chat over a
sneaky Thursday drink.

\*\*Who is it for?\*\*

Everyone from the trans community is welcome. This is an opportunity to
be yourself, whatever you identify as. We are inclusive and happy to
welcome you.

\*\*How does it work?\*\*

Your host Ray has booked a private area in a pub in the Soho area. All
you have to do is RSVP and then Ray will message you on the day with the
event location. Then, all you have to do is show up.

Ray will make sure that you meet some new people and get a chance to get
to know your fellow trans buddies. He is very friendly and will welcome
you and make sure you feel comfortable and happy.

It is free to attend, just buy yourself a drink at the bar.

\*\*Please Note:\*\* RSVP is a must as the location (based around Soho)
will be sent by email on the day to those who have RSVP\'d only. RSVP
closes at 16.00 on the day of the event.

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*
eventsByFilter.summary: February\'s Friendly Transgender Social Meetup London

eventsByFilter.name: Gimmie Gimmie Gimme - Fun Live Music Gig Night
eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*Wanna hear some great live music, have a boogie and enjoy a few
drinks?\*\*

\*\*Friday February 9th 18:00 – 23:00\*\*  
\*\*Amp Studios presents\*\*  
\*\*Gimme! Gimme! Gimme!\*\*  
\*\*Fundraiser for Tombo Oozebo to get rid of his tits.\*\*

We are delighted to have the ability to support a member of the trans
community, via their event to assist in payment for their top surgery.
It’s an ingenious way to raise funding and we are all for it.

\*\*Here’s what you need to know.\*\*  
This is a ticketed event that is NOT run by us and ALL the proceeds to
towards the surgery. (Tickets are £15)

A night of queer punk entertainment from The Oozes, Gender Crisis and an
extra special one night and one night only performance of/by \"TOMBO AND
THE AMOOZING C-ABBA-RET\" giving you punk covers of every single song
from Mamma Mia!!!

If that wasn\'t enough... the night will end with LIVE BAND KARAOKE
where you can scream/shout some absolute classics backed by our very own
Olly, Cherry and Ciara of the Oozes.

All ticket revenue will go towards Tom\'s Top Surgery Fund:
[https://www.gofundme.com/f/87u86y-toms-top-surgery-fundraiser][1]

There will also be bits of artwork + merch available of which sales will
also go towards the fundraiser!

\*\*Please do come\*\*

The venue has a step-free entrance and level access throughout, and an
accessible toilet.

\*\*What’s Happening\*\*  
\*\*18:00 Doors open\*\*

\*\*19:00 The Oozes\*\*  
\[Listen on
Spotify\]([https://open.spotify.com/artist/48VgYEfRllDfyLl4BEMVSF][2])

\*\*20:00 Gender Crisis\*\*  
\[Listen on
Spotify\]([https://open.spotify.com/artist/4TJjhycD4ogo5E3Aty6smu][3])

\*\*21:30 TOMBO AND THE AMOOZING C-ABBA-RET\*\*

\*\*22:30 The Oozes Live Band Karaoke\*\*

\*\*You can RSVP here, but you MUST BUY TICKETS via the link below.\*\*
(£15)

Even if you can’t make the event or are not into the music. So what,
support a fellow trans!!

\*\*\[BUY TICKETS
HERE\]([https://dice.fm/event/vnvbv-gimme-gimme-gimme-all-your-money-9th-feb-amp-studios-london-tickets][4])\*\*

eventsByFilter.name: One Foot in the Rave
eventsByFilter.description:
Building on the momentum of the last few months, One Foot in the Rave
returns, this time to the hidden gem, Folklore. With an incredible sound
system and rainforest vibes, this grassroots music venue is perfect for
an intimate rave.

Bringing the tunes on the night:

Aimee, our Scottish Raveheart creates a vibe that’s both nostalgic and
refreshingly modern. Interweaving tech and progressive house with a
touch of deep afro, she has an innate ability to get the party started.

Anil is a Bristol based selector whose genre-defying Djing style sees
him thread together vintage house and head-down minimal with hints of
progressive trance euphoria. This versatile approach has landed him
spots at Glastonbury, Waterworks and Love International Festival to name
but a few.

Co-founders and residents Yazmin and Amar will be sending off the night,
playing their very first b2b set. Prepare to be taken on a journey of
progressive house and rolling techno basslines.

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Family Day with Drag Tales
eventsByFilter.description:
Bookings
at: [https://www.outsavvy.com/event/18181/queer-family-day-with-drag-tales][1]

Join us at The Common Press Bookshop on **11th February** from 12 pm to
4 pm and** 16th February** from 11 am -12 pm for a Queer Family Day with
Drag Tales during the half-term break. Relax and enjoy the day with
stories by one of our fabulous drag artists. ** Free children\'s tickets
and Pay What You Can tickets for adults are available.**

 

**About Drag Tales**

Books like Where The Wild Things Are, Penguin, Girls, The Hug, and many
other classic stories will be read. The focus is to have children see
books they know and love being read by gender-diverse fabulous beings
that exist all across our society. By using stories they’re familiar
with, the whole environment becomes familiar and comfortable.

Expect the unexpected, there might be some singing and if the kids are
old enough,  there might also be some games. Kids (as well as the
parents, guardians, or carers) will have time to ask questions at the
end to help further understand drag queens, gender fluidity, and why we
are wearing whatever it is we are wearing!

* Children must be accompanied by a guardian
* Children\'s details should not be included when buying tickets
* There is a baby-changing toilet and accessible toilets 

NOTE: Please keep in mind that space is limited, so make sure to secure
your spot early. If you plan to bring a buggy with you, there will be
space to store them.



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/18181/queer-family-day-with-drag-tales
eventsByFilter.summary: Queer Family Day with Drag Tales

eventsByFilter.name: Popola: Twerk Temple
eventsByFilter.description:
Get ready to turn up the heat back on Friday 16th of Feb! – ‘Twerk
Temple’ takes over the beloved Dalston Superstore. Back again with our
steamy bi-monthly Afro Perreo ritual, we’re bringing a sexy twist to the
scene, blending booty-shaking beats with explosions of colour, sound and
expression of Afro Latinx Caribbean culture. We advocate for cultural
representation, appreciation and empowerment through music, movement and
community. This is a cute judgement-free safe space for all queens and
QPOC babes to fully express themselves on the dancefloor. Expect our
usual wide range Popolas DJs, gogos and MCs bringing the fierce femme
energy throughout the night. Nos vemossss x £8 BEFORE 11 / £10 AFTER
Door Policy Dalston Superstore is a queer space. We prioritise our
LGBTQIA+ customers and will sometimes ask our straight & cis allies to
support us by not taking up room in our venue. Please be conscious of
who this space is intended for and be respectful. Never assume sexuality
or gender identity. We will never ask personal questions on the door.

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Open Decks
eventsByFilter.description:
Queer Open Decks are a support and networking event for any LGBTQ+ DJs
working within London/Online or those looking to learn basic DJ skills.
Started as a small meet up at the London LGBT Centre, they are now a
growing community of genre-fluid LGBTQ+ DJs meeting on a monthly basis.
Sign up details: During the night, we have 6x 20 minute slots from 7-9pm
that you can sign up in advance here, followed by 6 x 30 minute slots
from 9-12pm that you can sign up for on the night. Please note that this
is primarily a social/networking event rather than a club night – we
have the whole venue to ourselves to allow for those wishing to learn to
DJ in a supportive environment alongside. Feel free to bring your
friends and supporters along! FREE ENTRY Door Policy Dalston Superstore
is a queer space. We prioritise our LGBTQIA+ customers and will
sometimes ask our straight & cis allies to support us by not taking up

eventsByFilter.name: BodySwap
eventsByFilter.description:
Dalston Superstore’s weekly party for the trans+ community BodySwap!
Every Wednesday from 10pm, curators Harietta and Karlie Marx play
Transgender Dance Music along with guest DJs, gogos and cvnty club kids.
It’s the only place to be on a Wednesday night in Dalston!  This is a
space for trans\* power, rage, beauty, resilience, and joy. BodySwap
celebrates and platforms trans\* artists from diverse backgrounds, while
raising crucial funds. BodySwap is by and for trans people. Each week we
raise money for a trans person’s healthcare fundraiser with our door
profits, so come through and party in community with the transexuals of
Kingsland Road.  FREE ENTRY

eventsByFilter.name: RIPOSTE - THE QUEER ART RAVE
eventsByFilter.description:
Riposte is a queer art-rave aiming to facilitate connections between
strangers. A full on sweaty RAVE where you have nice spaces for good
chats, installations, performances, everything to make good memories and
have fun. This is a large scale event on 4 floors, 8 rooms (2
dancefloors, 1 playroom, 1 chill room, 1 performance room, 2 bars). It
is mainly attended by alternative queer people across the whole LGBT+
spectrum with many gender non-confirming people. Strong allies are
welcome 🏳️‍🌈🏳️‍⚧️ This is a RAVE, be ready to SWEAT. We will open at 9pm
with a "social" , a moment before the music start to meet new people and
make cute connections and at 5.30am until 6am in the Courtyard: free
BREAKFAST so you have time to gather your thoughts and find your
friends.Ceasefire now
🇵🇸❤️----------------------------------ACCESSIBILITY INFORMATIONS-Stairs
across the venue (both of the main dance floors are up long flights of
stairs, roughly 30 each). -Groundfloor (chill space, playroom, bar
&amp; quieter room) accessible with no stairs, levelled access,
accessible toilets (please ask: there is 4 different toilets ground
floor so it can be tricky to find. ). Please note that the courtyard
floor partially has cobbles.-Some areas are quite dark (stairs).-Strobe
lights -If you do not have the means to pay for a ticket, please send us
a DM on instagram or email us at least a few days before the event. We
encourage to pay at least concession price as it is a hella pricey
&amp; time consuming event to put on, put we can also offer free
tickets if needed. This offers if only available before we are sold
out.-Covid: we follow the U.K. gov guidelines and tests are not required
upon entry but welfare has self test kids as well as masks upon
demands.-Welfare can also provide you for free: food, safer sex products
(condoms, lube, dental damns), gloves, finger gloves, wet wipes, hand
sanitisers, lollipops, menstruation products &amp; non-judgmental
chats to resolve any problems you might have. They can also provide a
uber service if needed (please only use if really in need: we have a
limited amount of funds dedicated to this scheme). The welfare is a
fully queer, very diverse team of ravers that are trained and have seen
it all. There is also SIA security &amp; medics on site.Please
contact riposte.london@gmail.com or DM us on
https://www.instagram.com/riposte.london if you have any questionENTRY
REQUIREMENTS- This is an 18+ event- Valid form of PHYSICAL ID
(photocopies / pictures not accepted) with a picture: please check
Electrowerkz website to see what form of ID is accepted. Plan
accordingly and tell your friends. No ID no entry.- A ticket (no tickets
on the door if we are sold out)-You will be searched by security upon
entry (body search + bag) &amp; your ID will be scanned as in all
major London venue. You can ask for someone specific to search you.-Last
entry 2.30amIf these requirements are not respected, you will not be
able to gain entry and you will not get
refunded.---------------------------------- LINE UP
----------------------------------DJsTOP FLOOR10 GODS FAVOURITE 12
ANNAKKAY 1 DONNA 2 NEOMA 3.30 WAX WINGS MIDDLE FLOOR10 3.69 11 MAGNETIC
12.30 LOVECAT 2 SHIRLEY TEMPER 3.30 LCY PLAYROOM10 HIMBOY 12 SUBDAWN 2
ARI LUNA 4 SELECKY PERFORMANCESFEMMI FROSTED TITS KARTOFFELSALATLIPMISTY
MOSCOW MORDECAI DUGITON THE CYBERMERMAID V3.0 TISH OLLIE VAMPI OMBI XO
STALLSELLA FRANCES JASMINE IMRENPIGSKINMAYHEMSLAGS SLUSH TRUE COLOUR
COLLARS VISUAL ARTISTS / INSTALLATIONS AVIHARVEY WOOD PAUL JAMES KEARNEY
SOPHIA JONES Can't wait to share this with you. Big love x

eventsByFilter.name: Portrait Photography Workshop
eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*Postponed until March - Due to Illness\*\*

\*\*Thursday February 29th (Will run in March)\*\*  
\*\*19.00 – 20.30, London UK (GMT)\*\*  
\*\*Lambeth Area\*\*

\*\*A live Transgender Portrait Photography Art Workshop\*\*

\*\*Have you ever wanted to know how to take great photos and understand
how to set up your shot so it looks amazing?\*\*

In our fourth at workshop, you will be guided by the wonderful Rebecca
as she shows us everything you need to know to take pictures like a pro.

\*\*Please note that due to limited equipment, we will be limiting this
workshop to 10 people only. First come first serve basis.\*\*

Further, as the materials needed for this workshop are quite expensive,
we will be \*\*charging £5 per person, which will be payable in
advance.\*\* (A link will be sent to you if you RSVP).

You will be guided step-by-step in the process of creating your own
amazing photos. No prior experience is required!

While you will be using professional gear while you learn about
lighting, composition and framing, there is also an opportunity for you
to take your own photos and leave with your own prints.

This is a fun and friendly environment helping you relax and connect
with your inner creative. This thoughtful, artistic activity can open up
the mind and relieve you of outside worries.

You do not need to bring anything apart from your lovely self. All
materials will be provided.

\*\*PLEASE NOTE: If you RSVP but find you cannot attend, please opt out
to make the space available for someone else as we will have a waiting
list.\*\*

\*\*Who this is for:\*\*  
Anyone who is transgender or supporting transgender and wants to do
something a little different. To enjoy themselves and take some down
time while expressing themselves through art. This is a friendly and
supportive environment where everyone, regardless of their artistic
abilities are welcome.

\*\*About Us:\*\*  
This event is part of a series of events run by the London Transgender
Meetup Group, sponsored by Lambeth Council and supported by LGBT Hero.

\### Sign Up Now To Secure Your Place

\*\*We will have to limit numbers to make sure that we can host the
event properly, so please RSVP now to avoid disappointment.\*\*

eventsByFilter.name: VINYL BITCH: OPEN DECKS
eventsByFilter.description:
On the first Monday of every month: – FEMME FATALE DJS – HOT BABES
– FIERCE BEATS – EMPOWERING ENVIRONMENT – QUEER MAGIC – SH\*T LOADS OF
VINYL Picture this: a night where the beats are as fierce as the talent
behind them, and where every drop is a testament to the power and skills
of femme and nonbinary turntablists! Through Vinyl Bitch open deck
events, we seek to inspire, showcase, and elevate the art of turntablism
which overwhelmingly favors cisgender men. Want to get involved? SIGN UP
HERE! Want to be spontaneous!? Enjoy free for all sets from 10 pm to
midnight! Perhaps you want to go b2b with a new bestie, take an encore,
or walk in off Kingsland Road! Want to play but don’t own any vinyl? NO
PROBLEM! WE GOT YOU! We also offer tutorials at the beginning of each
event! 7pm. – 10pm SIGN UP SETS 10pm – Midnight FREE FOR ALL SETS

eventsByFilter.name: Unbound: A G(end)er Swap Fundraiser
eventsByFilter.description:
[ ][1] [ TICKETS HERE ][2] All roads lead to Dalston on the 7th of March for ‘Unbound’, a raucous
evening of live performances and dazzling DJ sets to raise money for a
fabulous cause. Set yourself free with dancing, singing, and coming
together as a community to stand in radical solidarity. ‘Unbound’
celebrates unity between clothing, gender liberation, and identity
experimentation. 100% of the ticket sales will go to the charity. 

 

***Doors open - 7pm Performances - 8pm ***

 

***DJ set and general debauchery - 9pm onwards ***

 

*G(end)er Swap is a UK based LGBTQ+ style outreach organisation that
supports Trans+ people to access clothes, community and style resources.
Their core values are to minimise barriers for gender-diverse people to
experiment with their self-expression. G(end)er Swap equips individuals
with clothing, styling, makeup, and wellness resources and tools across
a plethora of platforms (both digitally and in person) via workshops,
pop ups, digital support initiatives, exhibitions and more. While we
endeavour to ensure the live performances are as accessible as possible
for this event, we must note that as a basement venue, VFD is,
unfortunately, wheelchair inaccessible.*



LINE UP:

Hasznat (Performer)  
Novaya Shey (Performer)  
Princess Xixi (DJ)  
Donna Biologica (DJ)  
Samaria (MC)



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/16389/a-show-called-thursday-with-laura-smyth
[2]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/18515/unbound-a-gender-swap-fundraiser

eventsByFilter.name: Queer House Party
eventsByFilter.description:
⛓️THAT’S RIGHT. WE’RE BACK ⛓️1000 QUEERS, 35 ARTISTS, 9 HOURS, 2 ROOMS.
QUEER HOUSE PARTY. DJs: Meg Ward, Claude Knight, Harry Gay, Mynixe,
Passer, The Doll Named Dan, Watcha &amp; Yung Reenie.Live Shows:
Haus of Telfar &amp; Drag Down the Borders.Hosts: Taali Not Charlie,
Shardeazy Afrodesiak &amp; Sweet FA.Performances: Charlie Wood,
Chiyo, Cyro, Nova Storm, Pink Lotus &amp; Sigi Moonlight.Gogo
Dancers: Danni Spooner, Deeva D, Dilemma, Finn Love, Odessy &amp;
Trayvaughn Robins.Vendors: Badge Cafe, Eden Makeup, Hood Pierced, Kween
Kream &amp; Tuff Times. VENUE: We’ve found our new home at Studio
9294, Hackney Wick. It’s a huge warehouse space with multiple rooms -
meaning we will have a stacked lineup across two rooms with spaces to
watch shows, dance, and chill. EVERYONE IN: Queer House Party is for
everyone - but trans people to the front. We’ve done our best to keep
ticket prices down for everyone. Tickets are on a sliding scale from
£7.50-20. If this is still a barrier for you, please drop us a message,
and we will add you to our free list. ACCESS: Studio 9294 is a
wheelchair-accessible venue. Both our IRL and URL events will have
British Sign Language and Audio Description available during the shows
-there is no hearing induction loop installed in the venue. Free tickets
are available for carers and PAs. If you have any specific questions,
drop us a line at queerhouseparty@gmail.com.COVID: We ask that everyone
tests before attending to keep the party safer. If you can’t get hold of
a test before the event, there will be a covid testing station outside
the venue. We will not ask for proof that you have tested.

eventsByFilter.name: Femmme Fraiche
eventsByFilter.description:
SPRING FRAICHENESS! Is it nearly Spring yet? Can you smell that
Fraicheness in the air? We can, and we’re excited for our March
instalment of Fèmmme Fraîche down at the mothership Dalston Superstore –
so come join us on Sat March 9th for a little Spring Fling! In the
basement, our first guest is all the way from Dublin, bringing some
Irish charm and banging choons Mercorn, who is resident for Dublin based
queer party Tender, and FLINTA platform Skin & Blister and we’re super
excited to have them in the Basement in March. Our second guest on
warm-up duties, is London based Percolate resident Ysanne, who when not
seen behind the counter at the iconic Phonica Records, they’re spinning
tunes, or on the dancefloor (or on the football pitch with Hackney
Parrots) and now regular guest for FF, we’re excited to have them back.
Of course no basement line-up is complete without our resident Michelle
Manetti to heat things up. Expect Hi-NRG, Hands in the air, dancefloor
Euphoria. Then up top we’ve got more top-notch treats. Opening duties is
a Fèmmme Fraîche fave & regular, creator of Faboo TV and all round sass
Queen Jeanie Crystal, followed by another Fèmmme Fraîche fave the
unstoppable Karlie Marx and as usual closing upstairs our fave duo of
Fraîchness, Fèmmme Fraîche residents Linzi Symons and Darren Skene on
disco duties with all your trash-tastic faves. For gogo duties, we have
two of our Fèmmme Fraîche faves, the dynamite dancer Sabrina Jade
alongside the super stunning Bobby expect ass-shakin’ sexy, sassy,
stupendous bar-top antics. With a small selection of £5 early bird
tickets and a limited number of General Admission tickets for sale
online – these allow you Q-jump and are valid for entry until 11pm only.
Once these have sold out entry will be general admission tickets
available on the door, on the night. For low salary income please
contact us for discounted entry. Our event is FLINTA focused and aimed
as a space for queer wxmn, Trans, NB, and they will be given priority.
Allies and friends are welcome, providing they respect the space. £8
ENTRY BEFORE 11pm / £10 AFTER

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents: THE RASPBERRY REICH (2004)
eventsByFilter.description:
On night two of Queer As In Fuck U, we’ve joined forces with our
comrades at Tissue to bring you a rare screening of the legendary Bruce
LaBruce‘s delirious piece of hardcore agitprop, The Raspberry
Reich(2004). Taking their cues from the Baader-Meinhof Gang, a ragtag
gay militia kidnaps the son of a wealthy industrialist in order to
further their fight against fascism, heterosexuality, and bourgeoise
life. Radical, satirical, funny, and deliciously messed up, LaBruce’s
battlecry against respectability politics, censorship, and gay
assimilation plays like a punk rock song belted into a double-ended
dildo, and twenty years later it still demands to be seen.

Joining us to introduce the film will be writer, artist, and co-curator
at Tissue, Sam Moore.

Find us salivating in the bowels of Dalston Superstore for a work by one
of queer cinema’s greats.

“HETEROSEXUALITY IS THE OPIATE OF THE MASSES”

Tickets available via
OutSavvy: https://www.outsavvy.com/organiser/transmissions

Please note that this film contains graphic nudity and sexual content  
Subtitles will be displayed throughout the film.   Seating is a mixture
of benches, backed chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is first
come, first served.

eventsByFilter.name: Happy Endings: TENDER Takover
eventsByFilter.description:
In celebration of St Patrick’s Day, we’ve invited TENDER over from
Dublin to takeover the Superstore basement on Thursday 14th March,
whilst Happy Endings residents take charge of the bar upstairs b2b all
night, hosted by the wonderful The Doll Named Dan x TENDER is a queer
collective based out of Dublin Ireland. TENDER, a dance party for queers
and allies, was born out of the unique connections that are cultivated
on queer dancefloors. TENDER has become notorious in the Dublin DIY rave
and club scene for their hot and high energy parties that offer dancers
an intentional space to experience the cathartic release of a
dancefloor. Trance, Euro and House are some of the driving forces behind
the moments which make up this collective. Fuelled by the progressive
sound revival, TENDER residents (Bull Horris, Gary, Mercorn) alongside
some truly special local and international acts have set the tone for
these parties so far. GRAB A LIMITED £5 EARLY BIRD TICKET HERE!

FREE BEFORE 11 / £7 AFTER 11pm

eventsByFilter.name: Twin Cherries Club
eventsByFilter.description: [ ](/https:/www.outsavvy.com/event/17737/leztopia) [ TICKETS HERE ][1] We\'re back to announce our first event of the year! We\'re doing our first EVER k-nky social at our mothership venue for our very first birthday 🥰 🎂 **Almost a year ago to the day we threw our first ever party there, and we\'re so happy to welcome you all back on March 15th for steamy social, 10pm - 3am.** **We will have no play equipment at this party but we will be having amazing performances from the likes of Master Carter @itsbrokeboy and DJing from @immeshesdead, @sissycinnamon and @underwaterkash with more performances to be announced, as well as some fun treats for our attendees as a thank you for coming to our birthday so don\'t miss out on this absolutely caked up lineup 😤** **We will also have a wristband system in place at this event to indicate what kind of connections you\'re seeking to make in our wonderful community, so come wish us a happy damn birthday or we\'ll be mad at you 😈** **£7 solidarity low income tickets** **£9 Early bird** **Prices will increase once these sell out so don\'t miss out 💋🍒** **⛓️ in b!o** Hosts: Carter (he/him) @itsbrokeboy   Carter is one of our organisers. He\'s a trans man, pansexual, and sw’er who brings a very important viewpoint to our company and is a big advocate for his trans community in general (as well as being a very cunty slay). He will be doing a performance at our next event for our birthday party 🎂   Katia (she/they) @cummunistparty   Kat is our founder and also performs at our events from time to time, they are an nb, bisexual sw’er who without we would not have our wonderful event and community. She slays every event we organise together and is an amazing leader to have for the important space we\'ve created together   Amber (she/they) @amberchaotix   Amber is the final member of our team as one of our organisers, she is a nb, pansexual, mixed race sw\'er and helps to keep our night as inclusive as possible using their life experience. They are also our resident photographer so feel free to approach her for a photo!   Performers: TBA DJs: Imme (he/they) @immeshesdead Imme is a queer mixed race musician and DJ from Brighton who is also part of @deijuvhs. Their genres span alt trap, hyperpop, bashment, cunty classics and more. eventsByFilter.name: Pumping Velvet
eventsByFilter.description:
Spring is coming! Time to shake off the last of those winter blues with
a horny and naughty night of dancing to celebrate the arrival of the
most fecund time of year. And what better way to do that than by pumping
some velvet? Assuming the role of high priestess of our ecstatic
fertility rights is none other than Chicago legend and queer dancefloor
icon Ariel Zetina! Ariel is one of our most treasured DJs and is always
guaranteed to slay the dancefloor. We literally cannot contain our
excitement that she’ll be bringing her selection of sleazy house,
belizean punt and queer techno slammers to Dalston’s naughtiest
basement. Her closing set at last year’s Honcho campout is all the proof
you need that this will be missable. Getting the party started with a
cute babe 2 babe set will be our homegrown resident heroes Sofie K and
Nick Kagame with their first ever b2b set, likely to range from sleazy
chug to UKG bops and all the good stuff in between. Upstairs is a
flaming Portuguese love affair as we welcome back perennial fave and
Lisbon Legend Mario Valente alongside his compatriot PLUM for an
audacious mix of pop, disco, house and lesbian riot grrrl, but not
before head honcho Sam PV opens proceedings with some slinky numbers.
Come pump some velvet! £7 BEFORE 11 / £10 AFTER

eventsByFilter.name: Testo Hunkie Sunday Service
eventsByFilter.description:
Testo Hunkie is a social event for the boys and their pals. Whether
you’re a trans twink, butch bruiser or a wee guy come down from 3 pm for
SUNDAY ROAST and a chat. Our ever popular arm wrestling competition
returns, just find Lori Mae and sign up for a chance to be the champ of
the season. We’ll be back at Old Nun’s Head, taste their legendary roast
dinner while watching hot bois wrestling for mama Lori Mae. See you on
the dance floor from 6pm. We’ll have sets from Harietta, the trans David
Guetta to get you up and dancing with fun chill Sunday
vibes.Unfortunately the room upstairs is not wheelchair accessible Dogs
are welcome Join Us For Another Hunksome time. Roast and gossip:
3pm-8pmArm wrestling: 4pmDJ’s: 6pm-8am How to find us: Old Nun's Head15
Nunhead GreenSE15 3QQ COVID’s still a thing. Please test and stay home
if you feel unwell. Testo Hunkie is an 18+ event. We might have to check
your ID. Testo Hunkie is an inclusive, LGBTQ+ event. We’re here for the
celebration of all bodies and gender expressions. No excuses -
acceptance is the bare minimum, babe. Testo Hunkie is the dream of two
trans fags. We’re doing it DIY and raising some money for trans\* joy
whilst we’re at it. We’ll be raising money for gender-affirming
fundraisers through ticket sales and donations.Money will be distributed
to anyone who makes a request. Email us a link to your fundraising page
to testohunkie@gmail.com and we’ll donate a split of the money raised.

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents: LOVE IS THE DEVIL (1998)
eventsByFilter.description:
Continuing our March season of bold, explicit, and uncompromising queer
cinema, Queer As In Fuck U, we’re proud to present underrated
masterpiece Love Is The Devil: Study For A Portrait of Francis Bacon
(1998). Director John Maybury – who first rose to prominence helming
music videos for Sinead O’Connor and Pet Shop Boys, as well as
collaborating with Derek Jarman – crafts not only a rigorous snapshot of
a period in iconic contemporary artist Francis Bacon‘s life, but a
vividly immersive journey into the dark heart of the work itself.

Love Is The Devil seems to live within Bacon’s brutal paintings,
depicting a cutthroat world of cruel figures and emotional depravity as
it depicts the fraught relationship between Bacon (Derek Jacobi) and his
troubled lover George Dyer (Daniel Craig), conjuring the gay pub culture
of 1960s London, and letting viewers float down a river of gruel and
into Bacon’s consciousness. Come for a hunky young Daniel Craig and
unforgettable cinematography by John Mathieson (Gladiator, Logan,
Hannibal), stay for a devilish supporting turn by Tilda Swinton and
polari insults delivered a mile a minute.

We’ll be cosy in the bowels of Dalston Superstore, ready for another
night at the movies designed for our beloved trans audience.

“Do I possess some inner destructive demon?”  

Tickets available via
OutSavvy: https://www.outsavvy.com/organiser/transmissions

Please note that this film deals with suicide and addiction.   Subtitles
will be displayed throughout the film.   Seating is a mixture of
benches, backed chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is first come,
first served.
eventsByFilter.summary: Transmissions presents: LOVE IS THE DEVIL (1998)

eventsByFilter.name: Raghd + Venus Anon
eventsByFilter.description:
Raghd

Raghd is rightfully being hailed as one of the most talented and
exciting new artists from Sweden. She blends rap, electronic dance, and
alternative rock into something completely its own. Carrying an
unapologetic punk energy, while showcasing incredible lyricism that is
vulnerable, humorous, smart, and playful, Raghd stands out as an
outstandingly versatile artist.

Venus Anon

Venus Anon has proven to be one of the most compelling artists in
today\'s contemporary music scene. She is of Iranian descent, and spent
her early years on the Swedish west coast listening to Googoosh and
Timbaland. During her teenage years, she lived in Stockholm and became
deeply embedded in the city\'s underground and queer scene, allowing
every encounter with new music to become an influence. Contemporary R&B,
clever pop productions, 21st-century emotional indie and future bass -
all can be heard as small traces in Venus Anon’s sound today.

eventsByFilter.name: Video Vixen Era
eventsByFilter.description: [ TICKETS HERE ][1] Celebrate an evening with a Y2K theme, featuring classic club hits from the UK and the US. 🪩💅   *We\'ll be adopting a privacy-conscious approach, inspired by German clubs, by providing stickers to cover phone cameras. This ensures a worry-free clubbing experience.* ### **The Lineup** ***Svrn *** *Rhianna Addae-Mensah, known as DJ Svrn (7) is a British Ghanaian, DJ specialises in amapiano, dance hall & Afrobeats with phonky house twist. Svrn loves to combine crowd favourites and crazy beats by her favourite producers to create a fun & jumping set that also introduces the crowds to new music. Svrn seeks inspiration from her motherland, as well as diving into works from around the world including Brazil, Nigeria and the UK to fabricate a fusion of genres that you can’t help but groove to.*   RIZZELDA a fresh addition to the vibrant London music scene. Bringing an eclectic mix of UKG to Angolan afrohouse, RIZZELDA captivates audiences with their dynamic sound. With a keen ear for exploration and a passion for discovering new musical horizons, listeners are invited on a journey through a diverse musical landscape. Infused with infectious charisma, RIZZELDA guarantees an unforgettable experience filled with joy and excitement.   **Nésa Thea:** Emerging from the diverse scene of South London, Nésa Thea is a rising star in the realm of multi-genre DJing. With a diverse repertoire spanning Amapiano to UK Funky, her sets promise an unpredictable yet irresistibly danceable journey. Expect an energetic, immersive experience, where you are lost in sound and drawn to the dance floor.   *🎟️ Advance tickets on Outsavvy.* **🎟️On the door: £10** [1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/18171/video-vixen-era

non-binary people. We have multiple tables set up with games, ranging
from quick and easy games to learn for newbies, to medium-length
strategy board games. If you've got a game you'd love to bring and teach
others to play, please bring it too, as we will have some spare tables
for wildcard games on the night. This will be a really friendly
environment where we can enjoy playing games with other queers who love
games as much as us. Learn something new, or put a new strategy to the
test, and make some new queer friends in the process. Date: Tuesday 26
March 2024, 7-9pm Location: The Glitch, 134 Lower Marsh, London, SE1 7AE
(5 minutes walk from Waterloo underground station)Cost: £10. Booking in
advance is essential. Please note that costs go towards paying our staff
to host the evening, and towards buying new board gamesAccessibility:
The venue is wheelchair accessible, with step-free access to

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents: ANATOMY OF HELL (2004)
eventsByFilter.description:
For the finale of our March season of bold, explicit, and uncompromising
queer cinema, Queer As In Fuck U, we’ve looked to one of the true
masters of provocation, France’s infamous auteur Catherine Breillat.
Anatomy of Hell (2004) chronicles four nights between a suicidally
depressed woman and the gay man she picks up at a club and pays to
“watch her when she is unwatchable”, observing her body, and hearing her
proclamations about sex, gender, and patriarchy.

Join us for this chic and at times shocking piece of arthouse mastery
that continues to polarise viewers who either see it as feminist or
unacceptably obscene. You be the judge.

“The woman is the man’s disease”    

Tickets available via
OutSavvy: https://www.outsavvy.com/organiser/transmissions

Please note that this film contains nudity and graphic depictions of
sex.   Subtitles will be displayed throughout the film.   Seating is a
mixture of benches, backed chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is
first come, first served.

eventsByFilter.name: World Trans Film Premeire
eventsByFilter.description:
\## \*\*Three Amazing Trans Positive Films All In One Night\*\*

\### March 28th 2024 at 19.00 - Online World Premiere

\*\*\[See the Trailer and get your tickets
HERE\]([https://transmatters.co/premiere/][1])\*\*

\### \*\*During the summer of 2023, and in answer to the current trans
bashing agenda, we decided to start showing the truth. Trans people are
strong, intelligent and resilient.\*\*

\### \*\*Be inspired by our stories.\*\*

You will be the first to see these \*\*three amazing short films.
Filmed, directed and edited by Jess Crooks and produced by Ray
Lavery.\*\*  
These short web series highlight what it is really like to explore our
trans identity. Life is not doom and gloom and being trans actually
brings much positivity and joy into our lives.  
\*\*These films give you the real world experience and opinions of
people who are living their trans life. - Come To Our Premiere\*\*

\### The Films Are:

\### Trans Joy

\### Trans Pride

\### Trans Dysphoria

\[!\[\]()\]([https://transmatters.co/premiere/)\*\*\[See][2] the Trailer
and get your tickets HERE\]([https://transmatters.co/premiere/][1])\*\*

\*\*Find your own joy through their eyes.\*\*

\### Here\'s what\'s happening:

\* \*\*See our three amazing films\*\*  
\* Have a Q&A with the director and cast members  
\* Have entertainment from trans musicians (Kay Rowan and Hunting
Hearts)  
\* Interviews with Trans Celebrities.

It\'s going to be an amazing evening. \*\*Please Support Us\*\*

eventsByFilter.name: Seize the means: Staff Trans Healthcare fundraiser
eventsByFilter.description:
SEIZE THE MEANS OF MEDICAL TRANSITION! Dalston Superstore presents our
annual staff healthcare fundraiser for Trans Day of Visibility, with all
proceeds going to Superstore staff gender affirming funds. We need to
relinquish the idea that visibility is positive in and of itself. The
hyper visibility that trans\* people have experienced in the past decade
has left us increasingly vulnerable to violence from both the public and
the government while continuously being neglected by social services,
including the NHS. The increased exposure of trans\* people has not
improved our access to gender affirming health care. Rather, we are left
hanging with an expected waiting time of more than five years for an
initial appointment at the Gender Identity Clinic. Fundraisers and
privatised health care should not replace the public healthcare system
but for most trans\* people, this is currently our only option. Thus,
health care becomes a matter of proximity to privilege. We as trans\*
people should get to define for ourselves whether and how we choose to
transition medicially, legally and socially. On this Trans Day of
In/visibility, we encourage you to seize the means of medical transition
to redistribute resources, including but not limited to money, HRT, and
knowledge. Dalston Superstore is throwing a fundraising party to support
gender affirming health care for our trans members of staff. This party
centres trans\* people, medicalised and otherwise.

We’ll be taking donations on the door and inside all night, come open
your hearts and wallets in support of trans\* healthcare.

Minimum Donation £7. Door Policy

eventsByFilter.name: RIPOSTE - QUEER ART RAVE
eventsByFilter.description:
My lovelies, will you give me your hands for a dance? On the 29th of
March 2024, we are taking over the whole of Electrowerkz for a
beautiful, magical, absurd rave. At Riposte, we are professional of the
absurd. We mix DJs all night often playing techno &amp; rave music
with art. Our focus is on community, and everything we create has the
aim to bring people closer together. Make you meet new people, friends
&amp; lovers. We are a sex positive rave with a playroom, 2 dance
floors, a performance space, a room for stalls &amp; to chill and
many areas to discover.Join us for a night of wonder. xxThis rave is
mainly attended by alternative queer people across the whole LGBT+
spectrum with many gender non-confirming people. Strong allies are
welcome 🏳️‍🌈🏳️‍⚧️We will open at 9pm with a "social" , a moment before
the music start to meet new people and make cute connections and at
5.30am until 6am in the Courtyard: free BREAKFAST so you have time to
gather your thoughts and find your friends.Ceasefire now
🇵🇸❤️----------------------------------ACCESSIBILITY INFORMATIONS-Stairs
across the venue (both of the main dance floors are up long flights of
stairs, roughly 30 each). -Groundfloor (chill space, playroom, bar
&amp; quieter room) accessible with no stairs, levelled access,
accessible toilets (please ask: there is 4 different toilets ground
floor so it can be tricky to find. ). Please note that the courtyard
floor partially has cobbles.-Some areas are quite dark (stairs).-Strobe
lights -If you do not have the means to pay for a ticket, please send us
a DM on instagram or email us at least a few days before the event. We
encourage to pay at least concession price as it is a hella pricey
&amp; time consuming event to put on, put we can also offer free
tickets if needed. This offers if only available before we are sold
out.-Covid: we follow the U.K. gov guidelines and tests are not required
upon entry but welfare has self test kids as well as masks upon
demands.-Welfare can also provide you for free: food, safer sex products
(condoms, lube, dental damns), gloves, finger gloves, wet wipes, hand
sanitisers, lollipops, menstruation products &amp; non-judgmental
chats to resolve any problems you might have. They can also provide a
uber service if needed (please only use if really in need: we have a
limited amount of funds dedicated to this scheme). The welfare is a
fully queer, very diverse team of ravers that are trained and have seen
it all. There is also SIA security &amp; medics on site.Please
contact riposte.london@gmail.com or DM us on
https://www.instagram.com/riposte.london if you have any questionENTRY

on the door if we are sold out)-You will be searched by security upon

eventsByFilter.description:

sometimes you’re just looking to make some queer friends, so speed
friending is a very non-pressurised way to meet lovely new people.You
bring your own drink and chat. We will pair you up with approximately 10
fantastic LGBTQ ladies and non-binary folk. You’ll have around 5 minutes
with each pairing to spark up a good conversation. We’ll also help
kickstart the event with some friendly ice breakers. The next day, we
will match up those who both expressed interest so you can keep the
conversation going without us. We will just send you a little form to
fill out post-dates.The day before the event, we will send you a ZOOM
link so you can join in at the start time. We invite you to join us from
across the U.K. COST: £10

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents: DESIGN FOR LIVING (1933)
eventsByFilter.description:
For our April season at Transmissions, we’ll be exploring the mechanics
of the triangle, and looking at what happens when there’s love to go
around. In Three’s Company: Polyamory, Throuples, and Unethical
Non-Mongamy we’ll take you on a journey from tenderqueer housing drama,
to couples falling for a third, to steamy mind games, and women who just
can’t choose between boyfriends. It’s all fun and games until somebody
gets hurt, or perhaps the hurt is being laid down by societal pressure
and heteronormative ideas about what a relationship should look like?
Whatever the case, these cinematic trios never take the easy route, and
you’ll want to be there for their every move.

On opening night we’re serving up a pre-code classic from Ernst Lubitsch
about a crazy gal and her two pals, Design For Living (1933). Can a
modern woman really have it all? And if she wants one man just as much
as the other, does she really have to choose? Come find out when we
screen a surprisingly modern film from a time before the word “polycule”
began plaguing our every waking moment.

We’ll be deep in the warm embrace of the basement at Dalston Superstore,
ready to invite you in.

“Immorality may be fun, but it isn’t fun enough to take the place of one
hundred percent virtue and three square meals a day.”

Tickets available via
OutSavvy: https://www.outsavvy.com/organiser/transmissions

Subtitles will be displayed throughout the film. Seating is a mixture of
benches, backed chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is first come,
first served.

eventsByFilter.name: Writing for Performance workshops with Liv Ello
eventsByFilter.description:
A 5-part ‘writing for performance’ weekly workshop series, providing a
safe space for emerging writers to develop their ideas through writing
tools and techniques with room for experimenting and break away from
convention. A space to write share and develop without the pressure of
producing something at the end of the series, but rather a focus on
skill development, community building and finding your voice through
writing. 

This workshop series is run by writer and performer, Liv Ello (Body
Show, SWARM, Jack the Mack, director of Frankie Thompson: CAttS).

This workshop series is aimed to create an encouraging environment to
explore your ideas through writing exercises, discussion and support to
develop your writing skills and become confident in your writing
abilities.  
  
The sessions are catered towards anyone of any writing experience,
whether you’re an experienced playwright, curious about developing text
for your performance practice, love the idea of writing something new
every session or absolutely terrified by it!  
  
The aim of this course is to use writing for performance as a creative
tool for developing our ideas, not just as the thing that formalises
them at the end. It’s writing for discovery and expression, not just
definition.

The course is designed so that if you can only afford a single drop-in
session, you will still come away with valuable tools and explorations,
whilst those completing the full course will also experience a sense of
progression and development

 [ TICKETS ][1]

[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/18952/writing-for-performance-workshops-with-liv-ello-vfd

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents: SPLENDOR (1999) + DOG MOVIE (2023)
eventsByFilter.description:
Ever been too avoidant to ask Sock to do the dishes? Ever been faced
with a choice between passion and security? On night two of Three’s
Company: Polyamory, Throuples, and Unethical Non-Mongamy, we’ll be
presenting two very different looks at queer housing drama when we
screen Henry Hanson‘s hyper-relatable folk punk-y short Dog Movie (2023)
about a pair of tenderqueers, their live-in liability, and a dog, right
before a showing of Gregg Araki‘s underrated essential of throuple
cinema, Splendor (1999). Come for Dog Movie‘s whily charms and moments
of cringe excellence (with a recorded intro by director Henry Hanson),
stay for the return of the beloved Gregg Araki to our humble screen on a
night that pits vegans against the unemployed, himbos against gym bros,
heteronormativity against trying to convince your boyfriends to make
out, and so much more.

Find us juiced up and jumbled in downstairs at Dalston Superstore for
another night at the movies.

Tickets available via
OutSavvy: https://www.outsavvy.com/organiser/transmissions

Subtitles will be displayed throughout the film. Seating is a mixture of
benches, backed chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is first come,
first served.

eventsByFilter.name: t\'ARTopia
eventsByFilter.description:
Join us in t\'ARTopia for a queer-curated night of drag, comedy, poetry,
cabaret and music from some of our most delicious t\'ARTs.

 [ tickets ][1] We have invited some of our favourite performers to entertain you all,
at a night that will be nothing short of t\'ARTopian. 

We will be raising money for gender affirming surgery funds with this
evening\'s raffle, so come with a couple of quid, win art and raise
money for good causes!

t’ART is a queer-led arts and lit collective, that creates space (on the
page and in real life) for marginalised voices.

*Let\'s get mouth-watering*

Performers: 

Alexis Sakellaris - Musical Comedy

Alexis (@alexis\_sakellaris) is a queer international artist who
graduated from Mountview last year and hasn’t had a stable routine
since. His first foray into original work, A STAN IS BORN! is a musical
comedy about how he devolved into a lil gay stan obsessed with pop divas
after a drastic move from NYC to rural Germany. This chaotic mess of a
show is heading to several London venues and Edinburgh Fringe this
summer, which is just like… wild lol.

Phil from Venus - Poetry

 Phil is a writer, actor and photographer. He likes to dress his
rambling thoughts with flowery language, calling it poetry! When
reading, the audience is urged to join in, making it a conversation
where authenticity reigns - the room becomes his mind and we all reside
in it, becoming his sounding board and sometimes, voice of reason.

Amy Lynne Westray - Drag

Amy Lynne Westray (they/she) is a queer theatre maker, cabaret artist
& facilitator with particular love for clowning, drag, physical
theatre, music & spoken word poetry.  They studied European Theatre
Arts a heavily ensemble & devising based course. Since graduating
last year, they co-founded a clowning and cabaret company Curls N Swirls
who took \'It takes 2 to tango\' to the Harrow Arts centre as part of
the Boiler festival. They also debuted a cabaret/comedy solo show
\'Crowbar Girl\' at Apple cart Arts. More recently they have been
developing more cabaret and drag acts & excessively drinking
tea.** **



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/19168/tartopia

eventsByFilter.name: Thursday Social Drinks In Soho
eventsByFilter.description:
Join me and your fellow trans lovelies for a relaxed meetup which takes
place on the second \*\*Thursday of the month in the Soho, central
London area.\*\*

This place has a great buzz. It\'s a sneaky way to start the weekend
early. Come and join us :)

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

We have a private area upstairs in the venue, which is plenty of space
for us all to chat, hear each other and relax.

Thursday is the new start of the weekend. Let\'s use this opportunity to
make some new friends and chat about whatever pleases you.  
This event will suit you if you are new to attending the meetup or are
one of our wonderful regulars. It is a popular evening with lots of
different people popping in. There is no need to be nervous. We are all
very friendly and welcoming. You\'ll feel right at home. :)

\*\*What is this meetup?\*\*  
This is a relaxed, friendly and inclusive meetup for the trans people of
London. This is an opportunity to make new friends and chat over a
sneaky Thursday drink.

\*\*Who is it for?\*\*  
Everyone from the trans community is welcome. This is an opportunity to
be yourself, whatever you identify as. We are inclusive and happy to
welcome you.

\*\*How does it work?\*\*  
All you have to do is RSVP and then we will message you on the day with
the event location. Then, all you have to do is show up.

We will make sure that you meet some new people and get a chance to get
to know your fellow trans buddies. This event is very friendly and will
welcome you and make sure you feel comfortable and happy.  
It is free to attend, just buy yourself a drink at the bar.

\*\*Please Note:\*\* RSVP is a must as the location (based around Soho)
will be sent by email on the day to those who have RSVP\'d only. RSVP
closes at 16.00 on the day of the event.

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

eventsByFilter.name: XOXA NYC TAKEOVER
eventsByFilter.description:
NYC based collective XOXA make their London debut with a full takeover
of Dalston Superstore. This collision of two legendary city’s queer
underground scenes will be iconic.  Upstairs is giving pure queer
utopian joy with London’s favorites UOKHUN (RITA LIN b2b Victoria
Peckham) and Queer House Party residents Harry Gay, Passer and Watcha
with a closing set by XOXA’s Kandylion. Hosts and dancers Bolly-Illusion
and Taali will captivate the bar area bringing the high queer energy
that London’s party scene is known for. Downstairs in the rave cave get
lost in a recreation of a NYC queer dance floor with XOXA residents
Panooc and Kandylion (coming all the way from NYC) pulling from their
extensive music collections of east coast house, acid and vocal house.
These two seasoned DJs who have inspired and turned up dance floors all
over New York for years with their high energy and heart pumping dance
music. Joining them is London’s own Reece Spooner – a Balamii resident
whose genre fluid sets are the perfect embodiment of NYC’s diverse dance
floor sound. From jackin’ house, acid and techno to ghetto, jersey club,
electro, UK bass, breakbeat, footwork and modern-day rave, his palette
is wide, heady and leans nicely on the anthems. XOXA is a platform,
party and DJ collective based out of NYC with a worldwide reach. Their
mission is to support and highlight artists in the electronic music
scene while providing an intentional space for dancers and partygoers.
XOXA works closely with DJs spanning genres, scenes, countries and
backgrounds all with the common goal of uplifting and unifying
marginalized artists. £8 before 11 / £10 after

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Running Club
eventsByFilter.description:
The most important thing you should know about QRC if you are planning
to attend is that this is a community. A decentralised space for us all,
as queer-identifying people, to run together without judgment or fear.

We are a friendly crew, we always have a drink after so that we can
socialise as well. Sessions are normally one hour long, they vary each
week.

It will be a mixture of a long run (up to 8km), hill sprints, paced
runs, and sprints or running games. We don\'t have a specific pace that
you need to run at, ALL levels are welcome. If you can comfortably run
5km you will get more from the runs. Some sessions have two people and
some have twenty, but, we always try to stay together.

After last year\'s comeback concert extravaganza came to a screeching

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents: X Y AND ZEE (1972)
eventsByFilter.description:
You’ll never believe how some folks live. For London socialites Robert
(Michael Caine) and Zee (a blistering Elizabeth Taylor), love is a cruel
game, and sex is little more than a weapon. But when Robert’s latest
affair with young single mum Stella (Susannah York) begins, it’s all out
war and the venomous Zee will stop at nothing to get even. And god help
anyone who gets in their way.

Don’t miss a film that plays like the psychedelic sibling of Who’s
Afraid of Virginia Woolf? when we screen the scandalous, acerbic, and
unbelievably gaggy X Y and Zee (1972) on night three of Three’s Company:
Polyamory, Throuples, and Unethical Non-Mongamy. Find us cosy in the
basement at Dalston Superstore, ready for a motion picture about lovers
on their very worst behaviour.   “I wasn’t being vicious, was I?”

Tickets available via
OutSavvy: https://www.outsavvy.com/organiser/transmissions

Subtitles will be displayed throughout the film. Seating is a mixture of
benches, backed chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is first come,
first served.

eventsByFilter.name: Cum As U Are
eventsByFilter.description: [ TICKETS ][1] **✨**Unleash your inner flirt and join us for a night of silly sex positivity ✨  This is a sex positive night all about feeling good and turning yourself on, expect irresistible cabaret performances and sultry tunes throughout the evening Celebrating self-expression in all its glorious forms, our line up promises to blend feel good rhythms with heartfelt live performance.  Doors 19:00 Performances begin 19:45 LAST ENTRY 22:30 End 00:00 No one turned away for lack of funds, please email [rainagreifer@gmail.com](mailto:rainagreifer@gmail.com), no questions asked. We will be providing a fully detailed content warnings document closer to the date but please be aware that the evening will include poetry and performances on the topic of sex. We also have a dedicated accessibility coordinator who can be contacted prior to the event, should any customers need anything to be arranged in advance. Their email is rainagreifer@gmail.com ### The Lineup Raina Greifer (Host) They/She Raina Greifer (she/they) is a Bristol-based theatre maker and producer interested in exploring themes around sex, consent, and grief.  They were shortlisted for the SH24: Sexual Health Awards 2022 as Young Person of the Year and were a BBC Words First Finalist in 2021.  Her solo show MANIC won Best Solo Show at Fuse International in 2022.  Raina loves talking about being horny.  She loves being dramatic about it. Rosa Garland Rosa is a clown, writer and burlesque artist. She likes things that are sticky, sexy and stupid. Her queer cult hit show TRASH SALAD has sold out at Soho Theatre, Edinburgh Fringe and VAULT Festival where it was nominated for the 2023 Innovation Award. She is currently developing a new show, Primal Bog. Maedb Joy Maedb Joy is a poet, writer and theatre maker, making work about class, sex work, queerness and womanhood. She is alumni of Guildhall School of Music and Drama (rated 1st in the UK for arts + drama), and the Royal Court Playwriting Group. Maedb is the founder and and artistic director of Sexquisite Events, a performing arts company platforming sex worker artists across theatre, cabaret and nightlife across the UK. She is also the co-founder of Riot Party, a sex positive queer community producing sold out club nights in London and Manchester. Both organisations are committed to creating paid creative opportunities for sex workers, and impacting meaningful change through art and entertainment. BEKIMACHINE BEKIMACHINE is a London-born, Midlands based emerging producer & DJ. She DJs progressive/melodic house & techno, peak-time/driving techno & hard techno.  She\'s known for producing electronic music ranging from synth pop to techno, creating an ethereal, otherworldly sound. She has a habit of crafting music with a sense of atonality, filled with catchy melodies and bass hooks whilst evoking nostalgia.   In 2022 she took DJing from Twitch to the stage, playing a string of shows to date including TwitchCon Amsterdam, Berlin Brighton & Shaydefest - falling in love with the atmosphere & energy of the live room, whilst sending the audience on an emotional journey through music. In 2023, she opened up for Elevation at EGG London as their DJ competition winner, as well as playing shows for Shaydefest, Deep Underground Notts and the Junc Collective.  2023 marked a new chapter in her music, exploring techno and trance in her sound. Her latest single, The Void (Chaotic Evil Remix) has seen radio play on BBC Radio 1 Introducing Dance. Prior to this, she released her debut album Another Atmosphere in 2022, a video-game inspired synth pop saga, gaining positive support from SIDE-LINE Magazine and securing radio play from BBC Introducing. Aria Progressive house producer Aria finds inspiration in the freedom and escapism that music brings. Her ethereal melodies take you away to another world, to your true reality. Let her take you on a journey from beautiful melodic waters to deeper tech progresive house that will have you in a trance. M Hunny South london based Brummie, M Hunny mixes her love for garage & electronic music with a distinct 90s and early 2000s sound. With a monthly show on Voices radio playing an eclectic mix of genres, M Hunny has also played at Ministry of Sound & recently opened up for Children of Zeus. Co-founder & designer at Barbara Bianco the DJ merges the worlds of fashion & music putting on nights showcasing talent from around the UK and dressing everyone in BB. Stay locked in for female vocals, bass heavy bangers and addictive hooks. Fanny Bleach Fanny Bleack is a raucous and riotous comedy act, in 2023 Fanny stormed the stage to be crowned the winner of East London’s Top of the Slops Season 3! Promising to be a sexy and filthy act, Fanny Bleach is a drag thing not to miss [1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/18479/cum-as-u-are

eventsByFilter.name: NO HARD SHOULDER
eventsByFilter.description:
[ TICKETS HERE ][1] United by a passion for resurrecting the raw energy and authenticity of
the underground music scene from the 1990s, a collective of DJs from the
East London music scene is the driving force behind NO HARD SHOULDER.

Fuelled by a love for tech and deep house, minimal tech, breaks, and
techno, these artists have banded together to create unforgettable
experiences in intimate club settings.

Drawing inspiration from the gritty, electric atmosphere of the \'90s
rave culture, each member brings their own unique style and influences
to the dancefloor, creating diverse sonic landscapes that keep the crowd
on their toes all night long.

But it\'s not just about the music; it\'s about fostering a sense of
community and connection among like-minded individuals who share a deep
appreciation for electronic music. Whether you\'re a seasoned raver or a
newcomer to the scene, you\'re welcomed with open arms at these parties.

In an era dominated by mainstream trends and commercialism, NO HARD
SHOULDER offers a refreshing change, and welcomes the most diverse of
crowds. So if you find yourself craving an escape from the ordinary,
keep an eye out for their next event.

[@nohardshoulder][2]



[1]: https://ra.co/events/1870098
[2]: https://www.instagram.com/nohardshoulder/

eventsByFilter.name: One More Time
eventsByFilter.description:
[ TICKETS ][1] Encore Une Fois - after a short break, One More Time is BACK!

Its 1997 and Girl Power is everywhere! The Spice Girls dominate the
charts, Louise, Dannii Minogue and Gina G fly the flag for the pop
girls. Katrina and The Waves won Eurovision, Janet Jackson returned and
All Saints, Natalie Imbruglia and Shola Ama launched.

The boys were busy too though with Backstreet Boys, 911, Boyzone,
Hanson, North & South, No Mercy and Five all making the top 10.
Robbie Williams launched his solo career proper, Kavana adorned bedroom
walls and Will Smith was the man in black. Not content with the charts
being full of pure pop, Texas, Republica and No Doubt added some guitars
to the mix. 1997 also saw HUGE dance anthems from Gala (and her
trombelese), Ultra Nate and Dario G - not to mention the trio of hits
from Sash! And just as the year was ending, we said hello to bright new
things Steps and Aqua!

We’ll be playing the A list popstars from 1997 along with B listers like
Michelle Gayle, Lisa Stansfield and Skunk Anansie along with loads of
other pop and dance hits from 1997. Immerse yourself with memorabilia
galore from 1997 adorning our walls including our much loved chart wall
whilst our resident drag queen Karma will be back with a homage to
1997. 

Expect loads of forgotten gems you\'re unlikely to hear anywhere else
(from Jimmy Ray to The Course and Clock). Our Bargain Bin first hour of
1997’s pop flops (from Mary Kiani to Newton and \*\*whisper \*\* Kylie
Minogue - yes it was that year) kicks the night off as usual from 9pm.



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/19001/one-more-time-1997

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents: PROFESSOR MARSTON AND THE WONDER WOMEN (2017)
eventsByFilter.description:
On closing night of Three’s Company: Polyamory, Throuples, and Unethical
Non-Mongamy we screen Professor Marston and the Wonder Women (2017), an
endearing gem from director Angela Robinson (D.E.B.S.) that tells the
true story of the inventor of Wonder Woman, and his polyamorous
relationship with the two women who inspired the character. Far from
fading into the background, the women behind the man are as much the
context of the story as he is, and their love for each other during a
time where acceptance defied imagination is an integral part of the
film’s emotional foundation. Luke Evans, Rebecca Hall, and Bella
Heathcote star in a story of censorship, repression, and forbidden love
against a backdrop of 1940s America.

Come for the vintage bisexuals and rope bondage, stay for the romance
and extremely horny origins of a comic-book icon. Whatever your
pleasure, you’ll find us cosy in the basement at Dalston Superstore for
another night curated especially for our beloved trans audience.

“How are you going to learn anything at all about life if you refuse to
live it?”

  Tickets available via
OutSavvy: https://www.outsavvy.com/organiser/transmissions

Subtitles will be displayed throughout the film. Seating is a mixture of
benches, backed chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is first come,
first served.
eventsByFilter.summary: Transmissions presents: PROFESSOR MARSTON AND THE WONDER WOMEN (2017)

eventsByFilter.name: DRAG UP! Queer China UK
eventsByFilter.description:
We are excited to announce the screening of Drag up! The Documentary.
This documentary followed seven young, queer, Chinese-identified people
who signed up for a performance art project in London. In this
month-long community art project, they would learn about drag and how to
perform it, discover their queer Chinese heritage, and explore ways to
de-westernise and #decolonisedrag. Guests: Dawn Li (she/her),
participant & performer in the Drag Up Project and member of Queer China
UK. Yabin (she/her), participant and performer in the Drag up! Project.
Qiuyan (she/her), LGBTQ+ activist and co-director of Drag up! Project.
SCREENING: Basement 7:30-9:30pm AFTERPARTY: Upstairs 9.30-11.30pm
