eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents: OCEAN\'S 8 (2018)
eventsByFilter.description:
In May, multi-talented hurricane, creator of the infamous Kate Cobain
powerpoint, and the other mind behind Transmissions, Heather Estradiol
(@djungelskog\_gf) is back at the reigns for a whole month of lesbian
larceny, sapphic supremacy, and extreme yearning. From elaborate heists,
to cyber crime, espionage, murder most foul, and devious dealings done
in style, these ladies are simply up to no good. Will they get the bag
and get away with it, or will love get in the way? Join us every week to
find out, and celebrate a mantra many hold dear: be gay, do crime.

On opening night we screen the ultra-slick Ocean’s 8 (2018). Far from
just the girlbossification of Soderbergh, it offers a certain hit that
only a movie with this stacked a cast and this big a boner for bad girls
could. Sexual tension and unspoken history simmer between Sandra Bullock
and Cate Blanchett‘s characters as they lead a gang of women through a
plan to steal a very expensive necklace full of diamonds from round Anne
Hathaway’s neck at the MET Gala. Rihanna, Sarah Paulson, Mindy Kaling,
and more co-star in a sleek, sexy romp that we just can’t stop coming
back to.

Not gay enough for you? Wait till you hear about Sandy’s rumoured
private member’s club. Join us downstairs at Dalston Superstore for
another night at the movies by and for London’s trans community.

“Somewhere out there is an eight-year-old girl lying in bed, dreaming of
being a criminal. Let’s do this for her.”

Tickets available via
OutSavvy: https://www.outsavvy.com/organiser/transmissions

Subtitles will be displayed throughout the film. Seating is a mixture of
benches, backed chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is first come,
first served.

eventsByFilter.name: RIPOSTE - QUEER ART RAVE
eventsByFilter.description:
Queer art-rave. A rave starting a 9pm with an hour social, with 2
dancefloors blasting music from 10pm until 5.30am, a free breakfast
until 6am and performances, installations, a market place and games all
night long. THE LAST BATTLE: at entrance you'll have the possibility to
join a team depending on your zodiac sign to finally decide which sign
is the bestest of all and kick ass. All night long there will be games
during which you can gain points for your team &amp; help your team
win. Meeting at 4am in the Courtyard to decide who's the winner. This is
a cute way to meet a lot of new queerdos ❤️LINE UP BELOW. Grab your tix
now as they're cheap, BIG LOVE.
xx----------------------------------ACCESSIBILITY INFORMATIONS-Stairs
across the venue (both of the main dance floors are up long flights of
stairs, roughly 30 each). -Groundfloor (chill space, playroom, bar
&amp; quieter room) accessible with no stairs, levelled access,
accessible toilets (please ask: there is 4 different toilets ground
floor so it can be tricky to find. ). Please note that the courtyard
floor partially has cobbles.-Some areas are quite dark (stairs).-Strobe
lights -If you do not have the means to pay for a ticket, please send us
a DM on instagram or email us at least a few days before the event. We
encourage to pay at least concession price as it is a hella pricey
&amp; time consuming event to put on, put we can also offer free
tickets if needed. This offers if only available before we are sold
out.-Covid: we follow the U.K. gov guidelines and tests are not required
upon entry but welfare has self test kids as well as masks upon
demands.-Welfare can also provide you for free: food, safer sex products
(condoms, lube, dental damns), gloves, finger gloves, wet wipes, hand
sanitisers, lollipops, menstruation products &amp; non-judgmental
chats to resolve any problems you might have. They can also provide a
uber service if needed (please only use if really in need: we have a
limited amount of funds dedicated to this scheme). The welfare is a
fully queer, very diverse team of ravers that are trained and have seen
it all. There is also SIA security &amp; medics on site.Please
contact riposte.london@gmail.com or DM us on
https://www.instagram.com/riposte.london if you have any questionENTRY
REQUIREMENTS- This is an 18+ event- Valid form of PHYSICAL ID
(photocopies / pictures not accepted) with a picture: please check
Electrowerkz website to see what form of ID is accepted. Plan
accordingly and tell your friends. No ID no entry.- A ticket (no tickets
on the door if we are sold out)-You will be searched by security upon
entry (body search + bag) &amp; your ID will be scanned as in all
major London venue. You can ask for someone specific to search you.-Last
entry 2.30amIf these requirements are not respected, you will not be
able to gain entry and you will not get
refunded.---------------------------------- DJs / LIVE MUSIC:TOP FLOOR

eventsByFilter.name: DALSTON SUPERSTORE\'S 15th BIRTHDAY
eventsByFilter.description:
15 YEARS OF DALSTON SUPERSTORE **PRESALE TIX NOW SOLD OUT. TICKETS
AVAILABLE ON THE DOOR** East London’s legendary queer pleasure palace is
celebrating FIFTEEN YEARS! You are cordially invited to kick off this
major milestone with her. For a decade and a half, Dalston Superstore
has pushed boundaries to innovate queer talent: platforming the hottest
local DJs, debaucherous drag icons and gagworthy gogos. We’re
indescribably proud of the unique energy our humble corridor has
cultivated, and the vibrant community that surrounds us. To commemorate
this unbelievable occasion, we’re cramming the cream of the crop into
ELEVEN HOT HOURS of mischief and madness, bringing you the biggest
birthday celebration yet. Our favourite lovers and friends will provide
mind bending bops and guilty pleasure screamers, with a side of drag
decadence, all the way thru to 5am. While East London’s most fabulous
feud continues as Dolls vs Twinks take over room 3. May 2024 is the
biggest month Dalston Superstore has ever seen. Mark your calendars,
this is only the beginning… Artwork by the legendary @1thingfor1day £8
AFTER 8 / £12 AFTER 10 / £15 AFTER 11

eventsByFilter.name: Comedy Night: John Tothill and Will Owen (WIPs)
eventsByFilter.description:
[ TICKETs ][1] Two Edinburgh WIPs from rising comedy stars John Tothill and Will Owen!

**John Tothill: Thank God This Lasts Forever (Work in Progress)**

Last year, John Tothill was visited by a series of terrible plagues.
Now, he\'s desperate to tell you all about it (preferably over many
drinks and maybe the tiniest cigarette?). Imagine the Old Testament,
with less historical accuracy and even more divine intervention. And
it\'s a stand-up show, not a book. Chortle Awards\' Best Newcomer
nominee 2024. John\'s debut show was one of the Best-Reviewed Edinburgh
Fringe Shows of 2023 ([Comedy.co.uk][2]). As seen on Comedy Central
Live. \'Resplendent, ridiculous, didactic, and fabulous\' (*Tatler*).

*\*\*\*\*\* EdFest*

*\*\*\*\*1⁄2 Chortle*

*\*\*\*\* Guardian*

*\*\*\*\* Telegraph*

*\*\*\*\* Skinny*

**Will Owen: Like, Nobody\'s Watching (Work in Progress)**

Watch rising star Will Owen fight for his place in the hearts of the
Great British Public, in a competition entirely of his own-making. From
the Winner of Leicester Square New Comedian of the Year comes a
glittering debut comedy hour of fastidiously-curated spontaneity.
Featuring admittedly over-developed musings on popularity, performance
and the Pussycat Dolls. He will dance like nobody’s watching, just as
long as somebody is. The stakes *have* been higher. Bath Comedy Festival
New Comedian Second Runner-Up 2022; 2Northdown Finalist 2022.

‘a master of the casually cruel comment, biting yet delivered with an
archetypal Gen Z indifference… it’s a winning formula\' (*Chortle*)

Directed by Daniel Emery and Molly Stacey. 



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/19336/queer-comedy-night-john-tothill-and-will-owen-wips
[2]: http://comedy.co.uk/
eventsByFilter.summary: Comedy Night: John Tothill and Will Owen (WIPs)

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents: KAJILLIONAIRE (2020):
eventsByFilter.description:
From programmer Heather Estradiol and indie darling Miranda July comes a
sweet and strange story about a young woman (bicon Evan Rachel Wood) who
finds her world turned upside down when her criminal parents invite an
outsider (Gina Rodriguez) to join them on the major heist they’re
planning. The complications of a peculiar upbringing, neurodivergence,
and budding romance all throw a spanner in the works and result in a
film that is by turns funny, affecting, and beautiful.   Join us
downstairs at Dalston Superstore for night two of Crimes of Passion:
Criminal Dykes, this one’s a charmer.   “Most happiness comes from dumb
things.”  

Tickets available via
OutSavvy: https://www.outsavvy.com/organiser/transmissions

Subtitles will be displayed throughout the film. Seating is a mixture of
benches, backed chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is first come,
first served.

eventsByFilter.name: Chocked Up!
eventsByFilter.description:
[ TICKETS ][1] Choked Up! Is a brand spanking new night for all your scratch night
itches, if you’re into that kind of thing. 

Our debut night is a chance to catch the first ever screening of Good
Grief! A film by host and choreographer, Daze Hingorani, exploring the
intersections of queerness and grief and how joyful it is to love
anything enough that you miss it that much. 

With stunning performances by Chiara Martina and Niamh Keady and even a
secret third act, it’s the first of many nights where we’ll be
platforming new works by outstanding performers. 

Doors will open at 7pm for a swift start of 7:30pm for performances,
there’ll be plenty of breaks for drinks and kisses and even a Q&A
for all the behind the scenes gossip of the making of Good Grief!

Early Bird (limited quantity) tickets £6

Standard Tickets £8

Limited quantity on the door £10

eventsByFilter.name: Thursday Social Drinks In Soho
eventsByFilter.description:
Join me and your fellow trans lovelies for a relaxed meetup which takes
place on the second \*\*Thursday of the month in the Soho, central
London area.\*\*

This place has a great buzz. It\'s a sneaky way to start the weekend
early. Come and join us :)

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

We have a private area upstairs in the venue, which is plenty of space
for us all to chat, hear each other and relax.

Thursday is the new start of the weekend. Let\'s use this opportunity to
make some new friends and chat about whatever pleases you.  
This event will suit you if you are new to attending the meetup or are
one of our wonderful regulars. It is a popular evening with lots of
different people popping in. There is no need to be nervous. We are all
very friendly and welcoming. You\'ll feel right at home. :)

\*\*What is this meetup?\*\*  
This is a relaxed, friendly and inclusive meetup for the trans people of
London. This is an opportunity to make new friends and chat over a
sneaky Thursday drink.

\*\*Who is it for?\*\*  
Everyone from the trans community is welcome. This is an opportunity to
be yourself, whatever you identify as. We are inclusive and happy to
welcome you.

\*\*How does it work?\*\*  
All you have to do is RSVP and then we will message you on the day with
the event location. Then, all you have to do is show up.

We will make sure that you meet some new people and get a chance to get
to know your fellow trans buddies. This event is very friendly and will
welcome you and make sure you feel comfortable and happy.  
It is free to attend, just buy yourself a drink at the bar.

\*\*Please Note:\*\* RSVP is a must as the location (based around Soho)
will be sent by email on the day to those who have RSVP\'d only. RSVP
closes at 16.00 on the day of the event.

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

eventsByFilter.name: COMANAVAGO Presents: Club Morpheus
eventsByFilter.description:
Club Morpheus… It is the club night of your dreams.

 [ TICKETS ][1] “In conjunction with our new album release of the same name, we set out
to create a glamorous club scene made for anyone and everyone with
VFDalston as the perfect location and partner.”

It will be a closely curated night hosted by COMANAVAGO and featuring
friends and collaborators such as Flourish, Heeli and Eliza Legzdina,
the musical vibe will be uplifting and euphoric dance pop music. Think
Madonna Confessions On A Dancefloor, Scissor Sisters, Jessie Ware,
Sylvester, George Michael. 

COMANAVAGO are the fast rising queer electro pop duo with a penchant for
forward thinking pop music that will warm the coldest of souls and bring
toe tapping glee to dance floors across the world. Signed to ultra
records the band has seen their music soar to new heights including
support across the world including bbc1 xtra, French radio support, and
a hearty mix of underground DJs and radio stations playing their tunes.

eventsByFilter.description:
NEUROTICA IS GRADUATING TO PRIME TIME! Join us on May 10th for our first
Friday ever! Serving up vibes upstairs we have Ki Griffin, Tryb and Rabz
(from SE’s iconic dyke night WET). They will keep you dancing all night
to Pop and RnB classics and 2step bangers. Joining them on the bar, we
have East London’s sexiest GoGo’s Antonia-Bloux and Izzy MacC. In the
laser-pit, we have not only extra extra lasers, but an iconic line-up as
well. We’re excited to welcome scene icons: BDE resident, Sadidas, and
adored nightlife diva and INFERNO DJ, Ashtrey. Joining them is Karlie
Marx, NEUROTICA founder and Superstore’s biggest laser enthusiast.
Expect to hear techno, breaks, trance, and electro. As always, expect a
ridiculous amount of lasers xxx £8 BEFORE 11 / £10 AFTER

eventsByFilter.name: Femmme Fraiche
eventsByFilter.description:
The Anti-Eurovision Party! Watching Eurovision? yes? WHY? BOYCOTT!!!!
Come down to Fèmmme Fraîche instead – it’ll be much more camp, much more
fun, MUCH better music and we promise no nil point. 10s 10s 10s across
the board, with our sexy line-up at our May instalment of Fèmmme Fraîche
down at the mothership Dalston Superstore – come join us on Sat May 11th
In the basement, we have the incredible Serenda joining us, we’ve been
following her for some time, and her Rinse residency and her latest EP
release ‘The Prophecy’ on Lovechild has really put her on the map and
we’re excited for her to bringing us her sexy beats to the basement. On
warm-up duties, we have another up-and-coming DJ Katie Baxter who’s been
making big waves on the music scene for a while, as a presenter on
Reprezent as well as producer and co-host of Jaguar’s Utopia Talks
podcast and of course, basement line-up wouldn’t be complete without our
resident Michelle Manetti. Then up top we’ve got more 10/10 treats.
Opening duties is your fave spicy Welsh daddy dyke Just Gia followed by
a Fèmmme Fraîche debut from London’s premiere Drag terrorist The Doll
Named Dan then for the final hours on usual closing upstairs our fave
duo of Fraîchness, Fèmmme Fraîche residents Linzi Symons and Darren
Skene on butt2butt duties with all your trash-tastic faves. For gogo
duties, we have our fave super-sonic sassy pair, Danni Spooner and
Reenie expect ass-shakin’ sexy, stupendous bar-top antics. £8 ENTRY
BEFORE 11pm / £10 AFTER

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents: D.E.B.S. (2004):
eventsByFilter.description:
Always wished Charlie’s Angels was just that little bit gayer? Or
watched films like Legally Blonde and wished the girls kissed? On night
three of Crimes of Passion: Criminal Dykes, Heather Estradiol has just
the film for you.

Directed by Angela Robinson (Professor Marston and the Wonder Women),
D.E.B.S. (2004) follows a team of international teenage super spies who
are put at odds when one of their members falls for the enemy. Will she
stay loyal to the firm or follow her heart? It’s the question on
everyone’s mind in a classic full of B Movie charms and bubblegum
visuals, a quintessentially 2000s piece of queer cinema about girls,
guns, and going gay for your nemesis.

Stars Devon Aoki, Jordana Brewster, Meagan Goode, Jimmi Simpson, Holland
Taylor, and more.

Join us at headquarters in the basement of Dalston Superstore for
another night at the movies.   “The only brave thing I’ve done this
whole time is what I’m doing now.”  

Tickets available via
OutSavvy: https://www.outsavvy.com/organiser/transmissions

Subtitles will be displayed throughout the film. Seating is a mixture of
benches, backed chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is first come,
first served.

eventsByFilter.name: Pumping Velvet
eventsByFilter.description:
Your favorite queer rave baby is turning six! And in celebration we’re
inviting all our shawties to come party like it’s our birthday, because
this time it actually is!  In the lazerpit festivities will be dedicated
to showcasing Pumping Velvet’s immaculate residents. Starting the night
will be one of the sexiest DJ sandwiches Superstore has ever seen –
Sofie K and Sam PV with their first ever b2b, coming in hot and heavy
with entrancing bangers to get you pumped and gagging for more.  Fresh
from an extended Asia tour is our fabulous headliner Joe Delon. Joe’s
sets represent everything we hold dear about dancing music at PV,
drawing on the fundamentals of dance music’s past – the snap of a disco
break, the sleaze of a Chicago bassline, and the bittersweet touch of
Italo – and connects them to its vivid present and creating moments of
pure pop catharsis along the way. Upstairs sees a wavy night of music as
M.Kwas and Edith Escobar step up with sets bound to span bashment,
garage and pop, while Kunteaa showcases her roots in black queer culture
with everything from ballroom to grime to baile funk. Come find us in
the club with a bottle bub and PUMP SOME VELVET.  
£7 BEFORE 11 / £10 AFTER

working within London/Online or those looking to learn basic DJ skills.
Started as a small meet up at the London LGBT Centre, they are now a
growing community of genre-fluid LGBTQ+ DJs meeting on a monthly basis.
Sign up details: During the night, we have 6x 20 minute slots from 7-9pm
that you can sign up in advance here, followed by 6 x 30 minute slots
from 9-12pm that you can sign up for on the night. Please note that this

eventsByFilter.name: Testo Hunkie
eventsByFilter.description:
Testo Hunkie is a social and community fundraiser event for the boys and
their pals. This time we'll be back with a big party at the
Fox&amp;Firkin till late, Thursday is the new Friday baby. What to
expect : -Our ever popular arm wrestling competition, hosted by the
mother to all the lost boys Lori Mae. Sign up for a chance to be the
champ of the night. -Fashion competition returns with a new theme is
Hold me Tight; bring your best ropes, chains, carabiner, harnesses,
straps and buckle up for a sexy night. See you on the dance floor from
10pm with Harietta dj, the trans David Guetta. COVID’s still a thing.
Please test and stay home if you feel unwell. Testo Hunkie is an 18+
event. We might have to check your ID. Testo Hunkie is an inclusive,
LGBTQ+ event, although be aware that is a trasn focus event centering
transmasculine people.We’re here for the celebration of all bodies and
gender expressions. Testo Hunkie is the dream of two trans fags. We’re
doing it DIY and raising some money for trans\* joy whilst we’re at it.
We’ll be raising money for gender-affirming fundraisers through ticket
sales and donations.Money will be distributed to anyone who makes a
request. Email us a link to your fundraising page to
testohunkie@gmail.com and we’ll donate a split of the money raised. Join
Us For Another Hunksome time. Food and gossip: 7pm-8pmArm wrestling:
8:30 - 9:30pmFashion Competition: 10:30 pmDJ set by Harietta : 10pm-12am
How to find us:The Fox &amp; Firkin316 Lewisham High St.,London,
SE13 6JZ Accessibility:The venue and garden have step-free access and
accessible toilets. Although, the exit to the garden may be too narrow
for some wheelchair / mobility scooters(please note the smallest width
is 692mm). If you are attending a garden event and your wheelchair is
bigger than our garden door, let us know, we can consider alternatives.
Service animals are welcome.As part of our accessibility policy, the
venue provide free Personal Assistant tickets for Deaf or disabled
customers who cannot attend without support - please email at
info@foxfirkin.com We reserve space for those with limited mobility. To
secure seating, please email the venue.

eventsByFilter.name: SPILT MILK Queer-Feminist Art Exhibition and After Party
eventsByFilter.description: [ TICKETS ][1] About Spilt Milk…  A RETALIATION AGAINST THE LACK OF REPRESENTATION FOR QUEER ARTISTS OF MARGINALISED GENDERS IN THE ART WORLD - SPILT MILK IS BOTH A PROTEST AND A CELEBRATION. AT SPILT MILK, WE AIM TO BRING QUEERNESS IN THE LIMELIGHT. TO USE OUR VULNERABILITY IN OUR FAVOUR AND INVITE THE REST INTO OUR WORLD. Theme of the Exhibition: Letting Go  This year we are highlighting vulnerability by focusing on something very intimate and special within the queer community: the transition from day to night. So…..we are hosting an iconic afterparty at the venue from 10 until close We want everyone to join us!!!  If you wish to attend the exhibit and afterparty, make sure you purchase an exhibit + afterparty ticket or an add-on after party ticket along with your timed entry slot.  DJ Lineup: TBC (OPEN CALL IS ON NOW)  Want to DJ at Spilt Milk? More info here: [https://www.instagram.com/spiltmilkkkkkk/][2] How it works… Buy a ticket online or at the door (limited capacity so book ahead of time to avoid disappointment) Ticket time slots are as follows:  * Early-bird special for £6.50  - first entry at 6 pm or let us know if you want a different slot :)  * Exhibit Entry 1 hour timed-entry  for £8. Stay as long as you please! 1. 7pm-8pm  2. 8pm-9 pm 3. 9pm-10pm  * Exhibit and Afterparty for £13.50 for 10pm-1am   * Add-on After Party Tickets are £5.50 (limited supply - afterparty starts at 11pm). The add-on allows you to exit the exhibition and return for the afterparty!  You must enter within the time slot of your ticket, latecomers may only be admitted under venue staff discretion.  Anyone who wants to attend the afterparty, should either purchase a 10pm entry ticket OR an add-on after party ticket If you are low-income, travelling from far away for the exhibition, or otherwise cannot afford a ticket, we have a limited number of tickets so you don’t have to miss out! Please DM @spiltmilkkkkkk \*\*\* This event is for the feminist queer community!! We welcome lesbians, bi babes, sapphic queers, and our queer, trans, gay, and non-binary friends of ALL genders and sexualities - we don\'t tolerate transphobia, biphobia, racism, or any kind of gross behaviour! LGBTQ+ Allies are welcome and are expected to respect our safety policies\*\*\*\*\*\* [1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/19479/spiltmilklondon [2]: https://www.instagram.com/spiltmilkkkkkk/

eventsByFilter.description: [ TICKETS ][1] ### **Ugly Sisters @ VFD (WIP)** piss / CARNATION  are a multi-award winning transfemme performance duo. This is a horrible, messy and dirty and sinister work in progress of their new show *ugly sisters.* it is the surreal rendition of a real-life encounter between Germaine Greer and her transgender superfan which bridges live-art, alt-comedy and speculative fiction. but really, it is a love story. and it is award winning. even tho it hasn\'t been made rly yet. previous acclaim: **UNTAPPED AWARD WINNER ** **OFFIE AWARD WINNER ** ★★★★ - “brutally revealing and beautifully soft” - The Guardian  ★★★★★ - “peerlessly fearless” - To Do List  ★★★★★ - “nuclear charm and shocking gusto” North West End  ★★★★★ - “truly dark” **Reviews Hub ** \- we will also be joined by some of our yet to be announced friends for sum WIP warm up acts  x [1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/20051/ugly-sisters-vfd-wip

eventsByFilter.name: Online Speed Friending for Queer Women and Non-Binary People in UK
eventsByFilter.description:
Enjoy a relaxed online speed friending event for LGBTQ+ women, trans and
non-binary people via Zoom on Tuesday 28 May, 8-9pm.We know sometimes
you’re just looking to make some queer friends, so speed friending is a
very non-pressurised way to meet lovely new people.You bring your own
drink and chat. We will pair you up with approximately 10 fantastic
LGBTQ ladies and non-binary folk. You’ll have around 5 minutes with each
pairing to spark up a good conversation. We’ll also help kickstart the
event with some friendly ice breakers. The next day, we will match up
those who both expressed interest so you can keep the conversation going
without us. We will just send you a little form to fill out
post-dates.The day before the event, we will send you a ZOOM link so you
can join in at the start time. We invite you to join us from across the
U.K. COST: £10

eventsByFilter.name: Long Live Queer Nightlife, a FREE community event.
eventsByFilter.description:
[ RSVP here ][1] **Long Live Queer Night Life **

**7 pm Doors **

**7.30 pm Start / Three sections of 20 minutes with 10-minute reset
breaks. **

A panel discussion with author Amin Ghaziani, Phoebe Patey-Ferguson, and
Kat Hudson will be hosted by Lyall Hakaraia. Talks of the establishment
of VFDs activation **Femmetopia**, which encouraged queer disrupters in
East London to tear down the patriarchy and celebrate diversity beyond
the heteronormative.  We will explore the wider themes of change
recorded in the book and finish with a Q and A. 

**9 pm to 9.20 pm performance and then dancing till 11 pm.**  
Following the discussion there will be cabaret performances from QTIPOC
artist Rhys\'s Pieces, then dancing until late. 

**Please RSVP so we can reserve you a spot !**  
 

You can also buy the book ‘Long Live Queer Night Life’ published by
Princeton University Press at the event and signed by the author Amin
Ghaziani at an incredibly discounted rate of £15.  
  
**Amin Ghaziani** 

The book: In this exhilarating journey into underground parties,
pulsating with life and limitless possibility, Acclaimed author Amin
Ghaziani unveils the unexpected revolution revitalizing urban nightlife.

Far from the gay bar with its largely white, gay male clientele, here is
a dazzling scene of secret parties— club nights—wherein culture
creatives, many of whom are queer, trans, and racial minorities, reclaim
the night in the name of those too long left out. Episodic, nomadic, and
radically inclusive, club nights are refashioning queer nightlife in
boundlessly imaginative and powerfully defiant ways.

@amin\_ghaziani @princetonupress

**Dr Phoebe Patey-Ferguson** is an academic, artist and producer. Their
research expertise is on international theatre festivals, rooted in the
Sociology of Theatre and Performance. This work frequently intersects
with their further research interests in live art, contemporary British
theatre, and queer theory. 

Phoebe is the course leader of the world\'s first MA in Queer
Performance training students to create, explore, examine and expand
queer performance practice.

@ppateyferg

**Kat Hudson Katherine \'Kat\' Hudson** is a multimedia artist and
writer who works closely with archives and libraries. Kat has curated
notable community-focused exhibitions and nightlife events and lives and
works in London, England.  
@kathudson\_  
Kat\'s personal art practice explores individual multiplicity,
collaborative creation, community wellbeing and performing utopia
through drawing, painting, collage and sound. Her curatorial practice
explores queer intersectional feminism, the work of her peers and
subcultural art and nightlife movements in London.

**Lyall Hakaraia** is a QTBIPOC Maori artist and Takatapui Rangatira
queer community organiser who runs the queer art spaces  VFD over two
venues in Dalston . A parent to our beloved daughter Tui and a raft of
fish, birds and two black cats.

@lyallhakaraia

**Rhys Pieces  **is a gender-f\*cking cabaret creature! A one-stop
cabaret troupe, multitalented, multi-award winning messy, smelly,
fabulous, and putting on a show! They are the creator and host of
@QueerdosCabaret and have toured the world shaking their pieces! 

@RhyssPieces\_





[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/20184/long-live-queer-nightlife-a-free-community-event
eventsByFilter.summary: Long Live Queer Nightlife, a FREE community event.

eventsByFilter.description:
[ Tickets ][1] Queer Noise is back with another amazing line-up of London\'s finest
poets, musicians and performers!

 Join us on **May 30th** at VFDalston for a simultaneously silly and
sensitive exploration of queer community, identity, and relationships
hosted by the **dyke**namic duo, Grace Quigley and Kia Matanky-Becker.

In addition to our amazing line-up of performers, photographer Cris
vople will be selling queer as fuck prints and cyanotype\'s 

We\'ve missed you and we know you\'ve missed us two, so get yourself
down to VFDalston for an evening of queer gorgeousness. 

Please arrive in time for a 7.30 start

**Featuring:**

Poetry from Kia Matanky-Becker and Grace Quigley 

Music from Holly Blair

Music from Honey Birch 

Dance / movement from Stephanie Burrell 

Music from Bella Artois

 

Doors 7pm

First Half 7.30 - 8.15

Break 8.15 - 8.40

Second Half 8.40 - 9.30

**TICKETS:**

Standard: £8

Solidarity: £14\*

Pay-it-forward: £9\*\*

 \*Solidarity tickets: for allies or those who can afford to pay a
higher ticket price to will help us keep this event sustainable and make
it grow, so please consider this option if you can.

\*\*Pay-it-forward tickets: please consider this option if you\'re an
ally who\'d like to support low/unwaged people from the community.

On the first Monday of every month: – FEMME FATALE DJS – HOT BABES

VINYL Picture this: a night where the beats are as fierce as the talent

events, we seek to inspire, showcase, and elevate the art of turntablism
which overwhelmingly favors cisgender men. Want to get involved? SIGN UP

or walk in off Kingsland Road! Want to play but don’t own any vinyl? NO

event! 7pm. – 10pm SIGN UP SETS 10pm – Midnight FREE FOR ALL SETS

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents: TOM OF FINLAND (2017)
eventsByFilter.description:
This month at Transmissions, the team behind HARDER: A Season of Lesbian
Kink is back for a second June of hot and heavy curation for our beloved
crowd of trans people of taste, and basement dwelling perverts. Runner
up of Bootblack Europe 2024, Butch Boots (Riposte, Pop-Up Dyke Bar) is
becoming a fixture in the London scene, with its creator Astrid Johnson
taking her bespoke bootblacking and leathercare services to some of the
hottest events in town. Lucky for us, she’ll be in residence for four
nights tracing the history of leather faggotry on screen, showcasing
shorts by the iconic Kenneth Anger, William Friedkin’s monumental
classic Cruising, rare documentary High Shine, and more.

But before all that, we screen Tom of Finland (2017), a celebratory
biopic of Touko Laaksonen, an artist whose legendary homoerotic
illustrations bloomed amidst the oppression of the 1950s, capturing
existing subcultures and influencing those that would follow. Join us
for a tribute to the life and work of a pioneering queer artist, whose
subversion has proved immortal.

“Everybody should see your drawings”

Tickets available via
OutSavvy: https://www.outsavvy.com/organiser/transmissions

Subtitles will be displayed throughout the film. Seating is a mixture of
benches, backed chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is first come,
first served.

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents: 4 SHORTS BY KENNETH ANGER
eventsByFilter.description:
On night two of our month-long collaboration with Butch Boots, come find
us deep down in the basement at Dalston Superstore for back to back
screenings of four short films by the controversial and iconic gay
experimentalist Kenneth Anger. Anger’s work silkily spans the sacred and
the profane, mixing cauldrons full of occult imagery with the
homoeroticism old Hollywood masculinity, psychedelia, fetish, and a
disdain for the workings of capital and all its fascist bedfellows.

See some of his very best when we screen Kustom Kar Kommandos,
Fireworks, Lucifer Rising, and Scorpio Rising.   “Making a movie is
casting a spell”

 

Tickets available via
OutSavvy: https://www.outsavvy.com/organiser/transmissions

Subtitles will be displayed throughout the film. Seating is a mixture of
benches, backed chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is first come,
first served.

eventsByFilter.name: Vinyl Bitch Presents: Spin Spin Sugar
eventsByFilter.description:
Vinyl b*tches are spinning Dalston Superstore like a record baby!
Through our event, we seek to inspire, showcase, and elevate the art of
turntablism from a FLINTA perspective. An art form that predominantly
prioritizes creating space for cisgender men. . What’s happening b*tch??
Record swap with other vinyl b*tches to expand your collection with
hidden gems Engage with our panel discussion, where FLINTA industry
experts and talented DJs share their insights on navigating barriers
Pick up some new DJ skills at our FLINTA-led turntable workshop, where
you’ll learn the art of vinyl manipulation 🙂 (SPACES LIMITED)* Party
with our 16 DJs spanning across various music genres proving that vinyl
DJing is not just about nostalgia but a diverse expression of creativity
. Thursday, June 13th 6 p.m. – 2:30 a.m. at Dalston Superstore \*Our
workshop will be for FLINTA-only participants. Please do not purchase a
workshop ticket if you do not identify as FLINTA (female, lesbian,
intersex, nonbinary, trans, agender). This is to keep our learning
environment safe and shame-free. . Big thanks to our
sponsors @technics\_global @mixcloud @flstudio @planetwaxuk @rookrecords for
providing our event with equipment and extra goodies for our
participants. This event is made possible by their generous support and
shared vision of empowering marginalized talent in the music industry. .
See you on the dance floor!

eventsByFilter.name: Thursday Social Drinks In Soho
eventsByFilter.description:
Join me and your fellow trans lovelies for a relaxed meetup which takes
place on the second \*\*Thursday of the month in the Soho, central
London area.\*\*

This place has a great buzz. It\'s a sneaky way to start the weekend
early. Come and join us :)

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

We have a private area upstairs in the venue, which is plenty of space
for us all to chat, hear each other and relax.

Thursday is the new start of the weekend. Let\'s use this opportunity to
make some new friends and chat about whatever pleases you.  
This event will suit you if you are new to attending the meetup or are
one of our wonderful regulars. It is a popular evening with lots of
different people popping in. There is no need to be nervous. We are all
very friendly and welcoming. You\'ll feel right at home. :)

\*\*What is this meetup?\*\*  
This is a relaxed, friendly and inclusive meetup for the trans people of
London. This is an opportunity to make new friends and chat over a
sneaky Thursday drink.

\*\*Who is it for?\*\*  
Everyone from the trans community is welcome. This is an opportunity to
be yourself, whatever you identify as. We are inclusive and happy to
welcome you.

\*\*How does it work?\*\*  
All you have to do is RSVP and then we will message you on the day with
the event location. Then, all you have to do is show up.

We will make sure that you meet some new people and get a chance to get
to know your fellow trans buddies. This event is very friendly and will
welcome you and make sure you feel comfortable and happy.  
It is free to attend, just buy yourself a drink at the bar.

\*\*Please Note:\*\* RSVP is a must as the location (based around Soho)
will be sent by email on the day to those who have RSVP\'d only. RSVP
closes at 16.00 on the day of the event.

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

eventsByFilter.name: 56T trans & non-binary sexual health & wellbeing service
eventsByFilter.description:
56T has become a booked appointment service instead of walk-in. Appointments can be booked here: [https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/][1]. This service is for:  
·         Hormone injections (with proof of ID and prescription)

·         Hormone level monitoring and liver function testing

·         PrEP – Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         PEP – Post-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         Confidential sexual health screening and Hepatitis B & HPV
vaccinations

·         Cervical smear tests for anyone over 25 with a cervix – not
done as walk in, but pre-booked into Tuesday AM clinic

·         Sexual assault support

·         Domestic abuse support and IDVA – Independent Domestic
Violence Advocate

·         Health advisor support and signposting into other services for
issues around housing, counselling etc.



[1]: https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/
eventsByFilter.summary: 56T trans & non-binary sexual health & wellbeing service

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents: CRUISING (1980) + LEATHER (1996)
eventsByFilter.description:
Round three of Butch Boots‘ residence at Transmissions brings a rare
short, and an all-time classic to our humble basement screen. William
Friedkin (The Exorcist, Sorcerer) reached a great many heights in his
storied career, but perhaps the filmmaker’s most fascinating achievement
is Cruising (1980), a dark and seductive thriller starring Al Pacino as
a NYC cop sent undercover to find a serial killer targeting men in the
city’s underground of gay kink, where he must disappear into the fetish
clubs, meat markets, and cruising grounds that populate the night-time
landscape. Whether he’ll survive, and if he’ll still be the same person
if he does, remains to be seen.

Throughout it’s production in 1979, Cruising was dogged by protestors
from New York’s gay community who believed the piece to be so homophobic
that there were numerous elaborate disruptions during filming, which
continued upon theatrical release. But despite the controversy of the
day, Friedkin’s film has only become more and more beloved in subsequent
years by queer audiences who have found it impossible not to appreciate
its nuances, grime, and invaluable nature as a time capsule of the
leather scene.

“There’s a lot you don’t know about me.”

Before Cruising, not only you can join us for a screening of Hardy
Haberman‘s documentary short Leather (1996), which captures testimonies
from various leather lovers on the freedom found in the dynamics of
BDSM, you’ll also be able to purchase custom leather pieces by Dalston
royalty Malwina, ranging from cuffs, to studded bracelets, to harnesses
and more.

Find all this downstairs at Dalston Superstore, it’s gonna be quite a
night.

Tickets available via
OutSavvy: https://www.outsavvy.com/organiser/transmissions

Subtitles will be displayed throughout the film. Seating is a mixture of
benches, backed chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is first come,
first served.

eventsByFilter.name: BodySwap
eventsByFilter.description:
Dalston Superstore’s weekly party for the trans+ community BodySwap!
Every Wednesday from 10pm, curators Harietta and Karlie Marx play
Transgender Dance Music along with guest DJs, gogos and cvnty club kids.
It’s the only place to be on a Wednesday night in Dalston!  This is a
space for trans\* power, rage, beauty, resilience, and joy. BodySwap
celebrates and platforms trans\* artists from diverse backgrounds, while
raising crucial funds. BodySwap is by and for trans people. Each week we
raise money for a trans person’s healthcare fundraiser with our door
profits, so come through and party in community with the transexuals of
Kingsland Road.  FREE ENTRY

eventsByFilter.name: STAR Lounge
eventsByFilter.description:
STAR Lounge is a weekly space for those with experience of domestic
abuse and sexual violence. Come to spend time with us and talk with
people if you need, have some food and hot drinks, relax in the quiet
room or on our sofas. Once a month we have haircuts from Open Barbers
and massage therapy.

We’re proud to have created a safe, accessible and welcoming space for
survivor support at our LGBTIQ+ Centre all day on Thursdays.

DM us on Instagram or email Star.Lounge@lgbtiqoutside.org if you want to
join the STAR Lounge social group on Thursdays 10.30-4pm.

eventsByFilter.name: Richmond Park Intro Laps
eventsByFilter.description:
A gentle, supportive and informative session for anyone who wants to ride with us in a casual, no expectations way. Suitable for any kind of roadworthy bike, we\'ll spend the first hour introducing some group riding techniques and doing a lap or two of Richmond Park. Afterward we all head to the cafe for a chat and get to know each other a bit better.   
  
Open to all women, trans, and non-binary people of any ability and riding experience, no membership required. Sign up via our [RiderHQ events page][1].  
  
This is held monthly on the fourth Saturday of the month. It is facilitated by Velociposse members who volunteer their time to lead this ride. Occasionally we may have to cancel due to bad weather or volunteer availability so please check before attending!

eventsByFilter.name: Queer House Party
eventsByFilter.description:
We're ready for you. Are you ready for this? After our second sold-out
party at No90 we're back for round three bby. Get your tickets in.
Taking to the stage will be; Pecs with Black is King, a huge showcase of
black, drag king talent, a Giac de Castro live show and our regular
extravaganza by Haus of Telfar, an exquist arrray of the fierciest
dancers, Benny Yang, Bobby, Mama Mamba, Mx Fit, Novaya and Reix, all
hosted by Taali and Loren Dell'Arco as well as DJ sets by the infamous
Princess Julia, Harry Gay, UOKHUN?, Donnie Sunshine, passer and an
extremely secret headliner. . . We'll be hosting a social for all guests
from 8-9pm, particularly those attending on their own, with our amazing
vendors, think tattoos, tooth gems, badges, makeup and ANTICS. VENUE:
We’ve found our new home at No.90 Hackney Wick. It’s a huge warehouse
space with multiple rooms - meaning we will have a stacked lineup across
two rooms with spaces to watch shows, dance, and chill. EVERYONE IN:
Queer House Party is for everyone - but trans people to the front. We’ve
done our best to keep ticket prices down for everyone. Tickets are on a
sliding scale from £7.50-20. If this is still a barrier for you, please
drop us a message, and we will add you to our free list. ACCESS: No. 90
is a wheelchair-accessible venue. Both our IRL and URL events will have
British Sign Language and Audio Description available during the shows
-there is no hearing induction loop installed in the venue. Free tickets
are available for carers and PAs. If you have any specific questions,
drop us a line at queerhouseparty@gmail.com.COVID: We ask that everyone
tests before attending to keep the party safer. If you can’t get hold of
a test before the event, there will be a covid testing station outside
the venue. We will not ask for proof that you have tested.

address.streetAddress: No90 Hackney Wick, 94 Wallis Road, London

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Youth Art Collective
eventsByFilter.description:
****QUEER YOUTH ART COLLECTIVE (QYAC)** **12pm – 4pm – ONLINE GROUP 2pm
– 3.30pm****

**[Queer Youth Art Collective][1] (QYAC) has run workshops at The
Outside Project for LGBTQ young people 18-26 since August 2019. The
project delivers newly commissioned workshops by LGBTQ artists and youth
forums for attendees to discuss their practice and socialise weekly on
Sundays.**

**Our primary aims are to challenge isolation, provide free and engaging
arts workshops and build skills and infrastructure for a resilient,
peer-led LGBTQ arts and education culture in London and throughout the
UK.**

**We currently run 2 groups: ONLINE on ZOOM & OFFLINE at The Outside
Project LGBTIQ+ Centre. **

****How to access: Email queeryouthartcollective@gmail.com**. **Travel
refund available. ****



[1]: https://qyac.org.uk/

eventsByFilter.name: HHV Women\'s Training
eventsByFilter.description:
Run by and at Herne Hill Velodrome in South East London. You must have completed a track induction before attending any track sessions: see [hernehillvelodrome.com][1] for details.  
  
A supportive and challenging environment in which riders of all abilities can develop their track craft through a mixture of skills, drills and workshops. £10 including bike hire.  
  
If you have completed a track training accreditation, you can join the intermediate session. Once you have done several skills sessions and feel confident that you understand the different techniques on the track you can do a training accreditation, and then join the intermediate session, which combines faster exercises, intervals to improve fitness, and introduces racing techniques.   
  
Please note that these sessions are not run by Velociposse. We recommend them because: track cycling is great for general bike handling skills (you\'re on a fixed gear bike), fitness (no stopping for traffic lights!) and confidence.  

[1]: http://hernehillvelodrome.com

eventsByFilter.name: Slow skills
eventsByFilter.description:
The original and most essential Velociposse session! Our weekly skills sessions are traffic-free, and designed to improve your bike handling, cornering and coordination. No point going fast without the control! They’re run by several club members who are level 1 or 2 British Cycling coaches. No pressure, lots of fun. Most bikes are suitable as long as they are roadworthy. Free for members, and perfect as a taster session if you\'re thinking about joining the club. We often head to the pub or a park afterward to hang out: a perfect midweek evening! Sessions take place either in Stratford or in Bermondsey. There are no toilet or changing facilities available. Check our [events page][1] if you wanna come along. 

[1]: https://www.riderhq.com/o/p/7odu8dgn/f/velociposse/enter

eventsByFilter.name:
Transmissions presents: HIGH SHINE: 15 YEARS OF INTERNATIONAL MS
BOOTBLACK (2015) + LIVE BOOTBLACK DEMONSTRATION
eventsByFilter.description:
The finale of Butch Boots‘ residency at Transmissions brings you a rare
screening of High Shine: 15 Years of International Ms Bootblack (2015),
Christina K. Court‘s documentary which lovingly chronicles the history
and passion behind over a decade of community, and competitive
bootblacking. Informative, erotic, joyous, funny, and memorable, High
Shine gives viewers access to a wealth of collective knowledge on the
role of women in the leather scene, as well as voices that go far beyond
the white, cis archetype of the leather man.

“Sometimes activism comes in a tin of boot polish.”

After the film, the creator of Butch Boots (Riposte, Pop-Up Dyke Bar)
will be giving a live demonstration and sharing her own knowledge of
leathercare with our lucky audience members.

Join us deep down in the basement of Dalston Superstore, for an extra
special edition of Transmissions, a night by and for London’s trans
community.

Tickets available via
OutSavvy: https://www.outsavvy.com/organiser/transmissions

Subtitles will be displayed throughout the film. Seating is a mixture of
benches, backed chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is first come,
first served.
eventsByFilter.summary:
Transmissions presents: HIGH SHINE: 15 YEARS OF INTERNATIONAL MS
BOOTBLACK (2015) + LIVE BOOTBLACK DEMONSTRATION

eventsByFilter.name: Haute Mess: The Labour Party
eventsByFilter.description:
The messiest queer disco in town Haute Mess crash lands back at the
mothership for another chaotic two floor meltdown. Is it a bird? Is it a
plane? No diva, it’s an election! After a long gestation we’re fully
dilated with excitement to be back at the most iconic corridor on this
side of the veil to put the mother back in the mothership! We have a
water-droppingly, earth-shatteringly slimy line-up of goo-goo girls to
make you go gaa gaa, joined by a pre-apocalyptic post-partum slew of DJs
to get you dancing between contractions. The new dawn is almost here,
just one more push! You know it’s the place(nta) to be. So, do we have
your vote? £8 BEFORE 11 / £10 AFTER Door Policy Dalston Superstore is a
queer space. We prioritise our LGBTQIA+ customers and will sometimes ask
our straight & cis allies to support us by not taking up room in our
venue. Please be conscious of who this space is intended for and be

eventsByFilter.name: HHV Women\'s Training
eventsByFilter.description:
Run by and at Herne Hill Velodrome in South East London. You must have completed a track induction before attending any track sessions: see [hernehillvelodrome.com][1] for details.  
  
A supportive and challenging environment in which riders of all abilities can develop their track craft through a mixture of skills, drills and workshops. £10 including bike hire.  
  
If you have completed a track training accreditation, you can join the intermediate session. Once you have done several skills sessions and feel confident that you understand the different techniques on the track you can do a training accreditation, and then join the intermediate session, which combines faster exercises, intervals to improve fitness, and introduces racing techniques.   
  
Please note that these sessions are not run by Velociposse. We recommend them because: track cycling is great for general bike handling skills (you\'re on a fixed gear bike), fitness (no stopping for traffic lights!) and confidence.  

[1]: http://hernehillvelodrome.com

eventsByFilter.name: Slow skills
eventsByFilter.description:
The original and most essential Velociposse session! Our weekly skills sessions are traffic-free, and designed to improve your bike handling, cornering and coordination. No point going fast without the control! They’re run by several club members who are level 1 or 2 British Cycling coaches. No pressure, lots of fun. Most bikes are suitable as long as they are roadworthy. Free for members, and perfect as a taster session if you\'re thinking about joining the club. We often head to the pub or a park afterward to hang out: a perfect midweek evening! Sessions take place either in Stratford or in Bermondsey. There are no toilet or changing facilities available. Check our [events page][1] if you wanna come along.

eventsByFilter.name: Gravel Club
eventsByFilter.description:
Ad-hoc ride arranged by members taking in the trails of Epping Forest. Decent confidence needed: come to our slow skills sessions first if you\'re not sure.  
  
Usually: 7pm meeting in East London. Gravel or offroad bikes. 2-3 hour ride: good quality front light essential as this ride ends after nightfall and the trails are unlit. May pause over winter in bad/cold weather, but will run as often as we can!  
  
Arranged via Discord.  
  
Contact us if you\'re interested and not already in the club! [https://forms.gle/2Fk9VvqHg8HbEehMA][1]

eventsByFilter.name: VINYL BITCH: OPEN DECKS
eventsByFilter.description:
On the first Monday of every month: – FEMME FATALE DJS – HOT BABES
– FIERCE BEATS – EMPOWERING ENVIRONMENT – QUEER MAGIC – SH\*T LOADS OF
VINYL Picture this: a night where the beats are as fierce as the talent
behind them, and where every drop is a testament to the power and skills
of femme and nonbinary turntablists! Through Vinyl Bitch open deck
events, we seek to inspire, showcase, and elevate the art of turntablism
which overwhelmingly favors cisgender men. Want to get involved? SIGN UP
HERE! Want to be spontaneous!? Enjoy free for all sets from 10 pm to
midnight! Perhaps you want to go b2b with a new bestie, take an encore,
or walk in off Kingsland Road! Want to play but don’t own any vinyl? NO
PROBLEM! WE GOT YOU! We also offer tutorials at the beginning of each
event! 7pm. – 10pm SIGN UP SETS 10pm – Midnight FREE FOR ALL SETS

eventsByFilter.name: Rishi Sunak\'s Leaving Drinks: Huck Magazine + Queer House Party
eventsByFilter.description:
ALL PROFITS GO TO SUPPORTING PALESTINIAN CAUSES It’s been 14 very long
years of Conservative party rule. Five Prime Ministers, four elections,
one referendum, countless scandals, a pandemic, an historic cost of
living crisis, over a decade of cuts to basic services, welfare and
social support, with over 330,000 deaths associated with them. A country
that, many would argue, has been broken – we can only hope not beyond
repair. Many of us have marched, fought, campaigned and tried to. Those
responsible, among them our current Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, look
finally set to be handed their marching orders in just a few short
weeks. If polls are to be believed the 4th of July will be the final day
of Sunak’s premiership and we thought we should send arguably the
richest man to ever be elected to Parliament off in style. There is no
place we’d rather get together and collectively scream “good riddance”
than in the hallowed hall (basement) of Dalston Superstore. Starting
from 9pm on 4 July, we’ll be screening the election results live, going
late into the night with an incredible roster of DJs curated by our good
friends Queer House Party. Huck’s Digital Editor and resident
gobshite Ben Smoke will be on hand to keep us abreast of developments
through the early hours, as we watch and celebrate (hopefully) the
demise of so many of those who have brought misery to millions. Don’t
tell anyone but we may also have a few extra surprises lined up for you
on the night… Of course, what comes next is not set. Indeed, even if
Keir Starmer, leader of the Labour Party does become the next Prime
Minister, as it looks likely he will, the fight both at home and abroad
is far from over. It’s why we’re taking the opportunity to fundraise for
those currently at the centre of a genocide that many say
Starmer provided political cover for. All profits from the night will be
going directly to organisations at the heart of providing vital
humanitarian assistance to those in Gaza. We are still a few weeks out
from the night and we’ll be doing a full line-up and beneficiary reveal
in the run up to the event over on our socials so be sure to follow if
you don’t already! THERE ARE NO ADVANCED TICKETS so you’ll need to get
there early, particularly if you want to join in our epic exit poll
celebration at 10pm. As extra incentive (as if you need any?!), we’ll be
giving away free copies of Huck 75, with legend Zarah Sultana on the
cover to the first 100 people through the door! It’s been a hard,
unrelenting few years – a simultaneously frantic and extraordinarily
dull election campaign, and an uncertain future awaits us all but on 4
July, let’s all get together to celebrate, to take the night to think of
all we’ve lost, all we’ve achieved and all we’re yet to win. To connect,
to laugh, to \[redacted\], and, most importantly, to (hopefully!!) say a
big SEE YA to the tories. See you all on the dancefloor x
eventsByFilter.summary: Rishi Sunak\'s Leaving Drinks: Huck Magazine + Queer House Party

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Youth Art Collective
eventsByFilter.description:
****QUEER YOUTH ART COLLECTIVE (QYAC)** **12pm – 4pm – ONLINE GROUP 2pm
– 3.30pm****

**[Queer Youth Art Collective][1] (QYAC) has run workshops at The
Outside Project for LGBTQ young people 18-26 since August 2019. The
project delivers newly commissioned workshops by LGBTQ artists and youth
forums for attendees to discuss their practice and socialise weekly on
Sundays.**

**Our primary aims are to challenge isolation, provide free and engaging
arts workshops and build skills and infrastructure for a resilient,
peer-led LGBTQ arts and education culture in London and throughout the
UK.**

**We currently run 2 groups: ONLINE on ZOOM & OFFLINE at The Outside
Project LGBTIQ+ Centre. **

****How to access: Email queeryouthartcollective@gmail.com**. **Travel
refund available. ****



[1]: https://qyac.org.uk/

eventsByFilter.name: HHV Women\'s Training
eventsByFilter.description:
Run by and at Herne Hill Velodrome in South East London. You must have completed a track induction before attending any track sessions: see [hernehillvelodrome.com][1] for details.  
  
A supportive and challenging environment in which riders of all abilities can develop their track craft through a mixture of skills, drills and workshops. £10 including bike hire.  
  
If you have completed a track training accreditation, you can join the intermediate session. Once you have done several skills sessions and feel confident that you understand the different techniques on the track you can do a training accreditation, and then join the intermediate session, which combines faster exercises, intervals to improve fitness, and introduces racing techniques.   
  
Please note that these sessions are not run by Velociposse. We recommend them because: track cycling is great for general bike handling skills (you\'re on a fixed gear bike), fitness (no stopping for traffic lights!) and confidence.  

[1]: http://hernehillvelodrome.com

eventsByFilter.name: Slow skills
eventsByFilter.description:
The original and most essential Velociposse session! Our weekly skills sessions are traffic-free, and designed to improve your bike handling, cornering and coordination. No point going fast without the control! They’re run by several club members who are level 1 or 2 British Cycling coaches. No pressure, lots of fun. Most bikes are suitable as long as they are roadworthy. Free for members, and perfect as a taster session if you\'re thinking about joining the club. We often head to the pub or a park afterward to hang out: a perfect midweek evening! Sessions take place either in Stratford or in Bermondsey. There are no toilet or changing facilities available. Check our [events page][1] if you wanna come along. 

[1]: https://www.riderhq.com/o/p/7odu8dgn/f/velociposse/enter

eventsByFilter.name: 56T trans & non-binary sexual health & wellbeing service
eventsByFilter.description:
56T has become a booked appointment service instead of walk-in. Appointments can be booked here: [https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/][1]. This service is for:  
·         Hormone injections (with proof of ID and prescription)

·         Hormone level monitoring and liver function testing

·         PrEP – Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         PEP – Post-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         Confidential sexual health screening and Hepatitis B & HPV
vaccinations

·         Cervical smear tests for anyone over 25 with a cervix – not
done as walk in, but pre-booked into Tuesday AM clinic

·         Sexual assault support

·         Domestic abuse support and IDVA – Independent Domestic
Violence Advocate

·         Health advisor support and signposting into other services for
issues around housing, counselling etc.



[1]: https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/
eventsByFilter.summary: 56T trans & non-binary sexual health & wellbeing service

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents: A HISTORY OF VIOLENCE (2005)
eventsByFilter.description:
Night two of Mothers, Fathers, Daughters, Sons sees the return of
maestro and Transmissions favourite David Cronenberg (Crash, Videodrome,
eXistenZ) to our humble screen as we proudly present his visceral and
affecting blood-stained melodrama A History of Violence (2005). A deep
cut from Cronenberg‘s oeuvre but one which can easily hold its own
against his very best work, the film stars Viggo Mortensen as the
mild-mannered manager of a small town diner whose quiet life explodes
after a heroic act leads to revelations about the secret past he thought
he had outrun, putting everything he cares about at risk. Maria Bello,
Ed Harris, and William Hurt head up a superb supporting cast in a story
of family, forgiveness, and reconciling who we were with who we hope to
be. Don’t miss this emotional heavyweight from one of cinema’s greatest
directors. “Ask him, how come he’s so good at killing people?” Tickets
available via OutSavvy: https://www.outsavvy.com/organiser/transmissions
Please be aware that this film contains scenes of very strong violence.
Subtitles will be displayed throughout the film. Seating is a mixture of
benches, backed chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is first come,
first served.
eventsByFilter.summary: Transmissions presents: A HISTORY OF VIOLENCE (2005)

eventsByFilter.name: BodySwap
eventsByFilter.description:
Dalston Superstore’s weekly party for the trans+ community BodySwap!
Every Wednesday from 10pm, curators Harietta and Karlie Marx play
Transgender Dance Music along with guest DJs, gogos and cvnty club kids.
It’s the only place to be on a Wednesday night in Dalston!  This is a
space for trans\* power, rage, beauty, resilience, and joy. BodySwap
celebrates and platforms trans\* artists from diverse backgrounds, while
raising crucial funds. BodySwap is by and for trans people. Each week we
raise money for a trans person’s healthcare fundraiser with our door
profits, so come through and party in community with the transexuals of
Kingsland Road.  FREE ENTRY

eventsByFilter.name: Thursday Social Drinks In Soho
eventsByFilter.description:
Join me and your fellow trans lovelies for a relaxed meetup which takes
place on the second \*\*Thursday of the month in the Soho, central
London area.\*\*

This place has a great buzz. It\'s a sneaky way to start the weekend
early. Come and join us :)

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

We have a private area upstairs in the venue, which is plenty of space
for us all to chat, hear each other and relax.

Thursday is the new start of the weekend. Let\'s use this opportunity to
make some new friends and chat about whatever pleases you.  
This event will suit you if you are new to attending the meetup or are
one of our wonderful regulars. It is a popular evening with lots of
different people popping in. There is no need to be nervous. We are all
very friendly and welcoming. You\'ll feel right at home. :)

\*\*What is this meetup?\*\*  
This is a relaxed, friendly and inclusive meetup for the trans people of
London. This is an opportunity to make new friends and chat over a
sneaky Thursday drink.

\*\*Who is it for?\*\*  
Everyone from the trans community is welcome. This is an opportunity to
be yourself, whatever you identify as. We are inclusive and happy to
welcome you.

\*\*How does it work?\*\*  
All you have to do is RSVP and then we will message you on the day with
the event location. Then, all you have to do is show up.

We will make sure that you meet some new people and get a chance to get
to know your fellow trans buddies. This event is very friendly and will
welcome you and make sure you feel comfortable and happy.  
It is free to attend, just buy yourself a drink at the bar.

\*\*Please Note:\*\* RSVP is a must as the location (based around Soho)
will be sent by email on the day to those who have RSVP\'d only. RSVP
closes at 16.00 on the day of the event.

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

eventsByFilter.name: Release Fundraiser: The Hub\'s Revenge
eventsByFilter.description:
Release is the national centre of expertise on drugs and drugs law
providing free and confidential specialist advice to the public and
professionals. Release also campaigns for changes to UK drug policy to
bring about a fairer and more compassionate legal framework to manage
drug use in our society. The UK is currently one of the deadliest
countries in Europe for people who use drugs. This situation is only
setto get worse: the spread of synthetic opioids and their contimaintion
of multiple drug supplies means is a serious concern. Given government
inaction and willingness to let people die, we need to take action and
fight against the forces preventing change around us to truly bring
change. We need spaces to keep people safe, alive, and informed. Release
opened the Harm Reduction Hub in East London this year: it is a
community drop-in centre which provides low threshold harm reduction
advice and signposting for any visitor, with the goal of benefitting
people who are traditionally underserved due to stigma – such as people
who rough sleep, use drugs, or sell sex. Through the Hub, anyone is able
to get drug test strips, drug testing kits, legal advice (similar to a
helpline), signposted to relevant services, as well as a warm drink and
a friendly face. As it is mostly funded by donations, Release is
fundraising to keep the Hub stocked, staffed, and loaded. All funds
raised will revert directly back to protecting and informing our
community on how they can keep safe and look out for each other. £7
minimum donation from 9:30pm Door Policy Dalston Superstore is a queer
space. We prioritise our LGBTQIA+ customers and will sometimes ask our
straight & cis allies to support us by not taking up room in our venue.

eventsByFilter.name: Regent\'s Park Intro Laps
eventsByFilter.description:
A gentle, supportive and informative session for anyone who wants to ride with us in a casual, no expectations way. Suitable for any kind of roadworthy bike, we\'ll spend the first hour introducing some group riding techniques and doing a few laps of the inner circle of Regent\'s Park. Afterward we all head to the cafe for a chat and get to know each other a bit better.   
  
Open to all women, trans, and non-binary people of any ability and riding experience, no membership required. Sign up via our [RiderHQ events page][1].  
  
This is held monthly on the second Saturday of the month. It is facilitated by Velociposse members who volunteer their time to lead this ride. Occasionally we may have to cancel due to bad weather or volunteer availability so please check before attending!

eventsByFilter.name: Sophie Duker x Kemah Bob at VFDalston
eventsByFilter.description:
[ TICKETS ][1] ### **Sophie Duker x Kemah Bob at VFDalston**

Comedians **Sophie Duker** (*Taskmaster, Live At The Apollo*)
& **Kemah Bob **(QI, Jonathan Ross’ Comedy Club, Comedy Central
Live) have been working up hilarious all-new stand-up hours to show off
at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival this August. But before they head up to
Scotland, they\'re giving the cuties of VFD an exclusive double-header
preview performance! Tickets are strictly limited. Do. Not. Miss. This. 

**The shows will run one after the other with a short ten minute
interval. Doors at 6:15. The first show will start promptly at 6:45
pm. **

MISS FORTUNATE - Life is gunna life and brains are gunna brain. Miss
Fortunate is a debut hour that\'s as raw and silly as you’d expect from
acclaimed oversharer Kemah Bob.   
  
BUT DADDY I LOVE HER sees Sophie champion delusion, arguing that we
should all choose hot wet fantasy over cold, bleak reality. Be bonkers,
dream big, lose your damn mind! In this intentionally unhinged show,
delulu is the solulu. 

Follow the girls on IG - @kemahbob / @sophiedukebox



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/20925/sophie-duker-x-kemah-bob-at-vfdalston

eventsByFilter.name: HHV Women\'s Training
eventsByFilter.description:
Run by and at Herne Hill Velodrome in South East London. You must have completed a track induction before attending any track sessions: see [hernehillvelodrome.com][1] for details.  
  
A supportive and challenging environment in which riders of all abilities can develop their track craft through a mixture of skills, drills and workshops. £10 including bike hire.  
  
If you have completed a track training accreditation, you can join the intermediate session. Once you have done several skills sessions and feel confident that you understand the different techniques on the track you can do a training accreditation, and then join the intermediate session, which combines faster exercises, intervals to improve fitness, and introduces racing techniques.   
  
Please note that these sessions are not run by Velociposse. We recommend them because: track cycling is great for general bike handling skills (you\'re on a fixed gear bike), fitness (no stopping for traffic lights!) and confidence.  

[1]: http://hernehillvelodrome.com

eventsByFilter.name: Hatred Is a Bitter Fruit - Residency Writing Workshops
eventsByFilter.description: [ TICKETS ][1] A series of 12 hosted writing workshops on offer every Tuesday from July 16 until the end of September, between 7 to 9pm The theme of the workshops is centred around the title - *Hatred is a Bitter Fruit* - we will be exploring the many intersections and layers of hatred, hate crimes, shame and abuse, and how we respond to those lived or imagined experiences and feelings.  The workshops are open to all LGBTQIA+ communities especially those of colour. Creative writing is a form of self-expression, and within a supportive and safe environment has the potential to begin a process of healing, and is an opportunity to be heard through your choice of words on a page. Playful, experimental and at times surprising what will emerge from deep within. Your host will be Jack - a Poet-Curator and Psycho-Spiritual Dharma and Shamanic performance artist. A Zen Body Worker and Carrier of Indigenous Earth Knowledge.  They received a Spread The Word Commission Award in Autumn 2023. Recent readings include Lewisham Literature Festival, Autistic Shuffle, Devereux and with Poem Brut at Rich Mix and a Hundred Years Gallery. They received an Arts Council Project Award in 2024, to co-facilitate a series of free poetry workshops for LGBTQIA+ communities and to produce a \'free\' intersectional poetry anthology hatred is a bitter fruit that will be published in Jan/Feb 2025.  All who attend the workshops may choose to enter up to four poems for publication, and will be responding to the prompt or theme: hatred is a bitter fruit details of the call will be shared during the poetry writing workshops. All first time writers are welcome, we want poetry to be accessible to all.  There will also be three co-hosts who will facilitate three workshops each, the last three weeks will be an open forum for everyone to share poems that they have written or choose and there will space to write too if that is your preference.   The first co-host will be Venus - a martial artist, writer and performer from Harlesden. A sex worker for many years, her work is a reflection of her experiences with unconventional notions of power, strength, sensuality, subversion and the concept of embodiment as knowledge. She is a recent graduate with a BA in Politics, Philosophy and History, and is founder of Sex and Rage, a sex worker led organisation resisting stigma and shame through sex education. Dates for Venus July 16, 23, 30 The second co-host will be Rhys Hollis AKA Rhys\' Pieces. Rhys\' Pieces is the alter ego of performance artist, dancer, comedian and rapper Rhys Hollis ... A born and bred Londoner cheeky boy, they get along with everyone (unless you\'re a \*\*\*\*). Rhys has for nine years been creating, hosting, drag, cabaret and performance, learn from Rhys\'s Pieces vast knowledge and experience, of coaching and facilitating workshops Dates for Rhys Aug 6, 13, 20. The third co-host will be Maya Nielsen from the Chickenshed Theatre, a writer, director and performer. Maya is actively engaged in creating equal, diverse and inclusive spaces, to inspire, support and encourage people in their creative journeys and be a springboard for their artistic discoveries. Dates for Maya Aug 27, Sept 3, 10. Our final co-host will be our own Lyall Hakaraia, these three final classes will be both creative and reflective of the outcomes of the workshops, dates for these are Sept 17, 24, Oct 1. This series of free association poetry writing workshops will run every Tuesday from July 16 until the end of September, 7 to 9pm The workshops are FREE but have a limited number of tickets (10 people per workshop). All attendees will be eligible for travel expenses, there will be a flat reimbursement of £10 per workshop. Pen and papers will be provided or bring your choice of pen to write with. These workshops are supported by Arts Council England. [1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/21088/hatred-is-a-bitter-fruit-residency-writing-workshops

eventsByFilter.name: 56T trans & non-binary sexual health & wellbeing service
eventsByFilter.description:
56T has become a booked appointment service instead of walk-in. Appointments can be booked here: [https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/][1]. This service is for:  
·         Hormone injections (with proof of ID and prescription)

·         Hormone level monitoring and liver function testing

·         PrEP – Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         PEP – Post-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         Confidential sexual health screening and Hepatitis B & HPV
vaccinations

·         Cervical smear tests for anyone over 25 with a cervix – not
done as walk in, but pre-booked into Tuesday AM clinic

·         Sexual assault support

·         Domestic abuse support and IDVA – Independent Domestic
Violence Advocate

·         Health advisor support and signposting into other services for
issues around housing, counselling etc.



[1]: https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/

eventsByFilter.name: Testo Hunkie Super Soaker
eventsByFilter.description:
Testo Hunkie is a social and community fundraiser event for transmascs\*
and their pals. We'll be back with a big party at the Fox&amp;Firkin
till late, Thursday is the NEW Friday, baby. . . Celebrate summer with
us at Testo Hunkie super soaker edition.Sign up for our iconic arm
wrestling competition to have a chance to be the summer Mr. Muscles
or/and get ready to get soaked at our wet t-shirt pageantry. *Transmascs
includes but not limited too tboys, trans men, boy dyk3s, butches, trans
f@gs, non-binary, f@g dykes, studs etc…What to expect : -Our ever
popular arm wrestling competition, hosted by the mother to all the lost
boys Lori Mae. Sign up for a chance to be the champ of the night. -Wet
T-shirt pageantry. Are you ready to get soaked and show Mama Lori Mae
who’s the most Mr. Drip? See you on the dance floor from 10pm with
Harietta dj, the trans David Guetta. COVID’s still a thing. Please test
and stay home if you feel unwell. Testo Hunkie is an 18+ event. We might
have to check your ID. Testo Hunkie is an inclusive, LGBTQ+ event,
although be aware that is a trasn focus event centering transmasculine
people.We’re here for the celebration of all bodies and gender
expressions. Testo Hunkie is the dream of two trans fags. We’re doing it
DIY and raising some money for trans* joy whilst we’re at it. We’ll be
raising money for gender-affirming fundraisers through ticket sales and
donations.Due to high demands we are prioritising gender affirming
fundraisers we received from member of the global majority.Email us a
link to your fundraising page to testohunkie@gmail.com and we’ll donate
a split of the money raised. Join Us For Another Hunksome Time. Food and
gossip: 7pm-8pmArm wrestling: 8:30 - 9:30pmWet T-shirt pageantry : 10:30
pmDJ set by Harietta : 10pm-12am How to find us:The Fox &amp;
Firkin316 Lewisham High St.,London, SE13 6JZ Accessibility:The venue and
garden have step-free access and accessible toilets. Although, the exit
to the garden may be too narrow for some wheelchair / mobility
scooters(please note the smallest width is 692mm). If you are attending
a garden event and your wheelchair is bigger than our garden door, let
us know, we can consider alternatives. Service animals are welcome.As
part of our accessibility policy, the venue provide free Personal
Assistant tickets for Deaf or disabled customers who cannot attend

eventsByFilter.description:
A Friday Night KIKI! We’re on party no 50 Can you believe it! and this
time, for our first time ever, we’re throwing a Friday night Kiki
instead of our usual Saturday night shenanigans, but with all the usual
sexy trimmings. Summertime madness on Fri 17th July down at the
mothership Dalston Superstore. In the basement, we have a special guest
all the way from Montreal – Pretty Privilige hosts a FLINTA party/mix
series microrave and is resident DJ for Montreal’s premiere kink rave
LATEX and we’re super excited to have her join us as part of her
European tour. Joining her is Holy C – who has been setting fire to
queer dancefloors across London. Nodding to their Afro-Caribbean and
British roots in their music selections, they were one of Body Movements
emerging artists back in Feb and they’ll be opening the basement for us
on the 17th, followed by our trusty resident Michelle Manetti. Then up
top we see the return of our Fave NYC doll Dinah Fire, ready to bring
her explosive bangers back to London for her third appearance with us.
Then we have a debut from bad pal lili an exciting new DJ from South
London bringing a fresh & percussive mix of global party sounds to
superstore who promises us 2 hours of campy club edits & afro baile
bops. Opening duties is our fave duo of Fraîchness, Fèmmme Fraîche
residents Linzi Symons and Darren Skene on ?2 ? duties with all your
trash-tastic faves. For gogo duties, we have our all time-fave the icon
Danni Spooner and with another Femmme Fraiche debut, from Than The Freak
who’s a regular at our events and ALWAYS brings the party, with killer
lewks, immaculate vibes and hi NRG. expect ass-shakin’ sexy, stupendous
bar-top antics. Entry is £8 b4 11pm / £10 after (for low salary income
please contact us for discounted entry) With a small selection of £5
early bird tickets and a limited number of General Admission tickets for
sale online – these allow you Q-jump and are valid for entry until 11pm
only. Once these have sold out entry will be general admission tickets
available on the door, on the night. *We operate a zero tolerance
