eventsByFilter.name: Brighton Trans Pride - Celebrate with us
eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*Trans Pride Brighton - Celebrate with us\*\*

Join us at Trans Pride Brighton. This was a fantastic event last year
with tens of thousands of people and we are delighted to return this
year. This is Trans Pride Brighton\'s 10 year celebration. It\'s a
really well organised event and you\'ll have an amazing time.

We are partnering with Rainbow Stores, a member\'s LGBTQAI+ business,
where you can get all of your trans party apparel there. \*\*(See below
for the discount code).\*\*

\*\*We have the regular meetup where we will do the march and then will
relax in the park after, enjoying the entertainment and then off to the
after pride official party. See below for more.\*\*

\*\*The Details:\*\*  
\*\*11.00\*\* We will be meeting at \*\*Brighton Train Station.\*\*  
\*\*11.30\*\* We will go down to Jubilee Square, to \*\*listen to the
speeches\*\* outside The Brighton Jubilee Library.

\*\*12.00: The march begins\*\* and we will join in, walking to
Brunswick Square. (This is really fun).

\*\*13.00 - 18.00\*\* There will be a speaker stage in Jubilee Square
during the afternoon, performances and community stalls at Brighton
Domes Corn Exchange from 1 until 6pm. There is a family picnic area in
Dorset Gardens with acoustic and spoken word performances, and finally a
bar in New Steine Gardens with a dance tent.

\*\*19.00 - 03.00\*\*: The after party venue is at the Corn Exchange on
the Saturday evening in central Brighton, 7pm until late and organised
by Traumfrau Brighton. This is the official after party trans
celebration - \*\*THIS IS A TICKETED EVENT AND YOU NEED TO BUY YOUR
TICKETS IN ADVANCE.\*\* The link is Tickets:
\[[https://brightondome.org/whats-on/Vgn-trans-pride-brighton-2024-afterparty/\](https://brightondome.org/whats-on/Vgn-trans-pride-brighton-2024-afterparty/][1])

\*\*As always I’ll email out the full details the day before to anyone
who has RSVP’d the day before.\*\*

\*\*Getting there:\*\*  
As we are meeting in Brighton train station, please make your own
arrangements to get there. Brighton has an excellent service from
London. It takes 90 minutes roughly from London to get there and trains
are quite regular. A direct train from Victoria takes just under 1 hour.
(\*\*Please Note:\*\* You cannot tap on with your card so please
remember to book a ticket).

\*\*About the March\*\*  
There is a vibrant trans community in Brighton and Trans Pride Brighton
started in 2013 and has grown year on year since then. Over 30,000
people attended in 2023. Let\'s help make this the best year ever.

To honour the long legacy of transgender, non-binary, gender
non-conforming and intersex people who came before us, build a placard,
wear the flag or flowers, paint your face, get involved and have fun
while you are building awareness of trans people and the trans
community.

\*\*See more at
\[[https://transpridebrighton.org/\](https://transpridebrighton.org/][2])\*\*\[
\]([https://transpridebrighton.org/][3])

\*\*Who is this for:\*\*  
This is for anyone who is trans, questioning or a supporter of trans
people.

\*\*Wanna celebrate in Pride in Style?\*\*  
We are delighted to give you a special Trans Pride offer from one of our
member\'s Trans business \[Transgender Clothes and Accessories
(therainbowstores.com)\]([https://www.therainbowstores.com/collections/transgender][4]).
Suzix has put together a special trans pack for all your pride
celebrations. Please use the code \*\*TRANSPRIDE24 to get a 20%
discount.\*\*

\*\*Please note:\*\* We do not make any money from any partner offers.
We just love to support the people who support us!



[1]: https://brightondome.org/whats-on/Vgn-trans-pride-brighton-2024-afterparty/](https://brightondome.org/whats-on/Vgn-trans-pride-brighton-2024-afterparty/
[2]: https://transpridebrighton.org/](https://transpridebrighton.org/
[3]: https://transpridebrighton.org/
[4]: https://www.therainbowstores.com/collections/transgender

eventsByFilter.name: ONE MORE TIME: 1996
eventsByFilter.description:
[ TICKETS ][1] ### **One More Time: 1996**

Been watching the Top Of The Pops re-runs and want (ooh aah) just a
little bit more?!

Its 1996 and boybands ruled (even if Take That would split up). Eternal
were the only girlband in sight… until five spicey girls zig-a-zig-ah\'d
their way into history and changed the face of pop forever!

We\'ll be celebrating the year the Spice Girls entered our lives, Gina G
flew the flag for the UK in Eurovision, everyone and their gran danced
the Macarena and Louise got Naked (yet still managed to show less flesh
than Peter Andre in the waterfall). Expect A list pop from the likes of
East 17, Gabrielle, Mariah Carey and Cher, dance music from JX, Livin\'
Joy and Robert Miles, the Britpop boom from Dodgy, Ash and Sleeper and
the smooth tones of Mark Morrison, Fugees, Lighthouse Family and George
Michael. Oh and did we mention the year of Celine\'s many epic ballads
?!

Expect loads of forgotten gems you\'re unlikely to hear anywhere else
(from 1996\'s B listers such as Alisha\'s Attic to Gloria Estefan and
Pet Shop Boys to Mary Kiani). Our Bargain Bin first hour of 1996’s pop
flops (from E\'voke to Maxwell and Let Loose) kicks off from 9pm.



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/20879/one-more-time-1996

eventsByFilter.name: Pumping Velvet
eventsByFilter.description:
Your favorite dance party is back to heat up the UK summer that never
was! Who cares if it’s barely even shorts weather when Pumping Velvet is
here to rock your body and warm you to the core? For our July party we
have a very special collaboration with the wonderful Pittsburgh-based
queer collective Jellyfish, known for their raucous parties across the
steel city. Jellyfish residents Formosa and Ricky Mawzlin will be making
their London debut with a set bound to morph between italo, house, disco
and electro. Completing the basement’s US invasion is LA native Mez,
who’s established a reputation for bringing a fresh but decidedly
old-school vibe while pulling inspiration from the golden age of New
York and Chicago House. No stranger to queer parties, Mez runs the LA
event Signal, which pays homage to the black roots of dance music.
Upstairs see’s Rosy Ross and Lavandula soundtrack the bar with sleazy
vocal heavy vibes before Dalston legend Mads Mads shuts things down with
his unmatched selection of pop-edits. And if you can’t dance go-go
humans Loren Dell’Arco and Cherry will have you transfixed with the
sexiest of bar top gyrations.  Come pump some velvet! £8 BEFORE 11 / £10
AFTER

****QUEER YOUTH ART COLLECTIVE (QYAC)** **12pm – 4pm – ONLINE GROUP 2pm
– 3.30pm****

**[Queer Youth Art Collective][1] (QYAC) has run workshops at The
Outside Project for LGBTQ young people 18-26 since August 2019. The
project delivers newly commissioned workshops by LGBTQ artists and youth
forums for attendees to discuss their practice and socialise weekly on
Sundays.**

**Our primary aims are to challenge isolation, provide free and engaging
arts workshops and build skills and infrastructure for a resilient,
peer-led LGBTQ arts and education culture in London and throughout the
UK.**

**We currently run 2 groups: ONLINE on ZOOM & OFFLINE at The Outside
Project LGBTIQ+ Centre. **

****How to access: Email queeryouthartcollective@gmail.com**. **Travel
refund available. ****

eventsByFilter.name: HHV Women\'s Training
eventsByFilter.description:
Run by and at Herne Hill Velodrome in South East London. You must have completed a track induction before attending any track sessions: see [hernehillvelodrome.com][1] for details.  
  
A supportive and challenging environment in which riders of all abilities can develop their track craft through a mixture of skills, drills and workshops. £10 including bike hire.  
  
If you have completed a track training accreditation, you can join the intermediate session. Once you have done several skills sessions and feel confident that you understand the different techniques on the track you can do a training accreditation, and then join the intermediate session, which combines faster exercises, intervals to improve fitness, and introduces racing techniques.   
  
Please note that these sessions are not run by Velociposse. We recommend them because: track cycling is great for general bike handling skills (you\'re on a fixed gear bike), fitness (no stopping for traffic lights!) and confidence.  

[1]: http://hernehillvelodrome.com

eventsByFilter.name: 56T trans & non-binary sexual health & wellbeing service
eventsByFilter.description:
56T has become a booked appointment service instead of walk-in. Appointments can be booked here: [https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/][1]. This service is for:  
·         Hormone injections (with proof of ID and prescription)

·         Hormone level monitoring and liver function testing

·         PrEP – Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         PEP – Post-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         Confidential sexual health screening and Hepatitis B & HPV
vaccinations

·         Cervical smear tests for anyone over 25 with a cervix – not
done as walk in, but pre-booked into Tuesday AM clinic

·         Sexual assault support

·         Domestic abuse support and IDVA – Independent Domestic
Violence Advocate

·         Health advisor support and signposting into other services for
issues around housing, counselling etc.



[1]: https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Board Game Group
eventsByFilter.description:
Are you queer and do you love playing board games? Sappho runs a monthly
social event for playing board games, open to LGBTQIA+ women, trans and
non-binary people. We have multiple tables set up with games, ranging
from quick and easy games to learn for newbies, to medium-length
strategy board games. If you've got a game you'd love to bring and teach
others to play, please bring it too, as we will have some spare tables
for wildcard games on the night. This will be a really friendly
environment where we can enjoy playing games with other queers who love
games as much as us. Learn something new, or put a new strategy to the
test, and make some new queer friends in the process. Date: Wednesday 24
July 2024, 7-9pm Location: The Glitch, 134 Lower Marsh, London, SE1 7AE
(5 minutes walk from Waterloo underground station)Cost: £15. Booking in
advance is essential as we have limited space. Accessibility: The venue
is wheelchair accessible, with step-free access to toilets.Sappho Events
welcomes LGBTQIA+ women, trans and non-binary people to our events

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents: STARRED UP (2013)
eventsByFilter.description:
This month at Transmissions, the team behind HARDER: A Season of Lesbian
Kink is back for a second June of hot and heavy curation for our beloved
crowd of trans people of taste, and basement dwelling perverts. Runner
up of Bootblack Europe 2024, Butch Boots (Riposte, Pop-Up Dyke Bar) is
becoming a fixture in the London scene, with its creator Astrid Johnson
taking her bespoke bootblacking and leathercare services to some of the
hottest events in town. Lucky for us, she’ll be in residence for four
nights tracing the history of leather faggotry on screen, showcasing
shorts by the iconic Kenneth Anger, William Friedkin’s monumental
classic Cruising, rare documentary High Shine, and more.

But before all that, we screen Tom of Finland (2017), a celebratory
biopic of Touko Laaksonen, an artist whose legendary homoerotic
illustrations bloomed amidst the oppression of the 1950s, capturing
existing subcultures and influencing those that would follow. Join us
for a tribute to the life and work of a pioneering queer artist, whose
subversion has proved immortal.

“Everybody should see your drawings”

Tickets available via
OutSavvy: https://www.outsavvy.com/organiser/transmissions

Subtitles will be displayed throughout the film. Seating is a mixture of
benches, backed chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is first come,
first served.

Every Wednesday from 10pm, curators Harietta and Karlie Marx play

It’s the only place to be on a Wednesday night in Dalston!  This is a
space for trans\* power, rage, beauty, resilience, and joy. BodySwap

raising crucial funds. BodySwap is by and for trans people. Each week we
raise money for a trans person’s healthcare fundraiser with our door
profits, so come through and party in community with the transexuals of
Kingsland Road.  FREE ENTRY

ultimate post-trans-pride motive. It's EXTRA LASERS meets TR4NNYT3K in
SE's Venue MOT... we've got the whole place to ourselves. We do expect
to SELL OUT so lock in early to avoid dissapointment &lt;3 Low
income tickets are available no questions asked - drop a DM on insta for
the link (@neurotica.club or @*ariz3*). Please consider buying a pay it
forward ticket - these are essential for keeping the event accessible
and we appreciate your help.Who is this event for: This event
prioritises trans+ people and their friends. Allies are welcome to come
celebrate (pay it forward tickets are reccomended). This event is NOT
for chasers, we will clock you and kick you out. This event is NOT for
cishet people (unless invited by trans friends). Anyone disrupting the
safety / comfort of the space will be removed. Access: Venue MOT has
wheelchair access for entry, but unfortunately no accessable toilets.
There may also be use of strobe lighting - please see info on the
NEUROTICA instagram, or DM for more details.

eventsByFilter.name: Celebrate Trans Pride London With Us
eventsByFilter.description:
\*\*Celebrate Trans Pride London 2024 With Us\*\*

\*\*We are very excited to announce that we are going to Trans Pride
London. We had a wonderful time here last year and we are delighted to
be able to support it again.\*\*

\*\*We have a full day planned and you’re very welcome to join us for
the whole day and evening or just the day or evening.\*\* It\'s up to
you. This is a friendly group and you will be welcomed into the group,
introduced to everyone and we’ll march together.

We are partnering with Rainbow Stores, a member\'s LGBTQAI+ business,
where you can get all of your trans party apparel there. \*\*(See below
for the discount code).\*\*

\*\*The Details:\*\*  
\*\*13.00\*\* We will be meeting at Trafalgar Square - \*\*Exact details
to those who RSVP\*\*

The details:  
13.00 We will meet close to Langham Place (Marylebone, W1B 3D) on the
main street outside the BBC and All Soul’s Church. (Location to be given
to you in the email sent the day before).

\*\*14.00\*\* The march will set off down Regents St (southbound), along
Oxford St to Piccadilly, before veering west to Wellington Arch (Hyde
Park Corner, W1J 7JZ).

\*\*16.00\*\* There is a stage at Wellington arch and we will find a
spot to sit and listen to the speakers and entertainment.

\*\*19:30\*\* I have booked us a space in a south London LGBTQ+ bar
where we can continue the celebrations (Very easy to get to by
tube/bus/train). - \*\*Places are limited to 20 so please book
early.\*\* There are plenty of places nearby the grab a bite.

\*\*22.00 - Late Neurotica Trans Pride After Party\*\* (The original
event has unfortunately been cancelled, so we are going to the below
instead. This is based in Dalston, however there is a direct train/tube
to it from Clapham. \*\*This is a Ticketed Event: Please buy your ticket
at
\[[https://www.outsavvy.com/event/20311/neurotica-x-arize-trans-pride-after-party\](https://www.outsavvy.com/event/20311/neurotica-x-arize-trans-pride-after-party][1])\*\*

\*\*As always I’ll email out the full details the day before to anyone
who has RSVP’d the day before.\*\*

\*\*About the March\*\*  
It first started in 2019 in London and has attracted more and more
people every year. Remember PRIDE IS A PROTEST!

London Trans+ Pride celebrates its sixth year. The event is a vital
coming together for trans people in the city, giving space to resist the
encroaching threats on trans rights around the world, and come together
to celebrate the community in the capital.

Since 2019, the event has sought to honour the memory of trans lives
taken, uphold the next generation of trans revolutionaries and support
crucial trans rights. In previous years organisers have asked people
taking part to wear flowers ”to honour the long legacy of transgender,
non-binary, gender non-conforming and intersex people who came before
us.”

\*\*Who is this for:\*\*  
This is for anyone who is trans, questioning or a supporter of trans
people.

\*\*Wanna celebrate in Pride in Style?\*\*  
We are delighted to give you a special Trans Pride offer from one of our
member\'s Trans business \[Transgender Clothes and Accessories
(therainbowstores.com)\]([https://www.therainbowstores.com/collections/transgender][2]).
Suzix has put together a special trans pack for all your pride
celebrations. Please use the code \*\*TRANSPRIDE24 to get a 20%
discount.\*\*

\*\*Please note:\*\* We do not make any money from any partner offers.
We just love to support the people who support us!



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/20311/neurotica-x-arize-trans-pride-after-party](https://www.outsavvy.com/event/20311/neurotica-x-arize-trans-pride-after-party
[2]: https://www.therainbowstores.com/collections/transgender

eventsByFilter.name: CAMP UTOPIA: A TRANS+PRIDE AFTERPARTY... AND FUNDRAISER
eventsByFilter.description:
[ TICKETS ][1] ### **Camp Utopia - a Trans + Pride After Party and Fundraiser**

Calling All Campy Cyborgs, Digital Divas, Artificial  
Join us after this year\'s London Trans+ Pride for the second edition of
CAMP at VFDalston!   
Every CAMP party has a theme, and this time we want to see your vision
of UTOPIA:  
  
It is time to imagine new and better worlds, so we want to see your best
futuristic fantastical looks. Think the androgynous universe of iconic
trans allegory The Matrix, the pleasure-seeking queer future of The
Fifth Element, or even turn to nonhuman worlds of gender fluid clownfish
and binary-bending fungi. Anything goes  
  
Finally, all proceeds made will be going towards London Trans+ Pride
(LTP). LTP @londontranspride is a grassroots trans-led community
organisation, operating as a collective of volunteers for and with the
trans+ community in the UK. They are responsible for organising the
annual London Trans+ Pride march since 2018



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/20750/camp-utopia

eventsByFilter.description:
****QUEER YOUTH ART COLLECTIVE (QYAC)** **12pm – 4pm – ONLINE GROUP 2pm
– 3.30pm****

**[Queer Youth Art Collective][1] (QYAC) has run workshops at The
Outside Project for LGBTQ young people 18-26 since August 2019. The
project delivers newly commissioned workshops by LGBTQ artists and youth
forums for attendees to discuss their practice and socialise weekly on
Sundays.**

**Our primary aims are to challenge isolation, provide free and engaging
arts workshops and build skills and infrastructure for a resilient,
peer-led LGBTQ arts and education culture in London and throughout the
UK.**

**We currently run 2 groups: ONLINE on ZOOM & OFFLINE at The Outside
Project LGBTIQ+ Centre. **

****How to access: Email queeryouthartcollective@gmail.com**. **Travel
refund available. ****



[1]: https://qyac.org.uk/

eventsByFilter.name: HHV Women\'s Training
eventsByFilter.description:
Run by and at Herne Hill Velodrome in South East London. You must have completed a track induction before attending any track sessions: see [hernehillvelodrome.com][1] for details.  
  
A supportive and challenging environment in which riders of all abilities can develop their track craft through a mixture of skills, drills and workshops. £10 including bike hire.  
  
If you have completed a track training accreditation, you can join the intermediate session. Once you have done several skills sessions and feel confident that you understand the different techniques on the track you can do a training accreditation, and then join the intermediate session, which combines faster exercises, intervals to improve fitness, and introduces racing techniques.   
  
Please note that these sessions are not run by Velociposse. We recommend them because: track cycling is great for general bike handling skills (you\'re on a fixed gear bike), fitness (no stopping for traffic lights!) and confidence.  

[1]: http://hernehillvelodrome.com

eventsByFilter.name: Slow skills
eventsByFilter.description:
The original and most essential Velociposse session! Our weekly skills sessions are traffic-free, and designed to improve your bike handling, cornering and coordination. No point going fast without the control! They’re run by several club members who are level 1 or 2 British Cycling coaches. No pressure, lots of fun. Most bikes are suitable as long as they are roadworthy. Free for members, and perfect as a taster session if you\'re thinking about joining the club. We often head to the pub or a park afterward to hang out: a perfect midweek evening! Sessions take place either in Stratford or in Bermondsey. There are no toilet or changing facilities available. Check our [events page][1] if you wanna come along.

eventsByFilter.name: 56T trans & non-binary sexual health & wellbeing service
eventsByFilter.description:
56T has become a booked appointment service instead of walk-in. Appointments can be booked here: [https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/][1]. This service is for:  
·         Hormone injections (with proof of ID and prescription)

·         Hormone level monitoring and liver function testing

·         PrEP – Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         PEP – Post-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         Confidential sexual health screening and Hepatitis B & HPV
vaccinations

·         Cervical smear tests for anyone over 25 with a cervix – not
done as walk in, but pre-booked into Tuesday AM clinic

·         Sexual assault support

·         Domestic abuse support and IDVA – Independent Domestic
Violence Advocate

·         Health advisor support and signposting into other services for
issues around housing, counselling etc.



[1]: https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/
eventsByFilter.summary: 56T trans & non-binary sexual health & wellbeing service

eventsByFilter.name: Transmissions presents: TIME (2020)
eventsByFilter.description:
On the final night of Mothers, Fathers, Daughters, Sons we’re proud to
present a screening of Garrett Bradley‘s critically-acclaimed
documentary Time (2020), spanning decades in the life of mother and
abolitionist Fox Rich as she fights ceaselessly to bring her husband
home from a cruel prison sentence, all while raising their six sons.
Rich black and white digital photography continually blurs with intimate
home video footage and diaries captured by Rich over the years in a film
that seems to effortlessly illustrate the true cost of America’s
carceral system, while never losing focus as an intensely personal
capsule of a family and its matriarch as they endure in the face of
unimaginable obstacles.

Impressing the evil and futility of carceral structures world over that
we saw explored in last week’s film Starred Up (2013), Time is an
essential and one of the best films of the 2020s. Join us downstairs at
Dalston Superstore for a truly remarkable film.   “Desperate people do
desperate things. It’s as simple as that.”

 

Tickets available via OutSavvy:
https://www.outsavvy.com/organiser/transmissions Subtitles will be
displayed throughout the film. Seating is a mixture of benches, backed
chairs, bar stools, and floor space, and is first come, first served.

Every Wednesday from 10pm, curators Harietta and Karlie Marx play
Transgender Dance Music along with guest DJs, gogos and cvnty club kids.
It’s the only place to be on a Wednesday night in Dalston!  This is a
space for trans\* power, rage, beauty, resilience, and joy. BodySwap
celebrates and platforms trans\* artists from diverse backgrounds, while
raising crucial funds. BodySwap is by and for trans people. Each week we
raise money for a trans person’s healthcare fundraiser with our door
profits, so come through and party in community with the transexuals of
Kingsland Road.  FREE ENTRY

abuse and sexual violence. Come to spend time with us and talk with

room or on our sofas. Once a month we have haircuts from Open Barbers
and massage therapy.

We’re proud to have created a safe, accessible and welcoming space for
survivor support at our LGBTIQ+ Centre all day on Thursdays.

DM us on Instagram or email Star.Lounge@lgbtiqoutside.org if you want to
join the STAR Lounge social group on Thursdays 10.30-4pm.

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Youth Art Collective

****QUEER YOUTH ART COLLECTIVE (QYAC)** **12pm – 4pm – ONLINE GROUP 2pm
– 3.30pm****

**[Queer Youth Art Collective][1] (QYAC) has run workshops at The
Outside Project for LGBTQ young people 18-26 since August 2019. The
project delivers newly commissioned workshops by LGBTQ artists and youth
forums for attendees to discuss their practice and socialise weekly on
Sundays.**

**Our primary aims are to challenge isolation, provide free and engaging
arts workshops and build skills and infrastructure for a resilient,
peer-led LGBTQ arts and education culture in London and throughout the
UK.**

**We currently run 2 groups: ONLINE on ZOOM & OFFLINE at The Outside
Project LGBTIQ+ Centre. **

refund available. ****

eventsByFilter.name: HHV Women\'s Training
eventsByFilter.description:
Run by and at Herne Hill Velodrome in South East London. You must have completed a track induction before attending any track sessions: see [hernehillvelodrome.com][1] for details.  
  
A supportive and challenging environment in which riders of all abilities can develop their track craft through a mixture of skills, drills and workshops. £10 including bike hire.  
  
If you have completed a track training accreditation, you can join the intermediate session. Once you have done several skills sessions and feel confident that you understand the different techniques on the track you can do a training accreditation, and then join the intermediate session, which combines faster exercises, intervals to improve fitness, and introduces racing techniques.   
  
Please note that these sessions are not run by Velociposse. We recommend them because: track cycling is great for general bike handling skills (you\'re on a fixed gear bike), fitness (no stopping for traffic lights!) and confidence.  

[1]: http://hernehillvelodrome.com

eventsByFilter.name: Slow skills
eventsByFilter.description:
The original and most essential Velociposse session! Our weekly skills sessions are traffic-free, and designed to improve your bike handling, cornering and coordination. No point going fast without the control! They’re run by several club members who are level 1 or 2 British Cycling coaches. No pressure, lots of fun. Most bikes are suitable as long as they are roadworthy. Free for members, and perfect as a taster session if you\'re thinking about joining the club. We often head to the pub or a park afterward to hang out: a perfect midweek evening! Sessions take place either in Stratford or in Bermondsey. There are no toilet or changing facilities available. Check our [events page][1] if you wanna come along. 

[1]: https://www.riderhq.com/o/p/7odu8dgn/f/velociposse/enter

eventsByFilter.name: Gravel Club
eventsByFilter.description:
Ad-hoc ride arranged by members taking in the trails of Epping Forest. Decent confidence needed: come to our slow skills sessions first if you\'re not sure.  
  
Usually: 7pm meeting in East London. Gravel or offroad bikes. 2-3 hour ride: good quality front light essential as this ride ends after nightfall and the trails are unlit. May pause over winter in bad/cold weather, but will run as often as we can!  
  
Arranged via Discord.  
  
Contact us if you\'re interested and not already in the club! [https://forms.gle/2Fk9VvqHg8HbEehMA][1]

[1]: https://forms.gle/2Fk9VvqHg8HbEehMA

eventsByFilter.name: VINYL BITCH: OPEN DECKS
eventsByFilter.description:
On the first Monday of every month: – FEMME FATALE DJS – HOT BABES
– FIERCE BEATS – EMPOWERING ENVIRONMENT – QUEER MAGIC – SH\*T LOADS OF
VINYL Picture this: a night where the beats are as fierce as the talent
behind them, and where every drop is a testament to the power and skills
of femme and nonbinary turntablists! Through Vinyl Bitch open deck
events, we seek to inspire, showcase, and elevate the art of turntablism
which overwhelmingly favors cisgender men. Want to get involved? SIGN UP
HERE! Want to be spontaneous!? Enjoy free for all sets from 10 pm to
midnight! Perhaps you want to go b2b with a new bestie, take an encore,
or walk in off Kingsland Road! Want to play but don’t own any vinyl? NO
PROBLEM! WE GOT YOU! We also offer tutorials at the beginning of each
event! 7pm. – 10pm SIGN UP SETS 10pm – Midnight FREE FOR ALL SETS

eventsByFilter.name: 56T trans & non-binary sexual health & wellbeing service
eventsByFilter.description:
56T has become a booked appointment service instead of walk-in. Appointments can be booked here: [https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/][1]. This service is for:  
·         Hormone injections (with proof of ID and prescription)

·         Hormone level monitoring and liver function testing

·         PrEP – Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         PEP – Post-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         Confidential sexual health screening and Hepatitis B & HPV
vaccinations

·         Cervical smear tests for anyone over 25 with a cervix – not
done as walk in, but pre-booked into Tuesday AM clinic

·         Sexual assault support

·         Domestic abuse support and IDVA – Independent Domestic
Violence Advocate

·         Health advisor support and signposting into other services for
issues around housing, counselling etc.



[1]: https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/
eventsByFilter.summary: 56T trans & non-binary sexual health & wellbeing service

eventsByFilter.name: Thursday Social Drinks In Soho
eventsByFilter.description:
Join me and your fellow trans lovelies for a relaxed meetup which takes
place on the second \*\*Thursday of the month in the Soho, central
London area.\*\*

This place has a great buzz. It\'s a sneaky way to start the weekend
early. Come and join us :)

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

We have a private area upstairs in the venue, which is plenty of space
for us all to chat, hear each other and relax.

Thursday is the new start of the weekend. Let\'s use this opportunity to
make some new friends and chat about whatever pleases you.  
This event will suit you if you are new to attending the meetup or are
one of our wonderful regulars. It is a popular evening with lots of
different people popping in. There is no need to be nervous. We are all
very friendly and welcoming. You\'ll feel right at home. :)

\*\*What is this meetup?\*\*  
This is a relaxed, friendly and inclusive meetup for the trans people of
London. This is an opportunity to make new friends and chat over a
sneaky Thursday drink.

\*\*Who is it for?\*\*  
Everyone from the trans community is welcome. This is an opportunity to
be yourself, whatever you identify as. We are inclusive and happy to
welcome you.

\*\*How does it work?\*\*  
All you have to do is RSVP and then we will message you on the day with
the event location. Then, all you have to do is show up.

We will make sure that you meet some new people and get a chance to get
to know your fellow trans buddies. This event is very friendly and will
welcome you and make sure you feel comfortable and happy.  
It is free to attend, just buy yourself a drink at the bar.

\*\*Please Note:\*\* RSVP is a must as the location (based around Soho)
will be sent by email on the day to those who have RSVP\'d only. RSVP
closes at 16.00 on the day of the event.

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

eventsByFilter.name: STEAMED JAMS
eventsByFilter.description:
[ TICKETS ][1] ### **Steamed Jams **

Music Policy / Nostalgia pop and throwback dance anthems

Dress Code / Your Simpsons Icon ( yellow body paint unnecessary ) 

### **A Night Out In Springfield **

A silly, camp, Simpsons-themed party? At this time of year? At this time
of day? In this part of Dalston? Localised entirely within VFD?

Eeeh-Ye-e-e-es!

If you’re looking for a dopamine hit of nostalgia, grab your ticket
for *Steamed Jams* - a costumed club night dedicated to our four
fingered, future predicting, Flanderific friends… The Simpsons.

[MisterrCha][2] is our resident Disco Stu for the night, delivering
throwback dance anthems and feel-good tunes from 1990 to now. You might
even hear some familiar voices from our neighbourinos in the mix too.
Are you couch gagging yet?

You will be rubbing shoulders with all of the Springfield socialites, so
we invite you to dress the part of your favourite Simpsons icon. Minus
any yellow body paint.

Are you stupid sexy Flanders? What will you reveal under that mangled
Chanel dress? Or will you expose the true identity of El Homo?

Filled with absurdity and surprises, *Steamed Hams* will be
unforgettably dumbening. So don that blue beehive. Suck that pacifier.
And join us for a Flamin’ Moe’s at a one-of-a-kind night with the whole
Party Posse.

So what are you waiting for? Buy that ticket and let your brain release
some more endorphins.

Smell ya later!



[1]: https://www.outsavvy.com/event/20172/steamed-jams
[2]: https://vfdalston.us2.list-manage.com/track/click?u=b09f656a9a725c3cdd5ea84f6&id=53750ec282&e=6d7b2df0b0

eventsByFilter.description:
A gentle, supportive and informative session for anyone who wants to ride with us in a casual, no expectations way. eventsByFilter.name: HHV Women\'s Training
eventsByFilter.description:
Run by and at Herne Hill Velodrome in South East London. You must have completed a track induction before attending any track sessions: see [hernehillvelodrome.com][1] for details.  
  
A supportive and challenging environment in which riders of all abilities can develop their track craft through a mixture of skills, drills and workshops. £10 including bike hire.  
  
If you have completed a track training accreditation, you can join the intermediate session. Once you have done several skills sessions and feel confident that you understand the different techniques on the track you can do a training accreditation, and then join the intermediate session, which combines faster exercises, intervals to improve fitness, and introduces racing techniques.   
  
Please note that these sessions are not run by Velociposse. We recommend them because: track cycling is great for general bike handling skills (you\'re on a fixed gear bike), fitness (no stopping for traffic lights!) and confidence.  

[1]: http://hernehillvelodrome.com

eventsByFilter.name: J.Aria All Nite Long
eventsByFilter.description:
Dalston Superstore continues our Sunday night sesh series, inviting one
of our favourite selectors each Sunday to help lube you up to slip into
the new week! This week, we invite Adonis resident J.Aria for some
delish disco, groove, camp vocal house and more <3 FREE ENTRY

Door Policy Dalston Superstore is a queer space. We prioritise our
LGBTQIA+ customers and will sometimes ask our straight & cis allies to
support us by not taking up room in our venue. Please be conscious of
who this space is intended for and be respectful. Never assume sexuality
or gender identity. We will never ask personal questions on the door.

Low/no income access We reserve limited spaces for those who cannot
afford the standard ticket price due to being on low or no income.
Please email hello@dalstonsuperstore.com to enquire.

Full venue access info is available here

eventsByFilter.name: Slow skills
eventsByFilter.description:
The original and most essential Velociposse session! Our weekly skills sessions are traffic-free, and designed to improve your bike handling, cornering and coordination. No point going fast without the control! They’re run by several club members who are level 1 or 2 British Cycling coaches. No pressure, lots of fun. Most bikes are suitable as long as they are roadworthy. Free for members, and perfect as a taster session if you\'re thinking about joining the club. We often head to the pub or a park afterward to hang out: a perfect midweek evening! Sessions take place either in Stratford or in Bermondsey. There are no toilet or changing facilities available. Check our [events page][1] if you wanna come along. 

[1]: https://www.riderhq.com/o/p/7odu8dgn/f/velociposse/enter

eventsByFilter.name: 56T trans & non-binary sexual health & wellbeing service
eventsByFilter.description:
56T has become a booked appointment service instead of walk-in. Appointments can be booked here: [https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/][1]. This service is for:  
·         Hormone injections (with proof of ID and prescription)

·         Hormone level monitoring and liver function testing

·         PrEP – Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         PEP – Post-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         Confidential sexual health screening and Hepatitis B & HPV
vaccinations

·         Cervical smear tests for anyone over 25 with a cervix – not
done as walk in, but pre-booked into Tuesday AM clinic

·         Sexual assault support

·         Domestic abuse support and IDVA – Independent Domestic
Violence Advocate

·         Health advisor support and signposting into other services for
issues around housing, counselling etc.



[1]: https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/

eventsByFilter.description:

“Sunburn” by Chloe Michelle HowarthConversation facilitated by Mehar
Anaokar.Time: 7-8pm with further drinks and chats after in the

Events welcomes LGBTQIA+ women, trans and non-binary people.

eventsByFilter.name: BodySwap
eventsByFilter.description:
Dalston Superstore’s weekly party for the trans+ community BodySwap!
Every Wednesday from 10pm, curators Harietta and Karlie Marx play
Transgender Dance Music along with guest DJs, gogos and cvnty club kids.
It’s the only place to be on a Wednesday night in Dalston!  This is a
space for trans\* power, rage, beauty, resilience, and joy. BodySwap
celebrates and platforms trans\* artists from diverse backgrounds, while
raising crucial funds. BodySwap is by and for trans people. Each week we
raise money for a trans person’s healthcare fundraiser with our door
profits, so come through and party in community with the transexuals of
Kingsland Road.  FREE ENTRY

Door Policy Dalston Superstore is a queer space. We prioritise our
LGBTQIA+ customers and will sometimes ask our straight & cis allies to
support us by not taking up room in our venue. Please be conscious of
who this space is intended for and be respectful. Never assume sexuality
or gender identity. We will never ask personal questions on the door.

Low/no income access We reserve limited spaces for those who cannot

Please email hello@dalstonsuperstore.com to enquire.

eventsByFilter.name: STAR Lounge
eventsByFilter.description:
STAR Lounge is a weekly space for those with experience of domestic
abuse and sexual violence. Come to spend time with us and talk with
people if you need, have some food and hot drinks, relax in the quiet
room or on our sofas. Once a month we have haircuts from Open Barbers
and massage therapy.

We’re proud to have created a safe, accessible and welcoming space for
survivor support at our LGBTIQ+ Centre all day on Thursdays.

DM us on Instagram or email Star.Lounge@lgbtiqoutside.org if you want to
join the STAR Lounge social group on Thursdays 10.30-4pm.

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Youth Art Collective
eventsByFilter.description:
****QUEER YOUTH ART COLLECTIVE (QYAC)** **12pm – 4pm – ONLINE GROUP 2pm
– 3.30pm****

**[Queer Youth Art Collective][1] (QYAC) has run workshops at The
Outside Project for LGBTQ young people 18-26 since August 2019. The
project delivers newly commissioned workshops by LGBTQ artists and youth
forums for attendees to discuss their practice and socialise weekly on
Sundays.**

**Our primary aims are to challenge isolation, provide free and engaging
arts workshops and build skills and infrastructure for a resilient,
peer-led LGBTQ arts and education culture in London and throughout the
UK.**

**We currently run 2 groups: ONLINE on ZOOM & OFFLINE at The Outside
Project LGBTIQ+ Centre. **

****How to access: Email queeryouthartcollective@gmail.com**. **Travel
refund available. ****



[1]: https://qyac.org.uk/

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Tarot Reading Workshop
eventsByFilter.description:
Come and discover the tarot deck from a queer perspective. Get to know
the basics and learn how to read intuitively in this fun introduction to
tarot. We’ll look at different ways of finding meaning in the deck and
how to create a spread, as well as how to use the cards for
self-reflection, creative inspiration, and unlocking our subconscious.No
experience necessary – suitable for those completely new to tarot and
feeling curious, and those looking to find fresh inspiration for their
readings.Facilitated by Sarah April Lamb.Date: Monday 19 August 2024,
7-8:30pm Location: The Glitch, 134 Lower Marsh, London, SE1 7AE (5
minutes walk from Waterloo underground station)Cost: £15 (please book in
advance as we have venue caps)Accessibility: The venue is wheelchair
accessible, with step-free access to toilets.Sappho Events welcomes
LGBTQIA+ women, trans and non-binary people to our events

eventsByFilter.name: Richmond Park Intro Laps
eventsByFilter.description:
A gentle, supportive and informative session for anyone who wants to ride with us in a casual, no expectations way. Suitable for any kind of roadworthy bike, we\'ll spend the first hour introducing some group riding techniques and doing a lap or two of Richmond Park. Afterward we all head to the cafe for a chat and get to know each other a bit better.   
  
Open to all women, trans, and non-binary people of any ability and riding experience, no membership required. Sign up via our [RiderHQ events page][1].  
  
This is held monthly on the fourth Saturday of the month. It is facilitated by Velociposse members who volunteer their time to lead this ride. Occasionally we may have to cancel due to bad weather or volunteer availability so please check before attending! 

[1]: https://www.riderhq.com/o/p/7odu8dgn/f/velociposse/enter

eventsByFilter.name: HHV Women\'s Training
eventsByFilter.description:
Run by and at Herne Hill Velodrome in South East London. You must have completed a track induction before attending any track sessions: see [hernehillvelodrome.com][1] for details.  
  
A supportive and challenging environment in which riders of all abilities can develop their track craft through a mixture of skills, drills and workshops. £10 including bike hire.  
  
If you have completed a track training accreditation, you can join the intermediate session. Once you have done several skills sessions and feel confident that you understand the different techniques on the track you can do a training accreditation, and then join the intermediate session, which combines faster exercises, intervals to improve fitness, and introduces racing techniques.   
  
Please note that these sessions are not run by Velociposse. We recommend them because: track cycling is great for general bike handling skills (you\'re on a fixed gear bike), fitness (no stopping for traffic lights!) and confidence.  

[1]: http://hernehillvelodrome.com

gender) to explore our creativity in a caring space.

eventsByFilter.name: Slow skills
eventsByFilter.description:
The original and most essential Velociposse session! Our weekly skills sessions are traffic-free, and designed to improve your bike handling, cornering and coordination. No point going fast without the control! They’re run by several club members who are level 1 or 2 British Cycling coaches. No pressure, lots of fun. Most bikes are suitable as long as they are roadworthy. Free for members, and perfect as a taster session if you\'re thinking about joining the club. We often head to the pub or a park afterward to hang out: a perfect midweek evening! Sessions take place either in Stratford or in Bermondsey. There are no toilet or changing facilities available. Check our [events page][1] if you wanna come along. 

[1]: https://www.riderhq.com/o/p/7odu8dgn/f/velociposse/enter

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Board Game Group
eventsByFilter.description:
Are you queer and do you love playing board games? Sappho runs a monthly
social event for playing board games, open to LGBTQIA+ women, trans and
non-binary people. We have multiple tables set up with games, ranging
from quick and easy games to learn for newbies, to medium-length
strategy board games. If you've got a game you'd love to bring and teach
others to play, please bring it too, as we will have some spare tables
for wildcard games on the night. This will be a really friendly
environment where we can enjoy playing games with other queers who love
games as much as us. Learn something new, or put a new strategy to the
test, and make some new queer friends in the process. Date: Monday 26
August 2024, 7-9pm Location: The Glitch, 134 Lower Marsh, London, SE1
7AE (5 minutes walk from Waterloo underground station)Cost: £15. Booking
in advance is essential as we have limited space. Accessibility: The
venue is wheelchair accessible, with step-free access to toilets.Sappho
Events welcomes LGBTQIA+ women, trans and non-binary people to our
events

eventsByFilter.name: 56T trans & non-binary sexual health & wellbeing service
eventsByFilter.description:
56T has become a booked appointment service instead of walk-in. Appointments can be booked here: [https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/][1]. This service is for:  
·         Hormone injections (with proof of ID and prescription)

·         Hormone level monitoring and liver function testing

·         PrEP – Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         PEP – Post-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         Confidential sexual health screening and Hepatitis B & HPV
vaccinations

·         Cervical smear tests for anyone over 25 with a cervix – not
done as walk in, but pre-booked into Tuesday AM clinic

·         Sexual assault support

·         Domestic abuse support and IDVA – Independent Domestic
Violence Advocate

·         Health advisor support and signposting into other services for
issues around housing, counselling etc.



[1]: https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/

eventsByFilter.name: STAR Lounge
eventsByFilter.description:
STAR Lounge is a weekly space for those with experience of domestic
abuse and sexual violence. Come to spend time with us and talk with
people if you need, have some food and hot drinks, relax in the quiet
room or on our sofas. Once a month we have haircuts from Open Barbers
and massage therapy.

We’re proud to have created a safe, accessible and welcoming space for
survivor support at our LGBTIQ+ Centre all day on Thursdays.

DM us on Instagram or email Star.Lounge@lgbtiqoutside.org if you want to
join the STAR Lounge social group on Thursdays 10.30-4pm.

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Youth Art Collective

****QUEER YOUTH ART COLLECTIVE (QYAC)** **12pm – 4pm – ONLINE GROUP 2pm
– 3.30pm****

**[Queer Youth Art Collective][1] (QYAC) has run workshops at The
Outside Project for LGBTQ young people 18-26 since August 2019. The
project delivers newly commissioned workshops by LGBTQ artists and youth
forums for attendees to discuss their practice and socialise weekly on
Sundays.**

**Our primary aims are to challenge isolation, provide free and engaging
arts workshops and build skills and infrastructure for a resilient,
peer-led LGBTQ arts and education culture in London and throughout the
UK.**

**We currently run 2 groups: ONLINE on ZOOM & OFFLINE at The Outside
Project LGBTIQ+ Centre. **

****How to access: Email queeryouthartcollective@gmail.com**. **Travel
refund available. ****

eventsByFilter.description:

eventsByFilter.name: Online Speed Friending for Queer Women and Non-Binary People in UK
eventsByFilter.description:
Enjoy a relaxed online speed friending event for LGBTQ+ women, trans and
non-binary people via Zoom on Tuesday 3 September, 7-8pm.We know
sometimes you’re just looking to make some queer friends, so speed
friending is a very non-pressurised way to meet lovely new people.You
bring your own drink and chat. We will pair you up with approximately 10
fantastic LGBTQ ladies and non-binary folk. You’ll have around 5 minutes
with each pairing to spark up a good conversation. We’ll also help
kickstart the event with some friendly ice breakers. The next day, we
will match up those who both expressed interest so you can keep the
conversation going without us. We will just send you a little form to
fill out post-dates.The day before the event, we will send you a ZOOM
link so you can join in at the start time. We invite you to join us from
across the U.K. COST: £12
eventsByFilter.summary: Online Speed Friending for Queer Women and Non-Binary People in UK

eventsByFilter.name: In-person Speed Dating for Queer Women in London
eventsByFilter.description:
Enjoy a relaxed in-person speed dating event for LGBTQ+ women, trans and
non-binary people at Exhibit Balham in London on Wednesday 4 September
2024, 7-9pm.We have a big space for this event so it could be a
fantastic opportunity to meet 30 or more queers on the night.We will
help kickstart the event with some friendly ice breakers, so don’t fear
if it’s your first speed dating event, we will ease you in. Then we will
pair you up with some fantastic LGBTQ+ ladies and non-binary folk where
you’ll have around 5 minutes with each pairing to spark up a good
conversation. The next day, we will match up those who both expressed
interest so you can keep the conversation going without us. We will just
send you a little form to fill out post-dates.After the event you can
relax at the bar and keep the conversations flowing too without us.
Date: Wednesday 4 September 2024Time: 7-9pmLocation: The Garden Room,
EXHIBIT BALHAM - 12 BALHAM STATION ROAD, LONDON, SW12 9SGAccessibility:
The Garden Room is wheelchair accesibleCost: £20Sappho Events welcomes
LGBTQ+ women, trans and non-binary people to our events.

eventsByFilter.description:
Run by and at Herne Hill Velodrome in South East London. You must have completed a track induction before attending any track sessions: see [hernehillvelodrome.com][1] for details.  
  
A supportive and challenging environment in which riders of all abilities can develop their track craft through a mixture of skills, drills and workshops. £10 including bike hire.  
  
If you have completed a track training accreditation, you can join the intermediate session. Once you have done several skills sessions and feel confident that you understand the different techniques on the track you can do a training accreditation, and then join the intermediate session, which combines faster exercises, intervals to improve fitness, and introduces racing techniques.   
  
Please note that these sessions are not run by Velociposse. We recommend them because: track cycling is great for general bike handling skills (you\'re on a fixed gear bike), fitness (no stopping for traffic lights!) and confidence.  

[1]: http://hernehillvelodrome.com

eventsByFilter.name: Slow skills
eventsByFilter.description:
The original and most essential Velociposse session! Our weekly skills sessions are traffic-free, and designed to improve your bike handling, cornering and coordination. No point going fast without the control! They’re run by several club members who are level 1 or 2 British Cycling coaches. No pressure, lots of fun. Most bikes are suitable as long as they are roadworthy. Free for members, and perfect as a taster session if you\'re thinking about joining the club. We often head to the pub or a park afterward to hang out: a perfect midweek evening! Sessions take place either in Stratford or in Bermondsey. There are no toilet or changing facilities available. Check our [events page][1] if you wanna come along. 

[1]: https://www.riderhq.com/o/p/7odu8dgn/f/velociposse/enter

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Tarot Reading Workshop
eventsByFilter.description:
Come and discover the tarot deck from a queer perspective. Get to know
the basics and learn how to read intuitively in this fun introduction to
tarot. We’ll look at different ways of finding meaning in the deck and
how to create a spread, as well as how to use the cards for
self-reflection, creative inspiration, and unlocking our subconscious.No
experience necessary – suitable for those completely new to tarot and
feeling curious, and those looking to find fresh inspiration for their
readings.Facilitated by Sarah April Lamb.Date: Tuesday 10 September
2024, 7-8:30pm Location: The Glitch, 134 Lower Marsh, London, SE1 7AE (5
minutes walk from Waterloo underground station)Cost: £15 (please book in
advance as we have venue caps)Accessibility: The venue is wheelchair
accessible, with step-free access to toilets.Sappho Events welcomes
LGBTQIA+ women, trans and non-binary people to our events

eventsByFilter.name: 56T trans & non-binary sexual health & wellbeing service
eventsByFilter.description:
56T has become a booked appointment service instead of walk-in. Appointments can be booked here: [https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/][1]. This service is for:  
·         Hormone injections (with proof of ID and prescription)

·         Hormone level monitoring and liver function testing

·         PrEP – Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         PEP – Post-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         Confidential sexual health screening and Hepatitis B & HPV
vaccinations

·         Cervical smear tests for anyone over 25 with a cervix – not
done as walk in, but pre-booked into Tuesday AM clinic

·         Sexual assault support

·         Domestic abuse support and IDVA – Independent Domestic
Violence Advocate

·         Health advisor support and signposting into other services for
issues around housing, counselling etc.



[1]: https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/

eventsByFilter.name: STAR Lounge
eventsByFilter.description:
STAR Lounge is a weekly space for those with experience of domestic
abuse and sexual violence. Come to spend time with us and talk with
people if you need, have some food and hot drinks, relax in the quiet
room or on our sofas. Once a month we have haircuts from Open Barbers
and massage therapy.

We’re proud to have created a safe, accessible and welcoming space for
survivor support at our LGBTIQ+ Centre all day on Thursdays.

DM us on Instagram or email Star.Lounge@lgbtiqoutside.org if you want to
join the STAR Lounge social group on Thursdays 10.30-4pm.

Womens BMX session at Lee Valley Velopark. £10 including bike and helmet
hire. Beginner friendly.

Please note this session is not run by Velociposse and may be subject to

questions. Pre-booking required.

Why we recommend this session: it\'s where a lot of us had our first
taste of BMX, and now some of us are hooked. It\'s super beginner
friendly, a lovely community of welcoming women, and run by a superb and
knowledgeable coach, Nadine. You\'ll progress quickly, and have a hell
of a lot of fun.

eventsByFilter.name: Thursday Social Drinks In Soho
eventsByFilter.description:
Join me and your fellow trans lovelies for a relaxed meetup which takes
place on the second \*\*Thursday of the month in the Soho, central
London area.\*\*

This place has a great buzz. It\'s a sneaky way to start the weekend
early. Come and join us :)

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

We have a private area upstairs in the venue, which is plenty of space
for us all to chat, hear each other and relax.

Thursday is the new start of the weekend. Let\'s use this opportunity to
make some new friends and chat about whatever pleases you.  
This event will suit you if you are new to attending the meetup or are
one of our wonderful regulars. It is a popular evening with lots of
different people popping in. There is no need to be nervous. We are all
very friendly and welcoming. You\'ll feel right at home. :)

\*\*What is this meetup?\*\*  
This is a relaxed, friendly and inclusive meetup for the trans people of
London. This is an opportunity to make new friends and chat over a
sneaky Thursday drink.

\*\*Who is it for?\*\*  
Everyone from the trans community is welcome. This is an opportunity to
be yourself, whatever you identify as. We are inclusive and happy to
welcome you.

\*\*How does it work?\*\*  
All you have to do is RSVP and then we will message you on the day with
the event location. Then, all you have to do is show up.

We will make sure that you meet some new people and get a chance to get
to know your fellow trans buddies. This event is very friendly and will
welcome you and make sure you feel comfortable and happy.  
It is free to attend, just buy yourself a drink at the bar.

\*\*Please Note:\*\* RSVP is a must as the location (based around Soho)
will be sent by email on the day to those who have RSVP\'d only. RSVP
closes at 16.00 on the day of the event.

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

QUEER HOUSE PARTY TICKETS ON SALE NOW. coming back at you friday 13th of
September lineup tba xVENUE: We’ve found our new home at No.90 Hackney
Wick. It’s a huge warehouse space with multiple rooms - meaning we will
have a stacked lineup across two rooms with spaces to watch shows,
dance, and chill. EVERYONE IN: Queer House Party is for everyone - but
trans people to the front. We’ve done our best to keep ticket prices
down for everyone. Tickets are on a sliding scale from £7.50-20. If this
is still a barrier for you, please drop us a message, and we will add
you to our free list. ACCESS: No. 90 is a wheelchair-accessible venue.
Both our IRL and URL events will have British Sign Language and Audio
Description available during the shows -there is no hearing induction
loop installed in the venue. Free tickets are available for carers and
PAs. If you have any specific questions, drop us a line at
queerhouseparty@gmail.com.COVID: We ask that everyone tests before
attending to keep the party safer. If you can’t get hold of a test
before the event, t

eventsByFilter.name: Regent\'s Park Intro Laps
eventsByFilter.description:
A gentle, supportive and informative session for anyone who wants to ride with us in a casual, no expectations way. Suitable for any kind of roadworthy bike, we\'ll spend the first hour introducing some group riding techniques and doing a few laps of the inner circle of Regent\'s Park. Afterward we all head to the cafe for a chat and get to know each other a bit better.   
  
Open to all women, trans, and non-binary people of any ability and riding experience, no membership required. Sign up via our [RiderHQ events page][1].  
  
This is held monthly on the second Saturday of the month. It is facilitated by Velociposse members who volunteer their time to lead this ride. Occasionally we may have to cancel due to bad weather or volunteer availability so please check before attending! 

[1]: https://www.riderhq.com/o/p/7odu8dgn/f/velociposse/enter

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Youth Art Collective
eventsByFilter.description:
****QUEER YOUTH ART COLLECTIVE (QYAC)** **12pm – 4pm – ONLINE GROUP 2pm
– 3.30pm****

**[Queer Youth Art Collective][1] (QYAC) has run workshops at The
Outside Project for LGBTQ young people 18-26 since August 2019. The
project delivers newly commissioned workshops by LGBTQ artists and youth
forums for attendees to discuss their practice and socialise weekly on
Sundays.**

**Our primary aims are to challenge isolation, provide free and engaging
arts workshops and build skills and infrastructure for a resilient,
peer-led LGBTQ arts and education culture in London and throughout the
UK.**

**We currently run 2 groups: ONLINE on ZOOM & OFFLINE at The Outside
Project LGBTIQ+ Centre. **

****How to access: Email queeryouthartcollective@gmail.com**. **Travel
refund available. ****



[1]: https://qyac.org.uk/

forums for attendees to discuss their practice and socialise weekly on
Sundays.**

**Our primary aims are to challenge isolation, provide free and engaging
arts workshops and build skills and infrastructure for a resilient,
peer-led LGBTQ arts and education culture in London and throughout the
UK.**

**We currently run 2 groups: ONLINE on ZOOM & OFFLINE at The Outside
Project LGBTIQ+ Centre. **

****How to access: Email queeryouthartcollective@gmail.com**. **Travel
refund available. ****



[1]: https://qyac.org.uk/

eventsByFilter.name: LGBTQ+ Community Meditation
eventsByFilter.description:

eventsByFilter.name: HHV Women\'s Training
eventsByFilter.description:
Run by and at Herne Hill Velodrome in South East London. You must have completed a track induction before attending any track sessions: see [hernehillvelodrome.com][1] for details.  
  
A supportive and challenging environment in which riders of all abilities can develop their track craft through a mixture of skills, drills and workshops. £10 including bike hire.  
  
If you have completed a track training accreditation, you can join the intermediate session. Once you have done several skills sessions and feel confident that you understand the different techniques on the track you can do a training accreditation, and then join the intermediate session, which combines faster exercises, intervals to improve fitness, and introduces racing techniques.   
  
Please note that these sessions are not run by Velociposse. We recommend them because: track cycling is great for general bike handling skills (you\'re on a fixed gear bike), fitness (no stopping for traffic lights!) and confidence.  

[1]: http://hernehillvelodrome.com

eventsByFilter.name: Slow skills
eventsByFilter.description:
The original and most essential Velociposse session! Our weekly skills sessions are traffic-free, and designed to improve your bike handling, cornering and coordination. No point going fast without the control! They’re run by several club members who are level 1 or 2 British Cycling coaches. No pressure, lots of fun. Most bikes are suitable as long as they are roadworthy. Free for members, and perfect as a taster session if you\'re thinking about joining the club. We often head to the pub or a park afterward to hang out: a perfect midweek evening! Sessions take place either in Stratford or in Bermondsey. There are no toilet or changing facilities available. Check our [events page][1] if you wanna come along. 

[1]: https://www.riderhq.com/o/p/7odu8dgn/f/velociposse/enter

eventsByFilter.name: 56T trans & non-binary sexual health & wellbeing service
eventsByFilter.description:
56T has become a booked appointment service instead of walk-in. Appointments can be booked here: [https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/][1]. This service is for:  
·         Hormone injections (with proof of ID and prescription)

·         Hormone level monitoring and liver function testing

·         PrEP – Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         PEP – Post-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         Confidential sexual health screening and Hepatitis B & HPV
vaccinations

·         Cervical smear tests for anyone over 25 with a cervix – not
done as walk in, but pre-booked into Tuesday AM clinic

·         Sexual assault support

·         Domestic abuse support and IDVA – Independent Domestic
Violence Advocate

·         Health advisor support and signposting into other services for
issues around housing, counselling etc.



[1]: https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/

eventsByFilter.description:
STAR Lounge is a weekly space for those with experience of domestic
abuse and sexual violence. Come to spend time with us and talk with
people if you need, have some food and hot drinks, relax in the quiet
room or on our sofas. Once a month we have haircuts from Open Barbers
and massage therapy.

We’re proud to have created a safe, accessible and welcoming space for
survivor support at our LGBTIQ+ Centre all day on Thursdays.

DM us on Instagram or email Star.Lounge@lgbtiqoutside.org if you want to
join the STAR Lounge social group on Thursdays 10.30-4pm.

eventsByFilter.name: Richmond Park Intro Laps
eventsByFilter.description:
A gentle, supportive and informative session for anyone who wants to ride with us in a casual, no expectations way. Suitable for any kind of roadworthy bike, we\'ll spend the first hour introducing some group riding techniques and doing a lap or two of Richmond Park. Afterward we all head to the cafe for a chat and get to know each other a bit better.   
  
Open to all women, trans, and non-binary people of any ability and riding experience, no membership required. Sign up via our [RiderHQ events page][1].  
  
This is held monthly on the fourth Saturday of the month. It is facilitated by Velociposse members who volunteer their time to lead this ride. Occasionally we may have to cancel due to bad weather or volunteer availability so please check before attending! 

[1]: https://www.riderhq.com/o/p/7odu8dgn/f/velociposse/enter

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Board Game Group
eventsByFilter.description:
Are you queer and do you love playing board games? Sappho runs a monthly
social event for playing board games, open to LGBTQIA+ women, trans and
non-binary people. We have multiple tables set up with games, ranging
from quick and easy games to learn for newbies, to medium-length
strategy board games. If you've got a game you'd love to bring and teach
others to play, please bring it too, as we will have some spare tables
for wildcard games on the night. This will be a really friendly
environment where we can enjoy playing games with other queers who love
games as much as us. Learn something new, or put a new strategy to the
test, and make some new queer friends in the process. Date: Monday 30
September 2024, 7-9pm Location: The Glitch, 134 Lower Marsh, London, SE1
7AE (5 minutes walk from Waterloo underground station)Cost: £15. Booking
in advance is essential as we have limited space. Accessibility: The
venue is wheelchair accessible, with step-free access to toilets.Sappho
Events welcomes LGBTQIA+ women, trans and non-binary people to our
events

from [https://www.hejcoffee.co.uk/product/cafe-queero/][2] **

eventsByFilter.name: 56T trans & non-binary sexual health & wellbeing service
eventsByFilter.description:
56T has become a booked appointment service instead of walk-in. Appointments can be booked here: [https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/][1]. This service is for:  
·         Hormone injections (with proof of ID and prescription)

·         Hormone level monitoring and liver function testing

·         PrEP – Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         PEP – Post-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         Confidential sexual health screening and Hepatitis B & HPV
vaccinations

·         Cervical smear tests for anyone over 25 with a cervix – not
done as walk in, but pre-booked into Tuesday AM clinic

·         Sexual assault support

·         Domestic abuse support and IDVA – Independent Domestic
Violence Advocate

·         Health advisor support and signposting into other services for
issues around housing, counselling etc.



[1]: https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/

eventsByFilter.name: Thursday Social Drinks In Soho
eventsByFilter.description:
Join me and your fellow trans lovelies for a relaxed meetup which takes
place on the second \*\*Thursday of the month in the Soho, central
London area.\*\*

This place has a great buzz. It\'s a sneaky way to start the weekend
early. Come and join us :)

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

We have a private area upstairs in the venue, which is plenty of space
for us all to chat, hear each other and relax.

Thursday is the new start of the weekend. Let\'s use this opportunity to
make some new friends and chat about whatever pleases you.  
This event will suit you if you are new to attending the meetup or are
one of our wonderful regulars. It is a popular evening with lots of
different people popping in. There is no need to be nervous. We are all
very friendly and welcoming. You\'ll feel right at home. :)

\*\*What is this meetup?\*\*  
This is a relaxed, friendly and inclusive meetup for the trans people of
London. This is an opportunity to make new friends and chat over a
sneaky Thursday drink.

\*\*Who is it for?\*\*  
Everyone from the trans community is welcome. This is an opportunity to
be yourself, whatever you identify as. We are inclusive and happy to
welcome you.

\*\*How does it work?\*\*  
All you have to do is RSVP and then we will message you on the day with
the event location. Then, all you have to do is show up.

We will make sure that you meet some new people and get a chance to get
to know your fellow trans buddies. This event is very friendly and will
welcome you and make sure you feel comfortable and happy.  
It is free to attend, just buy yourself a drink at the bar.

\*\*Please Note:\*\* RSVP is a must as the location (based around Soho)
will be sent by email on the day to those who have RSVP\'d only. RSVP
closes at 16.00 on the day of the event.

\*\*RSVP NOW\*\*

eventsByFilter.name: Regent\'s Park Intro Laps
eventsByFilter.description:
A gentle, supportive and informative session for anyone who wants to ride with us in a casual, no expectations way. Suitable for any kind of roadworthy bike, we\'ll spend the first hour introducing some group riding techniques and doing a few laps of the inner circle of Regent\'s Park. Afterward we all head to the cafe for a chat and get to know each other a bit better.   
  
Open to all women, trans, and non-binary people of any ability and riding experience, no membership required. Sign up via our [RiderHQ events page][1].  
  
This is held monthly on the second Saturday of the month. It is facilitated by Velociposse members who volunteer their time to lead this ride. Occasionally we may have to cancel due to bad weather or volunteer availability so please check before attending! 

[1]: https://www.riderhq.com/o/p/7odu8dgn/f/velociposse/enter

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Youth Art Collective
eventsByFilter.description:
****QUEER YOUTH ART COLLECTIVE (QYAC)** **12pm – 4pm – ONLINE GROUP 2pm
– 3.30pm****

**[Queer Youth Art Collective][1] (QYAC) has run workshops at The
Outside Project for LGBTQ young people 18-26 since August 2019. The
project delivers newly commissioned workshops by LGBTQ artists and youth
forums for attendees to discuss their practice and socialise weekly on
Sundays.**

**Our primary aims are to challenge isolation, provide free and engaging
arts workshops and build skills and infrastructure for a resilient,
peer-led LGBTQ arts and education culture in London and throughout the
UK.**

**We currently run 2 groups: ONLINE on ZOOM & OFFLINE at The Outside
Project LGBTIQ+ Centre. **

****How to access: Email queeryouthartcollective@gmail.com**. **Travel
refund available. ****



[1]: https://qyac.org.uk/

eventsByFilter.name: HHV Women\'s Training
eventsByFilter.description:
Run by and at Herne Hill Velodrome in South East London. You must have completed a track induction before attending any track sessions: see [hernehillvelodrome.com][1] for details.  
  
A supportive and challenging environment in which riders of all abilities can develop their track craft through a mixture of skills, drills and workshops. £10 including bike hire.  
  
If you have completed a track training accreditation, you can join the intermediate session. Once you have done several skills sessions and feel confident that you understand the different techniques on the track you can do a training accreditation, and then join the intermediate session, which combines faster exercises, intervals to improve fitness, and introduces racing techniques.   
  
Please note that these sessions are not run by Velociposse. We recommend them because: track cycling is great for general bike handling skills (you\'re on a fixed gear bike), fitness (no stopping for traffic lights!) and confidence.  

[1]: http://hernehillvelodrome.com

eventsByFilter.name: Queer Youth Art Collective
eventsByFilter.description:
****QUEER YOUTH ART COLLECTIVE (QYAC)** **12pm – 4pm – ONLINE GROUP 2pm
– 3.30pm****

**[Queer Youth Art Collective][1] (QYAC) has run workshops at The
Outside Project for LGBTQ young people 18-26 since August 2019. The
project delivers newly commissioned workshops by LGBTQ artists and youth
forums for attendees to discuss their practice and socialise weekly on
Sundays.**

**Our primary aims are to challenge isolation, provide free and engaging
arts workshops and build skills and infrastructure for a resilient,
peer-led LGBTQ arts and education culture in London and throughout the
UK.**

**We currently run 2 groups: ONLINE on ZOOM & OFFLINE at The Outside
Project LGBTIQ+ Centre. **

****How to access: Email queeryouthartcollective@gmail.com**. **Travel
refund available. ****



[1]: https://qyac.org.uk/

eventsByFilter.name: HHV Women\'s Training
eventsByFilter.description:
Run by and at Herne Hill Velodrome in South East London. You must have completed a track induction before attending any track sessions: see [hernehillvelodrome.com][1] for details.  
  
A supportive and challenging environment in which riders of all abilities can develop their track craft through a mixture of skills, drills and workshops. £10 including bike hire.  
  
If you have completed a track training accreditation, you can join the intermediate session. Once you have done several skills sessions and feel confident that you understand the different techniques on the track you can do a training accreditation, and then join the intermediate session, which combines faster exercises, intervals to improve fitness, and introduces racing techniques.   
  
Please note that these sessions are not run by Velociposse. We recommend them because: track cycling is great for general bike handling skills (you\'re on a fixed gear bike), fitness (no stopping for traffic lights!) and confidence.  

[1]: http://hernehillvelodrome.com

eventsByFilter.name: 56T trans & non-binary sexual health & wellbeing service
eventsByFilter.description:
56T has become a booked appointment service instead of walk-in. Appointments can be booked here: [https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/][1]. This service is for:  
·         Hormone injections (with proof of ID and prescription)

·         Hormone level monitoring and liver function testing

·         PrEP – Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         PEP – Post-Exposure Prophylaxis

·         Confidential sexual health screening and Hepatitis B & HPV
vaccinations

·         Cervical smear tests for anyone over 25 with a cervix – not
done as walk in, but pre-booked into Tuesday AM clinic

·         Sexual assault support

·         Domestic abuse support and IDVA – Independent Domestic
Violence Advocate

·         Health advisor support and signposting into other services for
issues around housing, counselling etc.



[1]: https://www.dean.st/trans-non-binary/
eventsByFilter.summary: 56T trans & non-binary sexual health & wellbeing service

eventsByFilter.description:

£23 for the session, bike hire at an additional cost.  
  
Please note that these sessions are not run by Velociposse. We recommend them because: track cycling is great for general bike handling skills (you\'re on a fixed gear bike), fitness (no stopping for traffic lights!) and confidence.

eventsByFilter.name: STAR Lounge
eventsByFilter.description:
STAR Lounge is a weekly space for those with experience of domestic
abuse and sexual violence. Come to spend time with us and talk with
people if you need, have some food and hot drinks, relax in the quiet
room or on our sofas. Once a month we have haircuts from Open Barbers
and massage therapy.

We’re proud to have created a safe, accessible and welcoming space for
survivor support at our LGBTIQ+ Centre all day on Thursdays.

DM us on Instagram or email Star.Lounge@lgbtiqoutside.org if you want to
join the STAR Lounge social group on Thursdays 10.30-4pm.

eventsByFilter.name: Gravel Club
eventsByFilter.description:
Ad-hoc ride arranged by members taking in the trails of Epping Forest. Decent confidence needed: come to our slow skills sessions first if you\'re not sure.  
  
Usually: 7pm meeting in East London. Gravel or offroad bikes. 2-3 hour ride: good quality front light essential as this ride ends after nightfall and the trails are unlit. May pause over winter in bad/cold weather, but will run as often as we can!  
  
Arranged via Discord.  
  
Contact us if you\'re interested and not already in the club! [https://forms.gle/2Fk9VvqHg8HbEehMA][1]

eventsByFilter.name: HHV Women\'s Training
eventsByFilter.description:
Run by and at Herne Hill Velodrome in South East London. You must have completed a track induction before attending any track sessions: see [hernehillvelodrome.com][1] for details.  
  
A supportive and challenging environment in which riders of all abilities can develop their track craft through a mixture of skills, drills and workshops. £10 including bike hire.  
  
If you have completed a track training accreditation, you can join the intermediate session. Once you have done several skills sessions and feel confident that you understand the different techniques on the track you can do a training accreditation, and then join the intermediate session, which combines faster exercises, intervals to improve fitness, and introduces racing techniques.   
  
Please note that these sessions are not run by Velociposse. We recommend them because: track cycling is great for general bike handling skills (you\'re on a fixed gear bike), fitness (no stopping for traffic lights!) and confidence.  

[1]: http://hernehillvelodrome.com

vaccinations

done as walk in, but pre-booked into Tuesday AM clinic

·         Sexual assault support

·         Domestic abuse support and IDVA – Independent Domestic
Violence Advocate

·         Health advisor support and signposting into other services for
issues around housing, counselling etc.

hire. Beginner friendly.

Please note this session is not run by Velociposse and may be subject to

Why we recommend this session: it\'s where a lot of us had our first

of a lot of fun.
